About the role
Perioperative Services are currently seeking multiple opportunities for qualified Perfusionist to join their team on a permanent basis.

The Perioperative Services department at Mater Private Hospital Townsville (MPHT) provides surgical services across 16 theatres, and caters for adults and paediatrics with a variety of surgical specialities. Over the course of 2021, we will be increasing our operational capacity to include an additional 4 theatres. MPHT boasts brand new state of the art theatre facilities, a catheterization laboratory, separate onsite day site surgery facilities as well as newly implemented robotic surgery involving the da Vinci Surgical System.

What you’ll be doing
As a Perfusionist you will be responsible for the provision of perfusion and related services and conducting and reporting on respiratory function tests for both inpatients and outpatients.

Each Perfusionist is responsibility for a case load with opportunity for flexible rostering arrangements.

This role would work within a diverse team of surgical, nursing, anaesthetic and medical perfusion personnel, where approximately 200 open heart cases occur per year. This would also include cell salvage service both to cardiac and non-cardiac surgical patients (orthopaedic, general, urology and complex obstetric surgery); and potential for research and involvement in data collection for auditing and quality assurance.

About you
To be successful in this role you will possess:
Bachelor of Science (or equivalent).
Completed training in Clinical Perfusion.
Membership of the Australian Society of Cardiovascular Perfusion.
Well-developed communication skills (including demonstrated report writing ability).
Problem solving skills of a high order.
Proven ability to function as a member of a multi-disciplinary team.
Knowledge of Australian Council on Healthcare Standards (ACHS) accreditation requirements would be desirable.

Why join us?
In return for your skills, compassion, integrity and enthusiastic commitment, you will have the opportunity to work for an Australian leader in the field of Health, Education and Research. Working together as part of a larger team, you will help support Mater to improve the health of the community, empowering people to live better lives through improved health and wellbeing.

In addition to being part of a workplace that offers compassionate care in the Spirit of the Sisters of Mercy, you will have opportunities to increase your take home pay with our salary packaging options, support towards ongoing professional development, access to fitness passport, and many other benefits not offered in other workplaces.

As a not-for-profit organisation, employees are able to salary sacrifice their wage. This allows our employees to secure a tax-free income up to $15,900. In addition, employees are eligible for meal and entertainment expenses of up to $2,650.

To be eligible for employment in this role you must be one of the following:
An Australian Citizen
A permanent resident of Australia
A New Zealand citizen with a current New Zealand Passport
A citizen of another country with an appropriate visa that allows you to work in Australia

For more information, please contact Leo Canapi, Perioperative Services Manager, on 07 4727 4183.

Closing date for applications is Monday, 30 August 2022.

It is a requirement of this role that you are and remain fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Please note proof of vaccination (MyGov Medicare Vaccination Certificate or Medical Certificate) will be required as a pre commencement requirement.

Please note we will be reviewing and contacting applicants prior to closing date so please ensure you submit your application as soon as possible.

Forensic & Integrity Services | Senior Consultant

The opportunity

Successful organisations depend on their reputation for keeping promises, respecting laws and behaving ethically to maintain stakeholder trust. EY Forensic & Integrity Services professionals help organisations protect and restore enterprise and financial reputation. We assist organisations to investigate facts, resolve disputes and manage regulatory challenges. We put integrity at the heart of compliance programs to help better manage ethical and reputational risks.

We understand how organisations navigate complex environments; how pressures, attitudes and culture influence employee actions. We are committed to making integrity the cornerstone of a better working world.

As a Senior Consultant in the Forensic Data Analytics team, you will work across all areas of Forensics including anti-money laundering, corruption, fraud and other investigations, commercial disputes, business integrity assignments, transaction disputes, fraud prevention and compliance programme development. You’ll build relationships with internal peers across the practice.

Using market leading advanced data analytic tools, we look beyond the obvious to delve deeper into the underlying patterns and trends. FDA team members typically apply their specialist skills to large or complex datasets coming from disparate data sources. Our team generates insights to support fraud investigations, disputes, and regulatory compliance challenges for our clients, across a range of industries. This is achieved by combining forensic investigation skills with advanced data analytics techniques. This might include historical scenario reconstruction, investigative data analysis, social network analytics, natural language processing, development of machine learning algorithms and predictive modelling.

Forensic Data Analytics is one of the core growth areas in a fast-growing Forensics practice. EY’s motto of “building a better working world” by “asking better questions and finding better answers” is embodied in the work we do. Our clients look to us to deliver powerful business insights and to assist with addressing their most sensitive challenges. You’ll develop a deep understanding of the inner workings of business and draw on your data analytics skills to help solve challenges.

Your key responsibilities

Senior Consultants in our Forensics team will:
Be passionate about data analytics and the opportunities it provides to organisations, and be able to communicate technical information in non-technical language
Work with the broader Forensics team (including forensic accountants and incident response professionals) to assist Australian and global companies in addressing their fraud and compliance challenges
Consult with stakeholders; develop forensic procedures and define measurable data metrics, and design investigative analysis
Extract, validate, transform and load data from multiple data sources for deeper analysis
Undertake extensive analytical reviews of client data to produce insights that will assist our clients with:
detection of irregular financial transactions
identification of anomalous employee behaviour
targeting of error and waste in their operations
Support senior team members in the preparation and presentation of client deliverables in a clear, structured manner
Provide innovative thinking for strategic initiatives, new offerings and programs, and display a desire to contribute to the growth of the team
Work in multi-disciplinary teams across a range of industries helping our clients, using our analytics to transform and improve their business
Display critical thinking skills with strong attention to detail
In addition, you will also support the development and integration of our global Forensic Data Analytics platform, EY Virtual, into all of our Forensics Service offerings. You will have the opportunity to work with Forensics team members from various geographies to expand our capabilities in Oceania. You will have the chance to work directly with Forensic Data Analytics professionals who have successfully delivered FDA services via the platform to address our clients’ needs, and will act as a local “champion” supporting the broader Oceania Forensics practice in their knowledge and use of EY Virtual.
Skills and attributes for success
Academic or professional experience in a relevant technical field (Computer Science, Business Analytics, Information Systems, Finance, Statistics, Economics, Commerce, Mathematics, Linguistics)
Experience with statistical analysis and modelling tools such as SAS, Alteryx, SPSS, Python, R or similar packages, and data manipulation languages such as SQL
Familiarity with data visualization software such as Tableau, Power BI, Qlikview or Spotfire
A demonstrated understanding of commercial relational database systems and enterprise software solutions (Oracle, SAP, JD Edwards, PeopleSoft, Chris21, etc)
A working knowledge of financial processes other business processes (e.g., regulatory reporting)
Ablility to hypothesise, analyse and draw conclusions from financial and operational data and perform in-depth root-cause-analysis
A demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present data, conclusions, and recommendations in a manner that is easily understandable by a variety of audiences
Highly professional with ability to work in challenging, diverse and evolving client environments
Ability to think critically beyond task execution
Skills in presenting and communicating analytical outcomes (MS Word, Powerpoint, Excel)

What working at EY offers

We offer a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your performance. In addition, our comprehensive Total Rewards package can be tailored to your individual needs, to give you the freedom to manage your role in a way that’s right for you. This includes;
a variety of flexible working and leave arrangements
personalised career development including coaching and support to help you build your career and access to formal learning so you can develop the skills you’ll need to thrive in the future
a range of tools and benefits to guide and support your health and wellbeing throughout your entire EY career.

About EY

At EY, we hold a collective commitment to foster an environment where all differences are valued and respected, practices are equitable and everyone experiences a sense of belonging. Through our inclusive leadership behaviours, a variety of internal networks, flexible working and mentoring programs, you will have the support and flexibility to build an exceptional career.

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third party provider. Regarding this role, the minimum salary is $78,000 including 10% superannuation

About the team

Big data, information and analytics. Three words that spark apprehension in most businesses. But our team of experts are constantly curious and excited about combining our wonderful array of technological expertise to transform data into our clients’ most valuable assets, making their work smarter.

We primarily seek to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of organisations at all stages of the data transformation journey from designing the change required, to delivering and managing that change and providing assurance around change initiatives.

You will be an integral part of one of the fastest growing teams in Australia and build best in class data & AI solutions.

This role is for the AI & Automation team, which sits within the Data & AI, Strategy Analytics & Transformation in Deloitte Consulting.

What will your typical day look like?

As a Senior Consultant in our Data & AI team, focussing on Analytics & AI strategy, you will use your consulting skills to help clients make the right choices and take the right actions towards better use of Analytics and AI to achieve their business goals. As technical, strategy and industry experts, we understand clients’ challenges and define compelling strategies to meet their vision for becoming insight driven. A Senior Consultant will develop compelling interactions and presentations to showcases strategies, operating models and transformational business cases to clients across a range of industries, including Financial Services, Insurance, Government, Energy & Resources, Life Sciences & Healthcare, Telecommunications and Consumer Products.

Provide advisory services to business leaders and align AI, analytics, automation or data solutions to clients’ needs and develop an objectives, strategies and approaches that help clients transform
Build solid foundations of a business case and key recommendations for implementing analytical solutions for the client in alignment with their business agenda and strategic drivers
Analyse and evaluate current systems and structures of organisations where required, advising on business restructures, appropriate methods for collecting and analysing data and developing informed recommendations that shape or support the client’s business strategy
Comprehend and learn about client’s current business state, competitors’ point(s) of differentiation, industry landscape to support the identification, evaluation and selection of solutions that most effectively support clients’ strategic and business objectives
Conduct gap analysis on client’s current business landscape (i.e. operating model, business processes) to identify and define key recommendations and opportunities to uplift business performance
Design and assist with implementation plans for approved recommendations. Managing the delivery and provisioning of
Apply knowledge of best practices and latest yet effective trends to design a strategic and business transformation plan that delivers on client’s strategic growth agenda and gain client’s buy-in to the transformation plan
Assist with implementing approved recommendations in transformation plan, including provision of procedure and supporting documentation
Plan and carry out assigned business analysis activities within engagement timeframes and budget, to ensure implemented solutions meet business requirements and enhance efficiencies

Enough about us, let’s talk about you.

You are someone with:
Experience developing business unit or organizational level data or technology strategy within a consulting or industry environment

Ability to interpret analysis and modelling results in a business context and provide commercially foucssed recommendations to inform business decisions
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, capable of working effectively with people at all levels in an organization
Strong sense of ownership of outcomes with the drive to self-start and take initiative
A passion for working collaboratively with diverse teams, and to create an including environment for everyone
Ability to structure and facilitate client stakeholder interviews

Evaluate outcomes and prepare project reports for departmental and funding body publications

Edge Stackers is a privately owned investment, trading and technology company.

99.9% Need Not Apply

We need an ambitious, competitive data engineer with a passion for technology, data wrangling and DevOps to join this expansion.
The successful candidate will relish the challenge of attacking projects few can successfully complete, working as part of an experienced, best in class, close-knit team based on the Sunshine Coast.
Our standards are to out-think and out-work the rest. Your challenge will be to uncover innovative solutions that enable our team to capitalise on opportunities ahead of our competitors.

Company Description
-Be a part of groundbreaking Underground Mining practices and technology, opportunity to conduct and deliver industry leading Studies in the Geological Science.
Anglo American Steelmaking Coal
Steelmaking coal is an essential ingredient in blast-furnace steel manufacture, producing steel used for critical building and infrastructure around the world. In Australia, we operate five steelmaking coal mines in Queensland’s Bowen Basin, and have additional joint venture interests in steelmaking coal and manganese, as well as copper exploration projects underway in North West Queensland and Western Australia.

Job Description
-The Aquila project is an underground hard coking coal mine, which will extend the life of Anglo American’s existing Capcoal underground operations by six years, to 2028. As the largest underground coal miner in Australia, we are leveraging the innovative work already under way at our existing mine sites and scaling the development of new technologies in our operations. The Aquila project is a further demonstration of our commitment to the Australian metallurgical coal business, and the Central Queensland communities where we operate
Reporting to the Technical Services Superintendent, you will provide geological support to the operation to ensure safe and efficient production.
With a zero-harm attitude, you will contribute to developing geological hazard plans while maintaining the geological, geotechnical, borehole, coal quality, gas desorption and hydrogeological databases.
Being an expert in the field, you will plan for exploration, gas compliance drilling, sampling, and other geological related studies.
Your time management skills will allow you to issue permit to mine and associated documentation (including grade plans, fault plans, borehole intersection notices, contour plans and geological hazard plans) in a timely manner.
Taking part in regular underground mapping, you will audit and report to management operations on geological issues, and on occasion assist with initiating and executing mine plan change and authority to mine processes.

Qualifications
-Tertiary qualifications in Geological Sciences or equivalent
At least one year experience in operational mining (either open cut or underground)
Spatial design skills and awareness
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills
Strong analysis, problem solving and attention to detail

Additional Information
-Full-time, permanent position
7/7 roster
FIFO from Brisbane (company-funded)
Relocation assistance and subsidised accommodation
What we Offer
When you join Anglo American, you can expect to enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package. But more than this, you’ll find yourself in an environment where the opportunities for learning and growth are second to none. From technical training to leadership programmes, we bring out the best in our people. There are plenty of opportunities to move onwards and upwards too. We’re a large, successful multinational company – and we’re still growing all the time.
Who we are
We aim to lead the industry by pursuing ever safer and more responsible ways of working, demonstrating integrity, and showing care and respect for people and the planet. That means we are constantly seeking new opportunities to mine and process our products sustainably, using less water, less energy and more precise extraction technologies. As the custodians of coal and other precious natural resources – diamonds (through De Beers), copper, platinum and other precious metals, iron ore and nickel – our extraordinary teams work safely and collaboratively, with the utmost consideration for local communities, our customers and the world at large.

Background checks
Successful candidates will be required to complete background screening which may include a criminal check and validation of qualifications.

Inclusion and Diversity
At Anglo American, we embrace change and promote an inclusive and diverse environment where you can bring your whole self to work, every day. We are adopting new approaches to recruitment, talent development, mentoring, parental leave, and flexible working to further support diversity across our business.

How we are committed to your safety
Nothing is more important to us than ensuring you return home safely after a day’s work. To make that happen, we have the most rigorous safety standards in the industry. Not only that, we’re also continually investing in new technologies – from drones to data analytics – that are helping to make mining safer.
Employee referral
Do you know someone who would fit this role? Employee referrals will be accepted for this job. Refer to your local Referral Guidelines for policy conditions and amounts.
How to apply
To apply for this role, please complete our online application form. You will have the opportunity to upload your CV and other relevant documentation as part of this process.

We have an exciting full-time permanent (Monday to Friday 0800-1600) opportunity based at our centre located in Auchenflower. You will join our collaborative and expanding research team as a Clinical Research Assistant and be responsible for supporting research activities at the site located within the Wesley Medical Centre.

This is an amazing opportunity to be involved in a change to our research team at a site level and complement a growing trials portfolio in some of our busiest trial centres. You will report to the site-based research coordinator team leader and they will provide you with the support to coordinate and conduct the day to day management of administrative tasks associated with clinical trials.




We are seeking passionate individuals who are eager to join our team. You will have the ability to manage your workload and build professional relationships with various healthcare professionals at your assigned clinic. You will also be able to independently solve problems and have great team skills.
Having a vision and a passion to support our clinical trials portfolio and inspire more Icon staff to be involved in clinical research is key to succeeding.




If you meet the above criteria you and have an interest in starting your career with us, please directly apply now and attach your resume and cover letter to your application.

Icon Group celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive workplace for all employees. We encourage applications from all diverse backgrounds.


In submitting your application, you understand and acknowledge that a state government public health order, direction and/or regulation may be applicable to the workplace and/or role that you are applying for (“COVID Health Requirement”). You acknowledge and agree to comply with any applicable COVID Health Requirement including, but not limited to, providing us with information regarding your COVID vaccination status upon our reasonable request.

Consultant – Soil Science
SLR’s One Team Culture and Commitment

At SLR Consulting, we celebrate a ‘One Team Culture’, where bringing together diversity of thought and expression is key to building the best team to deliver excellent results. We strive to create an inclusive workplace where we value different experiences and look to create a culture where everyone belongs. The SLR culture is underpinned by our 5Bs which, in short is to Be safe, Belong, Be trusted, Be yourself and Be Successful.

We know it can be difficult and frustrating applying for roles, wondering if the role is right for you and if your experience is right for SLR. Many people won’t apply for roles unless they feel they tick every box on the checklist. At SLR we look for many different skills and technical competencies and we’re always looking for how new team members can add value to the business and to our culture. If you think this role isn’t quite for you, but you have a desire to work with us, – then we’d still love to hear from you!

SLR Consulting is an international environmental consultancy with a globally recognised reputation for providing high quality tailored services. With offices throughout the Asia Pacific, Europe, North, Central and South America and Africa regions, we are one of a very small number of leading international specialist environmental consultancies. We have committed to being a Climate Neutral Business by 2030 and have a long-term commitment to align with global net zero ambitions.


Key Responsibilities
About the role and what you need to succeed
SLR’s Soil Science team has a proven successful mix of practical industry experience, environmental impact assessment capability, project management skills, and regulatory knowledge. This includes providing valuable baseline information to better assess options for site management. Our focus on waste soil assessment and characterisation, and geochemistry integration into rehabilitation plans, creates a successful holistic view on the approach to land and soil management for clients.

As a member of our Soil Science team, you will have a minimum of three (3) years’ experience working on Soil Science related projects such as agronomical assessments, pasture science, land resource management and assessment, agricultural impact assessment, and soil erosivity assessments.
Reporting to the Technical Discipline Manager, you will be involved in delivering projects in the Soil Science team and be responsible for:
Organising and undertaking field investigations, including contractor supervision and training of junior staff. Field investigations will be undertaken at various sites primarily across Queensland with the opportunity for interstate project work to arise in the future.
Collation, assessment, and interpretation of data obtained from field investigations (undertaken by yourself and others) to meet the needs of our clients and provide innovative solutions to their problems.
Compilation of high-quality technical reports that meet not only the expectations of our clients, but the expectations and requirements of the administering authority.
Developing, facilitating, and enhancing relationships between our internal and external clients and SLR team members
Providing advice and assistance to internal and external clients, team members and Project Managers on projects regarding best principles and practices

To be successful in this role
You will be highly organised with excellent attention to detail and love getting things done to a very high standard. You are self-driven and comfortable with processes, whilst still being an excellent people person with a high level of client service. Ideally you would possess the following:
Appropriate Engineering, Science or other relevant tertiary qualification and demonstrated Soil Science industry experience
An understanding of the Australian Soil Classification
Excellent communication skills and technical report writing
Demonstrated experience managing a range of small to large multidisciplinary projects (preferable)
Excellent interpersonal skills, self-motivated and ability to work effectively within a team and independently
Ability and willingness to undertake fieldwork within Queensland and interstate

Our benefits at SLR include

Our culture is unique where we work together to collaborate on projects to get the best possible outcome for our clients. Whether you’re working in the office, from home or a mix of the two, we recognise that every person is different, and our benefits aim to ensure that we cater for all, including:
Hybrid work model (in-office & from home) - you choose where you work best.
Extra paid purchased leave up to 10 days so you can re-energize, help others, support family, or focus on your own professional development.
Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents throughout their parenting journey which includes 12 weeks primary carer and 4 weeks secondary carer leave.
Learning and development which includes a mapped career progression path, study assistance and up to 3 professional memberships subsidised by SLR.
Employee Assistance Program to support your physical, mental, and social wellbeing.
Global and regional mobility and recruitment referral bonus for both region and global candidates.
Other benefits include regular office social events, service anniversary awards, salary sacrificing (novated car lease) and a corporate uniform shop where you get $80 annually to spend.

We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion. Please note that interviews are conducted with gender diverse interview panels to the best of our ability. Description:
Work on cutting edge Analytics & AI technologies in real world environments
Work with clients in Australia and APAC to transform their Analytics & AI capabilities
World-class learning, development and leadership programs throughout your career

Do you want to work on the front-line of Analytics & AI? If you love working in diverse teams to solve complex business problems using Analytics & AI, we need you!

About the team

Our diverse Data & AI team comprises over 500 practitioners across Australia, each of whom are constantly curious and excited about combining their business acumen and technological expertise to create data-centric solutions that help solve complex problems and transform or reinvent our client’s business.

Our Data & AI team work with public and private sector clients helping them to design and implement world leading solutions and capabilities. From solving air and ground transport network issues through our industry-first Optimal Reality digital twin solution, bringing automation capabilities to vaccine rollout programs, to helping our clients move to a sustainable world, we are the partner of choice for our clients and our alliance vendors.

Our relationships with market leading vendors such as AWS, Microsoft, Google, Apple, Snowflake, Salesforce, and Informatica enable our practitioners to be at the forefront of new and emerging capabilities and to deliver our suite of services at scale. We are consistently recognised as leaders in Cloud, Data, Analytics and AI, including in the latest analyst reports.

About the job

As a Consultant or Senior Consultant in our Data & AI team, focussing on Analytics & AI, you will use your skills to work with clients to deeply understand their business challenges and build next generation, cloud-based solutions using leading data and analytics tools. With guidance from leading technical experts, you will further develop your skills across machine learning and AI solution design, build and deployment.

You will be challenged to work on real problems that span across a range of industries, including Financial Services, Insurance, Government, Energy & Resources, Life Sciences & Healthcare, Telecommunications and Consumer Products. You will draw upon a variety of analytics techniques (e.g. data engineering, machine learning), programming languages (e.g. R, Python, SQL) and real-world delivery experience to meet these challenges head-on. You will continuously be supported by senior leaders across the practice on projects and throughout your career growth at Deloitte. Your career coach will work with you to create a tailored plan that aligns your ambitions with our practice and client needs, including providing you access to leading training and certification programs and development opportunities.

Our team of Data & AI practitioners come from a diverse range of backgrounds, with everyone playing a different role in the team based on their unique skillsets.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you.

As a Consultant or Senior Consultant focused on technical solution delivery, you are someone with:

At least 2 years’ experience in data engineering, feature engineering and/or model development using statistical and machine learning techniques
Excellent knowledge of statistical techniques like Linear and Non-linear Regression, Generalized Models, Clustering, Forecasting methods, etc.
Demonstrable experience of one or more relevant programming languages (e.g. Python, R, SQL)
Experience with cloud services (Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure or Google Cloud Platform)
Ability to interpret analysis and modelling results in a business context and provide commercially focussed recommendations that support our clients’ business decisions
Experience working in an industry environment or managing non-technical stakeholders
Bachelor or Masters degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science or similar disciplines.
Experience in simulation, front-end development and/or web development is desirable, but not essential.

As a Consultant or Senior Consultant, you will need a range of technical and consulting skills from interviewing client stakeholders, capturing business problem statements, contributing to client workshops, designing, building and implementing advanced analytics solutions, and presenting results to your clients. As you grow, you will take up more senior level responsibilities in shaping and running projects.

Why Deloitte?

At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we’re leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive.

We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress – check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space.

TERN
HEW 7
Fixed-term position up to June 2023 at our Long Pocket campus
Closing date Tuesday 16 August at 11.00pm AEST (R-15278)
About This Opportunity
TERN is an Australian Government research infrastructure initiative to enhance Australia’s environmental research effort, particularly in the area of changes over time in ecosystems. TERN coordinates a national grid of field observation, sensors and remote sensing, which collectively provide open access data for researchers and other users in Australia and globally. TERN was established in 2009 by a National Collaborative Research Infrastructure Strategy (NCRIS) grant from the Australian Government Department of Education, Skills and Employment (DESE) and receives co-investment from state governments and partner institutions. Through a number of extensions and renewals of its grant, TERN’s project funding is currently in place until June 2023.
Reporting to the Program Lead, TERN Data & Analytics Platform, the Data Engineer is a hands-on role to facilitate the transformation, extraction, publication and distribution of ecosystem science data collected and collated by TERN. As a critical member of the TERN Data & Analytics platform team, the position will design, build and automate onboarding of wide range of terrestrial ecosystem data that can be exposed to researchers and policy makers.
Key responsibilities will include:
Engage with users and data providers to gather requirements to design and develop end-to-end data centric solutions to meet their needs.
Design and develop data assets by integrating data from multiple sources
Transform raw data into services for consumption in upstream application like data analytics and data visualisation tools.
Design and develop reusable automation processes for data on-boarding and migration to improve efficiency using tools such as Apache Airflow.
Design, implement and optimise data infrastructure to support datasets including geospatial, time-series and human observations from various sources;
Work with metadata and data representation and delivery standards;
Develop and maintain spatial databases and data services and make them cloud native;
Work in the cloud infrastructure to develop and host services;
Provide technical advice and support to the ecosystem science community;
Work with stakeholders to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs;
This role is subject to The University’s
Code of Conduct
.
About You
Tertiary qualification in IT, computer science, software engineering, geoinformatics, ecoinformatics or related field with at least 5 years work experience;
Proven experience in large scale data management (ingestion, extraction, processing and exploration) projects
Demonstrated experience in skillsets such as:
Python and/or R programming
Databases and SQL
ETL pipelines and workflows tools (e.g., Airflow)
Linux commands
Cloud technologies (OpenStack is preferred)
Experience building and optimising data pipelines, architectures and datasets;
Demonstrated experience in developing solutions to access large and/or streaming structured and semi-structured datasets for analytics needs.
Experience and expert knowledge in:
Data modelling and querying
Data curation and quality
Data access management
Data Migration tools and techniques
Data integration, visualisation and associated technologies
Data storage and associated technologies and infrastructure
Good understanding of software development lifecycle and agile development methodology.
Demonstrated ability to take ownership of complex problems and provide solutions.
Strong communication and organisational skills.
What We Can Offer
This is a full-time, fixed-term position through to June 2023 at HEW Level 7 based at our Long Pocket campus.
The full-time equivalent base salary will be in the range $90,538 - $98,719 plus super of up to 17%. The total FTE package will be in the range $105,929 - $115,501 per annum.

Hello. We’re Virgin Australia. And we’re back (in a big way).
We’re the airline that’s always done things a little different. Our way. The Virgin way. For us, flying is so much more than simply taking off and landing (although we understand that is quite important). It’s about going the extra mile, in the air and on the ground, to create authentic experiences that put our guests firmly at the heart of everything we do.
The opportunity:
The Commercial Performance and Insights team reports to the Chief Commercial Officer, and work alongside other Commercial Divisions including Marketing, Revenue Management, Direct Distribution, SME and Sales.
We are building a new team and looking for a talented revenue management analyst. This is an incredible opportunity for an associate or senior associate looking to take the next step in their career.
The objective of the Revenue Management Analyst, Commercial Acceleration Strategy role is to provide support to both Head of and Manager of Commercial Acceleration Strategy. This includes supporting the development of the broader commercial strategy and transformation roadmap to achieve our aspiration and support the analysis to identify opportunities to accelerate value capture. This role will work also focus on selected deep dives into these opportunities (i.e. special projects) as part of a 4-6 weeks sprint, in particular related to Revenue Management opportunities (e.g. inventory and price settings optimisation). These special projects will be in collaboration with relevant commercial functions and other teams within the Virgin Australia Group. You will be required to lead complex analysis to measure initiative effectiveness, and insights to drive optimisation (especially related to inventory and pricing optimisation), actively participate and contribute to the Commercial Acceleration and Commercial Performance and Insights team of analysts, through experience sharing and work closely with relevant Data Science teams to augment commercial analytics to drive commercial outcomes.
In addition, this role will play a critical role in supporting the preparation of outputs to facilitate stakeholder management and decision making.
Key responsibilities -
Support the workstream within special projects and selected deep-dives (in particular relating to Revenue Management) for value acceleration capture
Support the development of commercial strategy and transformation
Actively support the preparation for ELT/Board updates
Proactively work with internal stakeholders across the commercial functions and across the VA Group
Work closely with the Finance, Network and Revenue Management team (e.g. revenue forecasting)
Support the Manager of Commercial Acceleration Strategy to identify and scope commercial opportunities and lead the sizing of commercial benefits and investments
Support delivery and optimisation of initiatives as required, including tracking and measuring initiative effectiveness
The ideal candidate:
You will have 2+ years' experience in top-tier management/strategy consulting and ready to take the next step in your career in Commercial Acceleration Strategy with a focus on Revenue Management/Pricing. You will have a proven ability in translating business questions into critical analysis to prove or disprove hypothesis, interrogating and analysing large bodies of data to generate actionable insights and an ability to synthesis insights into a management level narrative to drive decision making.
You have a passion for commercial performance improvement strategy, specifically revenue management and would enjoy actively participating and contributing to the Commercial Acceleration and Commercial Performance and Insights team of analysts through experience sharing. You are comfortable working in a face paced environment, operating with ambiguity and enjoy the variety in working across different divisions. You enjoy proactively interrogating and analysing data to identify trends, gaps and opportunities, and understand drivers of commercial performance using Excel, BI and other analytical tools.
Experience and skills –
Relevant Bachelor degree ( or relevant post grad degree would be desirable)
2+ years' experience in strategy/management consulting
Experience in strategic pricing is highly desirable
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Excellent stakeholder management skills
Experience in preparing CEO/Board level presentation
Strong excel skills (competent in using BI tools would be desirable)
Having aviation/travel knowledge is not essential, however highly desirable
What you’ll get from us
We’re committed to looking after you, with some of the best benefits and conditions in the industry – including (but not limited to):
Heavily discounted air travel for you and your loved ones (including $1000 worth of travel credits per year)
Flexible working arrangements (including work hours and work from home)
Discounts on travel insurance, car hire, accommodation and experiences worldwide
Discounted Virgin Australia Lounge membership
Hospitality, retail, technology, beauty services and wellness discounts
Wellness support, including the betterme digital wellbeing platform
A comprehensive Employee Assistance Program, which offers confidential coaching and support from qualified professionals for all aspects of life – physical, mental, social and financial
Dress for Your Day – enjoy the freedom to wear whatever is appropriate for the type of work you do and the day you have ahead of you
Equality rules
We’re all individuals. We love that. That’s why we encourage applications from Indigenous Australians, people with disability, those from diverse cultural backgrounds, our friends in the LGBTQI+ community, and anyone else who wants to join our family.
COVID-19
The safety and security of our people, guests and operations come first. Always. That’s why we’ve put together a comprehensive ‘Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Policy’. In a nutshell, to work with us, you’ll need to comply with our (and the airport’s) rules and regulations. And be fully vaxxed.
Ready to apply?
We’re ready to hear from you.

Take a lead with researchers and farmers to coordinate and conduct soil sampling and the preparation of samples (including drying, mulching and grinding of samples) for subsequent physical, chemical or biological analyses of materials across major RDE projects in southern Queensland
Collaborate with research agronomists and farmers to co-ordinate, conduct and support on-farm research activities to ensure timely planting, spraying, harvesting, application of treatments and monitoring of sites.
Operate commonly used farm and research machinery and monitor and maintain data logging equipment (e.g. weather stations) at research sites.
Collect soil, plant, and water samples to characterise aspects of crop performance, soil health and farming system sustainability
Record and collate field observations from research sites using appropriate data management tools
Help maintain a central database of experimental results in preparation for statistical analysis
Participate in local planning within the Regional Agronomy Team and support other research projects in southern Queensland
You must have:
Diploma or equivalent qualification in Applied Science or similar field from a recognised tertiary institution
Hold a current driver licence, and desirably hold a heavy truck licence
Role specific requirements:
Experience implementing experimental designs and procedures for small-plot and farmer-scale trials, including following protocols, recording activities and observations, and accurately managing varying types of data and records in a timely manner.
Proven ability to take the initiative, anticipating timelines and work demands to meet research needs; integrating and maintaining treatments, preparing resources in advance, and organising logistics to ensure timely activities.
Empathy with farmers and agronomists and an ability to communicate with them as they identify and test new options to improve their farming systems.
Experience operating commonly used farm and research machinery to conduct field experiments, including regular soil sampling rigs, use of boom-sprays, planters, harvesters, drying ovens, soil and plant threshers and grinders.
Ability and willingness to travel, including overnight, to service research sites in southern Queensland.
Applications to remain current for 12 months.

Why choose us?
Icon Group is Australia’s largest dedicated cancer care provider with a growing reach into New Zealand and Asia. With over 2,500 employees company-wide, the Group’s cancer services include over 40 cancer centres, 3 large chemotherapy compounding facilities and over 60 pharmacies across Australia.
As a purpose-led organisation, we are committed to changing the dial on healthcare outcomes across Asia Pacific and beyond. Icon exists to deliver the best healthcare possible as close to home as possible for patients across the globe.
Our future success depends on the quality and commitment of our team, so we are devoted to empowering our people to thrive in their career through personal and professional growth and development. If you are looking for a rewarding role and to make a difference in the lives of cancer patients globally, this is the opportunity for you!
About Icon Research:
Icon offers Australia’s largest private cancer clinical trials program. We have over 120 clinical trials open for recruitment and over 650 patients currently on active trials across haematology, medical oncology and radiation oncology and conduct trials from phase I through to phase IV.
Benefits:
Valued rewards and recognition program
Flexible working arrangements
Paid parental leave
Informative training and professional development
Competitive salary package
Access to some of the nation’s leading clinicians, physicists and radiation therapists
About the role:
Permanent full-time opportunity to join our collaborative research team based at one of our Brisbane Icon Cancer Centres. This is an amazing chance to work in a high-volume oncology and haematology clinical trial unit, along with gaining experience in emerging early phase clinical trials and access to leading technology.
Key Responsibilities:
Provide high level support to Icon Principal Investigators in the conduct and day to day management of clinical trials
Manage and conduct the clinical trial portfolio including the trial coordination, recruitment, participant and team member education and communication
Ensure that clinical research carried out within Icon is conducted in accordance with Good Clinical Practice, the NHMRC National Statement and Icon policies
Contribute to the financial management of the business unit to ensure that trial participants are tracked and patient payment data is submitted in a timely fashion
Communicate effectively with trial participants to ensure that trial related procedures are booked appropriately and compliance to attendance for trial visits is maintained
Actively attend meetings with internal and external stakeholders
About you:
We are seeking a driven and detail-oriented individual who has the ability to independently solve problems. With relevant research experience, you will have the ability to manage your workflow and build rapport with various stakeholders through strong effective communication.
We are open to considering a highly skilled medical oncology or haematology nurse, as training in clinical trials is provided OR applicants with a bachelors degree in relevant health sciences or allied health field.

In the role of Cultural Heritage Officer, you will manage and implement cultural heritage processes and procedures related to the delivery of road and infrastructure works depicted in the Queensland Transport and Roads Investment Program (QTRIP) ensuring projects are not delayed while remaining compliant with state and federal legislation. You will provide high level specialist advice on cultural heritage policy, methodologies and standards both within and external to the department. You will identify sites of cultural heritage significance / project operational risks and lead the management of these risks. A key component of the role will require you to build and strengthen relationships between TMR and registered Aboriginal parties to ensure the risk of delays to delivery of QTRIP projects is minimised.
Accountabilities include,- Provide guidance and cultural heritage management expertise to meet the Department's and the Government's cultural heritage management commitments, particularly in relation to the delivery of the QTRIP works.- Demonstrate an applied understanding of historical and indigenous best practice cultural heritage management, including archaeological site survey and recording techniques to support delivery of the roads program.- Provide a sound level of cultural heritage technical expertise (both Indigenous and historical) and identify options and solutions to support the planning, design, construction and maintenance of transport infrastructure.- Undertake research including archaeological site survey where required and assemble historical data to evaluate authenticity and significance of findings to be used in cultural heritage documentation associated with infrastructure projects.- Influence infrastructure design solutions to meet cultural heritage objectives in line with government objectives and community expectations. - Assist in the management of the scope and direction of cultural heritage projects with consideration of time, cost and broader government expectations to secure timely and optimal outcomes for the community.- Work with and maintain mutually beneficial relationships with all relevant parties to assist with effective management of natural, social and cultural resources.- Manage or assist in the management of external Cultural Heritage related resources including development of terms of reference and project briefs, selection and management of contractors, technical review of risk assessments and recommendations, and oversee the implementation of the recommendations.This role reports to the Manager (Technical Services).The appointee may be eligible for incentives as detailed in the Rural and Remote Area Incentive Scheme (RRAIS) that may include subsidised accommodation, up to 10% salary incentive, subsidised electricity, family education assistance and medical treatment.
Mandatory requirements: - Possession of Bachelor of Archaeology, Anthropology, Social Science, Heritage Management, Heritage Conservation or related discipline.- A current Class 'C' Drivers LicenceHow to apply: - A certified copy of your qualifications, as listed under 'Mandatory requirements'. If your qualification is from an overseas institution, the Australian assessment of qualification equivalence must also be provided. - Your CV or resume (maximum five pages)- A cover letter (maximum two pages) outlining your skills and experience, and your ability to meet the requirements of the role- The name and contact details of at least two referees (at least one referee must have thorough knowledge of your conduct and performance within the previous two years)
Applications to remain current for 12 months

Thermo Fisher Scientific’s Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner, and safer, and the global coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak is a powerful reminder of the importance of that Mission. In fact, Thermo Fisher is at the forefront of the global response to COVID-19. We are working with governments, agencies, industry partners and researchers globally to ensure priority access to instruments, consumables, safety supplies and other products to address the outbreak. Our efforts have been particularly focused in supporting analysis of the virus, diagnosis, personal protection, and ultimately helping in the development of new therapeutics and vaccines.

Job Title: Bioprocess Scientist - DSP

Location: Brisbane

Reporting To: DSP Supervisor

The Brisbane site is a multi-product biopharmaceutical site with development and manufacturing facilities for biopharmaceutical products for clinical trials (Phase I, II and III) as well as commercial products. Manufacturing of biopharmaceutical products is required to be in compliance with regulatory requirements as defined by TGA, FDA, EMEA, ICH and other applicable regulatory agencies.

How will you make an impact?
Support execution of DSP unit operations (chromatography, virus inactivation, virus filtration, ultrafiltration-diafiltration and drug substance final fill) with the applicable production protocols and planning schedules, in a clean room environment under cGMP conditions.
A pro-active attitude and personal initiative is expected to identify practical problems and communicates to the responsible person.
Able to contribute in their DSP functions, such as maintaining production suite, supplies, equipment, logbooks, and data, as well as closing out batch record and material reconciliation in accordance with site SOPs and policies.
Perform equipment maintenance and testing related to technical skills of Bioprocess Scientist II.
Revise and author SOPs and logbooks.
Adhere to Patheon cGMP Quality Management System and the Patheon EH&S requirements.
Trained on DSP unit operations and equipment as well as maintain up to date training matrix.
Execute corrective and preventive actions and support the on-time closure of deviation reports and change controls.
Contribute in deviation investigations.
Implement lean (OE) initiatives and continuous improvements.
Contribute to the transfer and understanding of specific new technologies to DSP.
Support and implement new procedures and/or equipment in the OPS department in consultation with other owners and users.
Communicate with supplier about issued of technical nature.

How will you get here?
Tertiary education in science or engineering based field (i.e. biopharmaceuticals manufacture, biotechnology, process technology).
Very good knowledge in cGMP environment.
Skills & Attributes
Ability to work unsupervised.
Good communication, flexibility, reliability and assertiveness.
Responsible and proactive.

What’s in it for you?
A competitive salary and performance related bonus structure
Exposure to market leading cutting-edge technologies.
Development opportunities as part of a rapidly growing global organization

At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 110,000 extraordinary minds have a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission—enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner, and safer.

Urban Utilities is one of the largest water distributor-retailers in Australia... but we're so much more than water. Our people ensure that a population of more than 1.4 million South East Queenslanders have access to world-class drinking water, recycled water and sewerage services. We love being part of our urban and regional communities and take great pride in our people, our work, and the opportunity to manage a network that provides access to one of the earth's most precious resources.
A newly formed opportunity has become available for a Data Scientist / Analyst within our Environmental and Industrial Group.
The Environmental and Industrial Group was created to capitalise on the opportunities in the circular economy based on changes observed in the water and utility industry nationally and internationally. The Group contributes to Urban Utilities’ purpose and vision by protecting the environment and public health through our core treatment services; being prepared for the future through the treatment solutions and growth opportunities of tomorrow; and enabling economic growth and prosperity through our customer and developer services.
As the Data Scientist/Analyst, you will perform an end-to-end role in collecting data, conduct data analysis and provide insights through performance measurement and reporting for all teams across the Water Ventures division. The role will use a combination of internal data, market intelligence and third-party data sources including social media to generate insights to inform decision making.
Key Accountabilities:
Collate and analyse data relating to customers and markets using business intelligence, methods and formats. Involves working independently.
Support collection of Water Ventures business requirements using a variety of methods such as interviews, document analysis, and workflow analysis to express requirements clearly and succinctly
Support interpretation of advanced and predictive analytics data, using specialized software tools and functionalities.
Execute and deliver elements of the digital road map, leveraging agile and design-thinking principles to drive sustainable implementation.
Help others within Water Ventures get the most out of business intelligence systems by providing support and advice.
Contribute to the preparation of various data and analytics reports related to Water Ventures
Consult and educate stakeholders on methods for streamlining and standardizing data recording to ensure quality and accuracy.
About You:
Tertiary education in data science, engineering, or equivalent
Proficient user in data management software and Power BI tools
Can work with full competence to analyse potential solutions and create recommendations based on the expected benefits, costs, and overall value of the solution for key stakeholders.
Experience in collating using Natural Language Processing and analysing data relating to customers and markets using business intelligence, methods and formats.
Can effectively perform numerical, statistical and qualitative data analysis and creates clear and concise information to be acted upon by the enterprise.
Why US?
There has never been a better time to join our newly created join our Water Ventures function within our Environmental & Industrial Group. We’re a team that understands the importance of data and the benefit data science can bring to helping us make better growth decisions. We don’t just see data analysis as a helping space, it’s an important part in helping us sift through the universe and glean insight we otherwise couldn’t have found by hand.
You will be a part of an innovative team that drives sustainable change through development, implementation and operation of opportunities in the circular economy, ranging from novel solutions to support customers to achieve their water goals, creating value from organics, and hydrogen production.
If you are seeking to be a part of a forward thinking and innovative organisation with a genuine connection to their people, customers and communities as well as a desire to play a key part in driving Urban Utilities forward to be a digital utility of the future, this opportunity could be for you. So, if this sound like the right role and company for you – please apply through the link below!

Hello. We’re Virgin Australia. And we’re back (in a big way).
We’re the airline that’s always done things a little different. Our way. The Virgin way. For us, flying is so much more than simply taking off and landing (although we understand that is quite important). It’s about going the extra mile, in the air and on the ground, to create authentic experiences that put our guests firmly at the heart of everything we do.

What you will be doing
This pivotal role provides support to the Airports Commercial team, specifically in the planning and development of infrastructure at airports and for Virgin Australia.
Working with the Airport Planning Manager, you will translate business requirements into infrastructure plans, by reviewing and analysing airport master plans and development proposals combined with capacity modelling to ensure proposed and existing infrastructure meets Virgin Australia’s objectives. Additionally, you will also
Assist in the development of high-level reports based on data insights and analysis, including capacity analysis of critical infrastructure
Review and assess airport development proposals. Assessing the need for investment having regard to current and forecast demand
Ensure the scope of investment is aligned to operational and product needs
Ensure the cost of proposed investment is appropriate having regard to scope
Assist in the review and analysis of proposed commercial terms for access to airport infrastructure
Build effective and productive relationships with internal and external stakeholders

To be a great fit for this role you will bring:
A relevant bachelor’s degree in Aviation, Engineering, Science or similar
2 to 3 years’ experience working in a similar Planning role within a large complex organisation or relevant experience in a professional services environment
Strong infrastructure planning and design skills
Effective time management and project management skills
Demonstrated interrogating and analysis of large data set to generate insights, recommendations, and presentations
Advanced excel skills with a high level of PowerPoint and Word skills
Experience within the airline sector would be highly regarded
High level of attention to detail and strong written/oral communication skills

What you will get from us

Heavily discounted air travel for you and your loved ones (including $1000 worth of travel credits per year)
Flexible working arrangements (including work hours and work from home)

We’re all individuals. We love that. That’s why we encourage applications from Indigenous Australians, people with disability, those from diverse cultural backgrounds, our friends in the LGBTQI community, and anyone else who wants to join our family.

At the Virgin Australia Group, the safety and security of our people, guests and operations come first. Always. That’s why we’ve put together a comprehensive ‘Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Policy’. In a nutshell, to work with us, you’ll need to comply with our (and the airport’s) rules and regulations. And be fully vaxxed.

yourtown is a charity with services that support young people to find jobs, learn skills, become great parents and live safer, happier lives.
Our mission is to enable young people, especially those who are marginalised and without voice, to improve their quality of life.
yourtown is undertaking one of the boldest and most ambitious digital and business transformations in Australia which will forever change the way we help children and young people.
About the Role
The People & Culture Data & Insights Lead will be supporting the P&C team by analysing, reporting, and telling data stories in a meaningful and insightful way. This will support our leaders in driving the organisation towards our maturity journey and will be instrumental in the discovery and design of quality people metrics at yourtown. We want to be pro-active and have quality HR metrics that will give us visibility and knowledge of our people data to support our P&C and organisational strategy.
This is a new role for the P&C so you will be pivotal in shaping workforce planning and providing predictive analytics to a team who are enthusiastic to learn. You will need to be comfortable developing metrics from scratch and will have experience pulling data from multiple HR and legacy yourtown systems.
Your day-to-day tasks will include:
Create, develop and maintain a cyclical reporting schedule of P&C metrics
Undertake research and provide advice on best practice ensuring this is communicated with our P&C leaders regularly
Support the organisation to create predictive analysis, establish workforce planning and influence the organization in a constructive and positive way
Work with P&C leaders to provide meaningful data and present back to them in an engaging way
Create data stories that can drive performance improvement and influence decision making
Develop analytical tools and software
Create and support data quality initiatives, governance of accuracy and ongoing integrity of P&C data
Providing support and assistance with all data and reporting matters
About you
We’re looking for candidates with:
Degree level qualifications in a relevant discipline (e.g. Human Resources, Business, Data Science)
3+ years’ experience in a data & analytics position within a P&C/ HR team
High level understanding of People & Culture responsibilities
Proven experience developing reports and using analysis to assist with business decisions
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
Ability to analyse and present data in valid ways to tell powerful stories
Curious and inquisitive attributes to compare and research data
Great attention to detail and organisation skills that can manage multiple priorities
Benefits offered at yourtown:
Access to salary packaging arrangements (boost your take-home pay!)
Flexible hybrid working arrangements (at least 2 days a week working from home)
Free membership to our wellbeing program including apps such as CALM & Centr
Access to our Employee Assistance Program
A supportive workforce with coaching and development opportunities
Private health insurance discounts
Corporate rates local gym access
Diversity and Inclusion peer support groups
With a big agenda, a big brand profile and a compelling mission, and in an organisation small enough (but with great reach!) to make a real difference, this is an opportunity to do something incredible for your career and for children and young people.
yourtown is committed to providing services that protect and keep children, young people and adults at risk free from harm. The appointment of successful applicants will be subject to satisfactory screening for child-related employment including the completion of a National Criminal History Check and retention of a valid Working with Children Check.
yourtown supports vaccination as the best way to keep our people and our communities safe from Covid-19. We require all employees, volunteers, students and contractors to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 as a condition of employment.

This program is not simply a technology refresh – it will be a transformation that encompasses legislative, technology, business process and organisational changes.
Our configurable Product is central to this project and after the initial training period, you'll be based out of our client’s premises in Brisbane – working alongside the client and our team to deliver Registry Solutions.
Working as part of an agile project team, you'll be central to the delivery of our product for our client. You will spend your time on the data migration design & execution as well as coaching and mentoring other data migration team members.
This is a very rewarding role that will allow people to become resilient and stretch outside of their comfort zone. If you enjoy complex projects where you can really contribute and see the outcome, then this is the role for you. The right candidate can work in either Brisbane or Canberra.
We're looking for people with the following:
At least 4 years' experience in an Information Technology Business.
Tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Business, Statistics or related discipline.
Ability to communicate effectively with a wide range of stakeholders and articulate methodologies and results to non-technical business audiences.
Excellent statistical/numerical skills.
Sound knowledge of databases in essential (one of Oracle, Postgres or SQLServer).
Strong critical thinking, problem solving and data analysis skills.
Knowledge of database performance.
Knowledge of ETL tools is preferable e.g. Talend.
Works independently on complex tasks with some technical and management guidance.
Able to participate in project and virtual teams.
Handles multiple and competing projects while delivering on tasks and objectives on time.
Produces high quality work and results.
At Foster Moore we recognise that our people are a huge part of our success. That’s why we believe in providing a stimulating work environment, encouraging our employees to develop their strengths, voice their ideas and reach their full potential. Our people really know their stuff, are passionate about what they do, and have fun doing it.
We have a range of benefits to offer you - including hybrid working model for the right candidate, paid birthday day off, wellbeing support, learning & development opportunities, and fantastic team building sessions each month to reward everyone!

At Deloitte, our mission is to enhance a company’s value through its people. Deloitte Human Capital Consulting combines business strategy with people strategy to achieve success for our clients. We don’t just understand our clients, we become one with them. By embedding ourselves in their teams, we focus on fostering diversity and inclusion in workplaces. We empower and upskill talent to radically transform traditional HR functions.

Today’s business challenges present a new wave of people, technology, talent and organisation priorities. Deloitte’s Human Capital services leverage industry insights, research and analytics to help design and execute critical programs from business-driven, technology transformations and future of work to innovative talent, leadership, and change programs.

What will your typical day look like?

As a Change Manager, you will be part of a team that is passionate about enabling our clients to lead HCM implmentations in their organisations through high impact experiences that deliver true business value and lasting results. Together, we co-design change solutions, using Human Centred Design approaches, behavioural science and data customised to business needs in an agile and responsive, commercially orientated manner.

You will gain experience working on large scale business transformation projects including:

Organisational Change Management/ Business Readiness
Technology Adoption
Stakeholder engagement and communications
Capability development and communications
Organisational Design
Workforce Transition
Behavioural Science
Leader-led and data-driven change programs

Enough about us, let’s talk about you

We are looking for emerging change practitioners with 4+ years’ experience seeking to apply your skills and learn more from the Talent community and the latest global ‘change by design’ methodology:

You will have change management experience from either a professional services environment, played a significant role, or made an impact on business transformation projects as an internal advisor or business partner, alongside a Tier 1 consulting company.
An ability to combine domain expertise and sector specialisation to make recommendations that enables your client’s business agenda..
Demonstrable experience in stakeholder engagement as a trusted advisor to business
You will have worked across multiple business domains and can demonstrate experience ideally in the areas of change and transformation including but not limited to:
Facilitating change planning; including stakeholder identification, business impact analysis and change management planning within the context of HCM system deployments;
Driven technology adoption as part of a full lifecycle of an implementation (e.g. Oracle, Workday, Success Factors, ERP system or digital transformation)
Design for business including persona development, storytelling, design thinking workshops, human centred design

Why Deloitte?
At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

We’re committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we’re leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive.
We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress – check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space.

Our client is a leading Forestry company in Australia with several hundred thousand hectares under their management. The key focus of the role is to Identify innovation opportunities aligned to strategic objectives and promote their rapid introduction and integration into business operations.
The GIS Research Specialist aims to provide the most effective and efficient GIS information to the management team by incorporating new technologies as they become available.
Based in SE QLD and reporting to the Science Manager, the successful candidate will be an integral member of the Research team responsible for managing the company’s GIS databases, operational mapping requirements, remote sensing programmes and spatial data analysis.
This consists of managing, maintaining and developing the GIS system for spatial data management, mapping production, spatial analysis, and interactive web map application development. You will facilitate the automation of capture, maintenance and delivery processes of plantation spatial data and associated applications. Prepare project specific GIS databases, maps, database reports and specialised queries in support of various projects. You will be required to undertake a range of activities related to solution design and application development of digital solutions that support the management of plantations and day to day operations.
Projects may vary from the nursery, disease and weed control, timber quality, harvesting, logistics, timber byproducts, roads and infrastructure.

Bachelor’s Degree in Geography, Surveying, Remote Sensing or Forestry.
Proven experience in environmental systems, geography & computer science
Knowledge of current trends and developments in a wide range of technologies that can improve plantation management outcomes including: remote sensing technologies and platforms (satellites, drones, LiDAR, ’Internet of Things’ (IoT), data analytics, artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) with ‘big data’;
Experienced with ESRI suite of products, notably ArcGIS, ArcPro and ArcGIS online.
Knowledge of Geographic Information System (GIS) and cartographic principles and techniques
Drone use, imagery capture and processing.
Proficient project management skills with the ability of multi-tasking
Demonstrated capabilities to communicate and engage effectively with internal and external stakeholders
A self-starter with experience in leading best practice and processes in GIS
An ability to present technical information effectively, to a broad non-technical audience
A strong work ethic with a proactive approach to opportunities and with high performance standards
An understanding of Forestry and/or Resource management.
A generous package including salary, super, computer, phone and 4 weeks annual leave.
