The primary focus of our Drainage Waterways and Coastal Planning department is to plan, manage and design the region's coastal, stormwater and floodplain management infrastructure, including built and natural form assets, consistent with Council's corporate strategic vision, policies and strategies.
As our Water Quality Officer, you will undertake technical investigations and design for a range of stormwater infrastructure matters particularly relating to stormwater quality infrastructure to meet the needs of the community within the Moreton Bay Regional Council area.
You will undertake planning and design in the field of environmental water quality management, including water quality in urban and rural waterways and waterbodies, water sensitive urban design, bio-retention systems and other SQIDs, and riparian rehabilitation to drive integrated and sustainable outcomes.
You will investigate environmental water quality problems and prepare and present technical reports and recommendations. You will assist in the development and implementation of the site specific and/or region wide, flood and water quality monitoring including overseeing the initial set up of automatic samplers, liaising with contractors, overseeing the maintenance schedule for automatic samplers, sample selection, preparation and storage and data management.
You will prepare and present clear and concise technical reports, letters, and presentations describing the outcomes of coastal planning investigations and liaise with local and state departments and prepare applications for permits and approvals to undertake a range of stormwater & waterway management activities and projects.
In this role you will engage proactively with key stakeholders responding to customer/client requests relating to flood and water quality data and services provided to the community.
About you:
We are seeking someone who has sound knowledge and experience in stormwater quality management and experience in the operation of water sampling infrastructure. You will have skills with regards to spatial analysis; preferably with water quality information datasets. You will have well developed problem-solving skills with the ability to investigate and resolve issues, time management skills and the ability to manage conflicting priorities and meet deadlines.
You will excellent communications skills with the ability to build relationships with a variety of stakeholders both internal and external.
Our Water Quality Infrastructure team is highly technically skilled, collaborative and passionate about achieving high quality results for our community. We are focused on delivering on our corporate values of Service, Teamwork, Integrity, Respect and Sustainability - we are seeking people who resonate with these values.
You will hold a Degree in Civil or Environmental Engineering, Environmental Science, Planning or equivalent experience.
Why join the MBRC Team?
As the third largest local government area in Australia and the fifth fastest growing region, the Moreton Bay Region boasts beautiful beaches and waterways, amazing manufacturing hubs and picturesque hinterland hamlets. Moreton Bay has a strong and connected community that enjoys all the traditional Jinibara, Kabi Kabi and Turrbal country has to offer within our region.
With a diverse workforce of more than 2000 team members dedicated to servicing the needs and enhancing the lifestyle of more than 469,000 residents, each team member has an intrinsic ability to impact our community. Whether you’re a manager or working on the frontline, your role will make a difference - bring your expertise and join our driven team today.
Aside from an opportunity to build a rewarding career within a diverse and growing organisation, we offer a range of team member benefits including:
Flexibility at MBRC depends on the type of work you do but could include options such as work from home, part time, 9-day fortnights and flexible days. Talk to us about what flexibility means to you!
Discounted Health Insurance.
We are proud to offer opportunities to develop your career within a local government organisation and our team members are encouraged to undertake study for career development in their area of employment under our Study, Training & Research Scheme (STARS).
Generous employer and employee super contribution scheme.
Free onsite parking.
Fitness Passport program offering discounted membership for you and your family to selected facilities.

A current resumé or curriculum vitæ

Are you fascinated by Molecular Genetics and seeking a varied and exciting laboratory position?
Attractive remuneration package plus an outstanding range of benefits!
Supportive team environment with opportunities for career progression!
About the Organisation
Sullivan Nicolaides Pathology is one of the largest pathology practices in Australia, providing comprehensive services to patients and doctors over a geographic area throughout Queensland and New South Wales and employing more than 3000 people.
With many employees enjoying a 20+ tenure, Sullivan Nicolaides Pathology delivers on the promise of learning and development and career progression.
Fostering a true culture of support, Sullivan Nicolaides Pathology maintains an open-door policy, with each employee playing a role in patient care driven to make sure a top-quality service is provided.
About Your Next Opportunity
Sullivan Nicolaides Pathology now has an opportunity for a full-time Scientist to join their Molecular Pathology Genetics team located at their Bowen Hills laboratory.
The successful applicant will contribute to a national consortium project around the large-scale sequencing of tissue samples for cancer patients with a therapeutic focus. Additionally, successful candidates can enhance their skill sets with clinical experience/exposure in our other molecular genetics technical platforms and genetics assay portfolio, including Non-Invasive Prenatal Testing. Established techniques within the laboratory include DNA extraction, PCR, real-time PCR, fragment analysis, droplet digital PCR, pyrosequencing, Nanostring technologies and NGS.’
The successful applicants should posses an appropriate Accredited degree in Medical Laboratory Science. Prior experience in molecular genetics techniques, especially Illumina sequencing technologies, will be highly regarded. While experience with data analysis of somatic mutations associated with solid tumours is preferred, candidates with transferrable skills from similar areas are encouraged to apply.
Available as a full-time or part-time role, you will be expected to work a variety of weekday shifts. The core lab hours are 9 am - 5 pm; however, the ability to cover hours between 7 am - 7 pm will be advantageous. Similarly, candidates willing to cover weekend work and public holidays will be highly regarded.
Ideally, Sullivan Nicolaides Pathology is looking for someone who is enthusiastic, possesses good communication, organisational and problem-solving skills, displays efficient time management and can work unsupervised or as part of a busy and motivated team.
A high level of commitment to laboratory turnaround times, customer service, the accuracy of processing and laboratory goals is also required.
About the Benefits - Perks of the Job
The high level of service provided by Sullivan Nicolaides Pathology is delivered by a dedicated staff comprising Pathologists, scientists, technicians, laboratory assistants, collection personnel, couriers, computer personnel, pathology service assistants and other support staff.
The organisation offers staff members the opportunity to develop their skills through ongoing training and provides an avenue for career development and advancement.
In addition to a competitive remuneration package commensurate with experience and qualifications, permanent employees enjoy the following benefits:
Parental and Adoption Leave - SNP staff receive 6 weeks paid maternity and adoption leave as per E.B.A.
Employee Assistance Program - a free, confidential and voluntary counselling service provided as a resource to employees of Sullivan Nicolaides Pathology, as well as immediate family, with the aim of assisting with the resolution of personal and work-related problems which may affect the quality of life or work performance
Private Health Insurance - staff have access to discounted private health insurance through MBF, HCF and Medibank Private
Pathology Services - staff and their immediate family (their children, partners and their parents) have access to bulk billed Pathology Services
X-Ray Services - staff and their immediate family (their children, partners and their parents) have access to bulk billed X-Ray and other diagnostic imaging through Queensland X-Ray
Smoke Free Workplace - for those staff wanting to use nicotine replacement therapy in quitting, management provides a level of financial assistance towards the cost of nicotine replacement patches.
Join a leading pathology practice and enjoy outstanding benefits ‐ APPLY NOW!

About RedEye!
We provide the first fully cloud-based and purpose-built engineering data management solution for asset owners and their service providers globally.
We work with critical infrastructure organisations across industries such as water, energy, mining, infrastructure, healthcare, government (national parks and wildlife), and defence to improve the safety and productivity of their critical assets, in real time.
What began as an ambitious start-up in Brisbane in 2012 as a way for engineers to manage their engineering information has today evolved into a recognised leader in assets data management delivery, helping our clients manage over $250bn of assets. This is our RedEye story...so far.
Headquartered in Brisbane, we currently have a team of 89 across ANZ, the Philippines and North America.
We are a customer focused organisation, with a commitment to growth and continuous improvement. We are proud of the values we live by every day that shape the success of our team and the experience of our customers:
“I've got your back”
“I get sh*t done”
“We're making a difference”
About the Opportunity
As RedEye's Data Engineer, you will be responsible for migrating, processing, and transforming large amounts of data / files into the RedEye database as part of implementation projects. To be successful in this role, you will need to build a deep understanding of how RedEye's clients provide Engineering and asset data and have strong attention to detail with programming skills (Python, SQL, algorithms and data structures) and advanced Excel. Advanced written and verbal communication skills, providing client reporting and requirements elicitation.
Responsibilities
Data Migration:
Review Client Engineering Drafting Standards and other required artefacts and attendance at Client Engineering Data Migration requirements sessions
Perform data analysis (files and meta data) and creation of documentation of findings (ensure these are in suitable business format for client consumption)
Creation of Client Data Migration plan informing and specification of migration method
Preparation of data for migration including managing any data improvement (e.g., binary duplicates)
Preparation of Migration Manifest, matching files to metadata, assigning workflows and groups to artefacts and reviewing with client
Execute the data migration in RedEye DMS or appropriate system, validate migration
Perform revision consolidation analysis of engineering data and creation of Revision Consolidation Manifest
Complete post migration activities including automated and manual QA review and error analysis
Documentation of migration procedures and their continual development
Documentation of migration scripts and their continual development
Work with Dev/Ops teams to define tools and rules to improve the data migration and management process
Scope and assist to implement data improvement related opportunities with the Customer Operations and Account Management teams
Business Analysis & Technical Configuration:

Support the definition and documentation of business logic such as workflow mapping, and success criteria that supports the solution design
Support the translation of customer requirements into requirements definitions & input into solution design to achieve customer outcomes
Executing upon technical configuration tasks for RedEyeDMS products or environment based on client requirements
Engage with Project Manager and Technical Analyst to clarify solution requirements, answer queries and support UAT for solution development
About You:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Systems or related technical discipline
Post graduate Data Science qualifications highly regarded
Advanced knowledge of BI Power & Python
Working experience of SQL, PowerShell, algorithms and data structures and advanced Excel
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office suite, Teams, SharePoint and experience with Agile productivity tools (i.e., JIRA, Confluence etc) understands what impact variable data quality has on product performance and user experience
Ability to distinguish and communicate the difference between user error and actual system defects and document same
Ability to write clean, well-documented and reusable code and scripts in accordance with secure coding guidelines
Understanding of Agile project management methodology, approaches, tools, and phases of program/project lifecycles
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills enabling you to navigate customer processes and providing technical expertise related to the RedEye products
Excellent attention to detail
Why RedEye?
On top of being a leader in the delivery of assets data management, with a diverse team of talented and supportive professionals we also offer:

A chance to work on impactful greenfield projects, creating critical learning solutions that drive internal capabilities within our teams, and create awesome experiences for our customers
A genuine opportunity to take advantage of flexible working arrangements so you can be at your best both at work and in your personal time (work from home flexibility is the norm here)
A promise to not hold you back with red tape and excessive procedures that are counterproductive (strong emphasis on “I get sh*t done” here)
A commitment to your health and wellbeing, with discounted gym memberships and 2 annual RedEye Recharge Days, so you can take the time you need, just for yourself

How do you stand out?
By having knowledge of SaaS and PaaS and previous experience in eCommerce management, by thriving in a "startup-like" environment and being excited about the impact you will make.

Position overview:
As a part of the Global Technical Operations Team, the Platform Engineer is responsible for continuously operating, managing and supporting Cloud Platforms of our customers with the goal of maintaining a highly available, scalable, reliable and secure platform. In capacity of Platform engineer your main goals will be performing and automating operational activities such as but not limited to: products deployment and configuration, product catalog maintenance, platform updates delivery, validating implemented changes, system administration of underlying infrastructure.
Platform Engineer will focus on executing operational and maintenance tasks, developing, executing, supporting and maintaining automation tools. Daily tasks will range from supporting product rollouts, maintaining multiple operational environments, troubleshooting issues and contributing to improvements of processes, platforms and supporting its components. We are looking for a technology innovator who will be able to propose new ideas, work with technology teams to implement ideas and operationalize them once successful.

Responsibilities:
Continuously improve operational efficiency by automating manual tasks and processes
Actively contribute to internal automation toolset by developing new and improving of existing tools
Deploy, configure, maintain and manage customers' Cloud Platforms and its components
Analyze and understand requirements for customers' requests and implement accordingly
Maintain and support developed solutions
Collaborate with platform and connectors R&D teams in order report software issues as well as request improvements in order to satisfy customer experience satisfaction
Prepare deployment, configuration and process documentation
Monitoring of systems' health and performance, improving monitoring process
Support customers by investigating and successfully resolving reported issues
Maintain platform security by following established security and data protection procedures, perform security hardening by applying suggested configuration changes

Required Skills & Qualifications:
Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business or a related field, or an equivalent combination of education, training, and work experience
5+ years of experience as a System Administrator or related position
Excellent system administration skills
Understanding of SDLC
3+ years of scripting or development experience
Good experience in writing script in bash and/or PowerShell
Good Linux Server Administration skills - CentOS, Redhat
WebServers & Databases - Tomcat, Apache, MSSQL, Azure SQL, PostgreSQL
Experience working with IaaS/Cloud services of Azure (preferred), AWS and/or GCP
Experience writing and optimizing SQL queries
Fluent in English written/verbal communication


Core Skills:
Deliver results doing what it takes to get things done on time
Work autonomously with minimal supervision
Clear understanding of cloud technologies and offerings from Azure, AWS and GCP
Able to thrive in a fast-paced environment with strong teamwork abilities
Demonstrated strong written communication and speaking skills
Knowledge of bug tracking and documentation systems such as Jira and Confluence
Solid understanding of API concepts and types
Understanding of subscription-based services, subscriptions lifecycle and billing concepts
Knowledge and understanding of basics of financial terms: orders, AR/AP, credit management
Ability to learn and adapt to new services, systems, and technologies in a dynamic technical infrastructure
Writing and maintaining technical documentation: technical and process documentation, product requirements documents, feature requests
Ability to work in a very fast paced environment and provide significant contributions both individually and as part of a greater team

Nice to Have:
Experience working with Cloud Blue Commerce (formerly: Odin Automation)
Python, Azure, LPI, Microsoft, Postgres, MSSQL certifications would be a big plus
Experience working with Bitbucket, Git, Jenkins, Terraform, Puppet, Chef and Ansible
Experience working with API, manual execution as well as automating by writing scripts
Experience working with monitoring tools such as Zabbix, Prometheus, Grafana, etc.

About Us
Arrow Energy is an integrated coal seam gas (CSG) company, which develops gas fields, produces and sells CSG and generates electricity.
We have safely and sustainably developed CSG since 2000 and supplied it commercially since 2004 – for industrial use and power generation in northern Queensland, and for generation and the east coast gas market in the south.
Our corporate office is in Brisbane’s CBD, and we operate in the Bowen Basin in central Queensland, and in the Surat Basin in southern Queensland, where we are starting a major new development which is planned to bring about five trillion cubic feet of reserves to market over 27 years.
Arrow is owned by two of the world’s largest oil and gas companies, Shell and PetroChina.
Our Culture
At Arrow, safety is our highest priority, and our values – respect, lead, own, solve and integrate – underpin everything we do.
We believe a diverse and inclusive workplace, where people can bring their whole selves to work, is key to creating a culture where people thrive which is critical to our collective success. At Arrow, everyone belongs.

We strongly encourage diverse candidates to apply, including women, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people from multicultural backgrounds, people with disabilities and people from the LGBTIQ+ community.
The Role
As Graduate Data Specialist you will rotate through different areas of our business, gaining hands-on experience in data wrangling, analysis and it’s analytical use within subsurface, wells, reservoir and facilities management, finance and ICT departments; establishing the skills and experience required for a successful career start. This is a 2 year fixed-term role commencing January 2023, with the aim of joining our permanent team at the completion of the program.

Key Accountabilities:
Have a personal commitment to consistently role model Arrow’s values, code of conduct, safety and the environment.
Model inclusive behaviours and create a safe environment where different views and perspectives are encouraged and valued.
Complete assigned tasks through the application of discipline knowledge.
Develop an understanding and knowledge of Arrow’s business operations and processes and apply these to the work performed.
Identify opportunities for process and system improvement by sharing knowledge on new methodologies and theories.
Be an active contributor to the graduate community and program by participating in program enhancements, coordinating graduate events and buddying future recruits.
Contribute to team performance goals and undertake appropriate professional development opportunities.
About You
You will demonstrate excellent interpersonal and communication skills along with the ability to contribute to a high performing-team with a second-to-none focus on safety.
To be successful in the role, you will have:
University Degree in the Information Technology / Data Science, completed within the last two years (or on track to complete in 2022)
Familiar with programming languages like Python and SQL in Structured and Unstructured Data Scenarios
Analytical / Methodical and Problem-Solving mindset
Ability to integrate and work collaboratively with peers
Demonstrated self-leadership
High level critical reasoning and problem-solving skills
Ability to meet deadlines and adjust to competing priorities
Numerical and written aptitude
Awareness of own development objectives and gaps
You’ll be rewarded
We recruit talented and motivated people who are passionate about contributing to our journey.
Your appointment will be met with ongoing training and development opportunities, to ensure your greatest potential is realised.
In return for your efforts, you’ll be rewarded with a competitive remuneration and benefits package including:
An attractive remuneration package with annual incentive scheme based on company and individual performance
Employee benefits including health insurance & electricity rebate scheme, lifestyle benefit rebate scheme and Employee Assistance Program
Flexible working arrangements
Paid parental leave scheme
Indigenous support network, ‘Bundagadan’, offering mentoring, workshops and coaching opportunities
Ongoing learning and professional development opportunities
Novated leasing
All applications will be considered with utmost confidentiality.
One Arrow, One Team.
Arrow recognises Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples as the Traditional Custodians of the Land in which we live and work, and we pay our respects to Elders past, present and future. We are a diverse and inclusive workplace and genuinely encourage applications from women and Aboriginal and Torres Strait islander candidates.

About the role
The Real Estate Data Analyst is a newly created position reporting to the Head of Real Estate Data Management to support the growing needs of Real Estate staff for data to inform investment and management decisions based in Brisbane.
Data Management sits within QIC Real Estate’s Business Performance and Technology department and is responsible for modernising the data and technology platforms that underpin the operational management of these assets, and for powering data-driven insights for investors, tenants, and executives.
As QIC Real Estate’s data maturity grows, so too will the importance of this position within the organisation.
Role accountabilities also include (but are not limited to):
Delivery of timely and accurate data investigations and exploratory analysis.
Data quality investigations (including root-cause analysis) and recommendation to resolve.
Capture and definition of requirements for data integrations, extracts and reports.
Review and testing of data integrations and data processes.
Creation of data extracts and reports to support QIC Real Estate operations.
Maintenance of data management artefacts (data dictionary, business glossary, development guidelines, user-facing documentation, etc).
Produce data extracts for commercial teams to support decision making.
Prepare new datasets to be loaded into QIC’s operational data systems.
Test the success of newly created or recently modified data integrations and workflows.
Capture requirements for new database objects, integrations, or reports.
Explore data for insights, patterns, and unidentified commercial opportunities.
Identify opportunities for automation, simplification, or self-service to improve data services.
Research data service vendors and their products for consideration in QIC’s data platform.
About you
Recent and relevant work experience as a data analyst, or related experience.
Tertiary degree in Data, Finance, Business, Computer Science (or equivalent work experience).
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server, or similar database.
Experience with Microsoft Excel and working knowledge of the Microsoft 365 family of tools.
Excellent attention to detail and a desire to produce accurate, high-quality reports, governance papers and other presentation material.

Description:
Job Requisition ID: 24704

Be part of Australia’s largest cohort of Vacationers – meaning you’ll have a community of other students to lean on and learn from
Gain real experience at our clients as part of projects and engagements
Build transferable professional skills and networks as you work with our people and our clients

If you’re fascinated by the role that technology plays in business and love the idea of helping clients manage their current and emerging cyber risks – this is the team for you!

What will you get to do?
Cyber threats are constantly evolving and the security solution landscape is becoming more complex. That’s why our work is more meaningful (and exciting) than ever. Always one step ahead, we support clients with being secure, vigilant and resilient through end-to-end advisory, implementation and managed services. We’re a team of strategists, architects, hackers, and technologists that help clients address cyber threats and have confidence to build smarter, faster and more connected futures. Pretty cool, right?

Your future starts with us.
As a worldwide leader in cyber strategy consulting and cyber intelligence, there are opportunities in 2 main pillars:

Strategy & Governance: We help clients develop their cyber security and data privacy strategies and governance models to support security priorities in an era where cyber is everywhere.
Architecture & Engineering: We work with clients to design and integrate industry leading security solutions across cloud, infrastructure, identity and access management and applications) that proactively defend clients against cyber attacks.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you.
We know that as a student, you may not necessarily have a ton of work experience, and that’s okay! At Deloitte, we see past experience and value your ethic and potential to grow more than anything else. You are also a student who:

Has a true passion for all things tech – currently majoring in IT, Computer Science, Engineering (or Business/Commerce/Law with a tech edge)
Will complete your degree in 2023
Is quick to learn, naturally inquisitive and always up for a challenge
Has excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Works best collaboratively – you thrive when working in a team!
Is proactive in driving your career forward – you might have entered a few hackathons, capture the flag competitions, maybe you have a side hustle or even taught yourself how to code!
Has Australian permanent residency or Australian/New Zealand Citizenship

Why Deloitte?

At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

We’re committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we’re leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive.

We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress – check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space.

Join us as we pursue our vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!
Our Splunk Family in Australia/ New Zealand are a results driven and collaborative bunch spanning functions across sales, customer success, support, marketing and G&A functions. We love to work as a team, celebrate success and learn from our losses. We have an excellent team culture with weekly team breakfasts, cocktail hour Fridays, end of quarter celebrations, volunteering activities and a culture based on respect, transparency and always doing the right thing!
We are looking for a talented software engineer to join our team in Sydney. At Splunk, we are passionate, and we are looking for an engineer who is motivated and passionate too! This role is all about writing the best software and delivering innovative enhancements for our customers. We are looking for an engineer who works best in a team, is eager to learn and can identify and diagnose problems in large bodies of complex code. In this team at Splunk, we work to continually improve the product based on requirements and defects reported by Support, Customer Success and Field Organisations. We work in Australia and around the world to deliver fixes to customer with rapid turnaround time and high quality. Are you ready to start your career with Splunk?
Here’s a taste of what you will do
Implement major features identified through our program of work.
Implement minor enhancements as requested by customers from requirements gathering through delivery.
Investigate and implement fix to resolve product defects in the server components in an efficient and responsive manner.
Collaborate with stakeholders across different locations including global engineering, support, escalation managers, and QA.
You have
A degree in a computer science related area.
2+ years of experience as a Software Engineer in developing and troubleshooting multi-threaded server applications.
Experience in C++ and python coding languages.
Experience with git.
Strong analytical mindset and experience debugging and troubleshooting including use of tools.
An understanding of network communication and protocols e.g. TCP/IP, HTTP would be a plus.
Experience with sustaining and maintenance of enterprise software is highly desired.
Demonstrate passion towards customer success.
You may have worked on:
A project around the areas of big data, searching and statistical modelling
Maintenance of enterprise software.
Indexing, ingesting and searching of big data.
What we provide
A team of incredibly capable and dedicated peers, all the way from engineering to product management and customer support.
A stable, collaborative, and supportive work environment. We work in an open environment, work together to get things done, and adapt to the changing needs for the team. We keep it real by being open and honest. We are a collaborative team that understands the value in open communication—it's how we interact with our customers.
Balance. We don't expect people to work 12-hour days. We want you to be successful outside of work too. We trust our colleagues to be responsible with their time and commitment, and believe that balance helps cultivate a positive environment.
Fun. We are committed to having every employee want to give it their all, be respectful and a part of the family, and have a smile on their face while doing it.
Remote working. We believe that working remotely actually enhances productivity!

We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.

The Opportunity

IDEXX are currently seeking x3 Casual Veterinary Laboratory Assistant to work within our Herd Health Screening Department alongside our Veterinary Laboratory Scientists. Working as part of a team our Laboratory Assistant contributes to the delivery of a timely, effective and efficient diagnostic pathology services in Brisbane, IDEXX’s largest laboratory across Australia & New Zealand. Key responsibilities include but are not limited to specimen reception, routine diagnostic testing, quality control, general laboratory duties, instrument maintenance and general maintenance.

The Successful candidate will have…

Ideally a Bachelor of Medical Science/or equivalent degree – or working towards obtaining a degree in these fields.

Experience in a medical laboratory setting– a minimum one (1) year previous experience is highly desirable.

Experience within a core laboratory, with multi-discipline exposure is desirable

Intermediate PC & data entry skills are essential.

Demonstrated ability to follow and adhere to policies and practices.

Experience in operating efficiently and effectively to meet tight turnaround times in a commercial lab environment.

Passion for providing exceptional customer service.

Attention to detail and excellent communication skills.

Commitment to our IDEXX values, diligent attention to our Quality system and Health & Safety policies/procedures.

What we can offer?

In return, this role offers an opportunity to join a global market leader that continues to reinvest $100M per annum into research and development devoted to veterinary diagnostics.

Most importantly, this role offers you an opportunity to make a difference and positively impact the community alongside a fantastic local team who pursue our purpose with passion.

We are committed to your ongoing development with our education support initiatives, we provide ongoing health and wellness activities, and voluntary community leave entitlements.

Why IDEXX:
Across the globe the team at IDEXX are focused on enhancing the health and well-being of pets, people, and livestock. We work to raise the standard of care for all animals, make drinking water safe for billions and keep our livestock population healthy and free of disease. What we do each day is more than just a job and that creates an energy which is contagious. We live and work in an incredible environment full of passionate and committed people.
If you are passionate about making a difference and being rewarded for your efforts, please APPLY directly on the website to be considered. Alternatively, send through your queries anz-careers@idexx.com.

Based at our stunning beachfront location in Coolangatta, with a hybrid work from home opportunity, a role within this reputable organisation and industry, will shape an exciting next step, in your career journey. NRMA Parks and Resorts is a wholly-owned subsidiary of the National Roads and Motoring Association (NRMA) - keeping people moving for 100 years. Our expanding portfolio of owned and managed holiday parks currently features 48 holiday parks and resorts in iconic tourism locations around Australia.
NRMA Parks and Resorts has recently invested in a sophisticated new data platform to assist us on our future journey to provide market leading guest experiences.

The Role:

To support our future growth, we are looking to onboard an experienced data analyst as an integral part of our team, reporting to the General Manager Customer, Marketing and Sales. If successful, you will manage all aspects of our new data platform, including undertaking analysis of customer data to drive key insights to inform our guest experience, membership, marketing campaigns and operational strategy. This is an opportunity to use your skills in data analysis and segmentation to empower our team to deliver exceptional guest experiences.

Key responsibilities include:
Analysis of data sets, identify trends, share insights and make recommendations
Designing effective, user-centered reports, dashboards and visualisations
Assisting with the refinement and measurement of guest lifetime value, segmentation, and propensity model use cases
Measuring media effectiveness
Supporting the revenue team in understanding guest insights and trends
Assisting with data validation analysis and in enhancing our Google Cloud Platform (GCP) implementation
Adopting an agile delivery approach through continuous development of GCP, resulting market segmentation, reports, visualisation, and dashboards
Analysis of web and commercial data sets to identify trends and patterns
Identifying workflow automation opportunities
Preparing and maintaining technical documentation and an up-to-date repository
How Do You Measure Up?
Minimum of 3 years’ experience in a similar role
Experience working in a fast paced, ever-changing environment
Passion and enthusiasm for providing an exceptional customer experience and all things digital
Tertiary qualifications in a relevant field including Computer Science, Engineering, Finance or Economics (desirable)
Knowledge and experience in the travel and tourism industry (desirable)
The Perks!
Friendly hybrid working environment
Discounted NRMA insurances, FREE Premium Roadside Assist, FREE NRMA Blue Membership and other NRMA Benefits
Accommodation discounts with all NRMA Parks and Resorts across Australia


Please Note: All successful positions at NRMA Parks and Resorts will be subject to a mandatory pre-employment screening process

Located in QLD – Burleigh Heads; NSW – Wetherill Park; Vic – Keysborough; WA – Welshpool
Competitive hourly rate
Seeking Diploma or Bachelor qualified EMTs, PTOs, Paramedics and other pre-hospital emergency care practitioners
Certificate IV in Training and Assessment desired but not essential

About Us
Australian Paramedical College is Australia’s leading provider of vocational education in pre-hospital care. We are proud to deliver in-demand industry skills to grow and support Australia’s healthcare network.
We go above and beyond to ensure the quality of our graduating students, who become leaders in their industry, working as private sector medics, patient transport officers or continuing further University study to become state paramedics.
We have nationwide reach across both students and industry employer partners, and our expansive and high-quality training facilities, student support and training teams are unmatched in the sector.
We strive to innovate and use evidence-based data to ensure we deliver industry-leading training and outstanding support to our students.

About the Role
We are currently recruiting several qualified pre-hospital emergency care practitioners to assist deliver face-to-face training via our Student Workshop Program for Certificate III, Certificate IV, and Diploma students. These roles are offered casually within standard business hours, across various rosters, with workshop delivery from February through November.
Each pre-set workshop is delivered and supervised by our qualified Trainers and Assessors. This role will support the Trainer and Assessor by demonstrating essential skills and guiding small groups within workshops of between 10 to 20 students.
Our students learn a diverse range of skills at the Certificate and Diploma levels, including CPR and defibrillation, IM injections, IV cannulation, basic airway adjuncts, three-lead ECG interpretation, and manual handling. All skills are delivered in line with current best practices and are within the skill sets of Diploma and Bachelor qualified practitioners.

About You
To be successful in this position, you will be able to demonstrate:
Essential Requirements
Industry qualifications: Bachelor of Paramedicine or HLT51015 Diploma of Paramedical Science or equivalent.
Current or recent workplace experience in a pre-hospital emergency health care setting.
The ability to maintain standard clinical pre-hospital care competencies.
Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills
A kind, empathetic and respectful approach to teaching students
Honesty, integrity, and a positive approach

Optional but highly regarded requirements
TAE40116 Certificate IV in Training and Assessment or TAE 50111 Diploma of Vocational Education and Training OR TAESS00014 Enterprise Trainer-Presenting Skill Set OR willingness to obtain
Training and education experience, preferably in the Vocational Education and Training sector and with pre-hospital emergency care students

TAESS00014 Enterprise Trainer-Presenting Skill Set
The TAESS00014 can be obtained online from numerous providers, and we are able to assist you with any skills demonstration components of the certification.
For example, see https://accellier.edu.au/can-i-train-in-rto-without-tae-cert-iv/.
Apply Now!
Apply today if you believe you meet the criteria and are ready to join our fantastic team!
Australian Paramedical College is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage all applications. We are committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive work environment.
Australian Paramedical College (Industry Pathways Pty Ltd, RTO 32513)

Ready to apply?
Email your resume to hr@apcollege.edu.au to be considered.

Company: Great Barrier Reef Marine Park Authority
Job Descriptions:
Classification: EL1
Closing Date: 15/08/22
Location: Townsville, QLD / Canberra, ACT
The Position
We are seeking an accomplished writer and natural resource management professional to join a small multi-disciplinary team working on the next edition of the Great Barrier Reef Outlook Report. The report is a statutory requirement, produced every five years examining the Great Barrier Reef’s health, pressures, and likely future. The next Outlook Report is due mid-2024. The report will for the first time be delivered in a fully online format, with some requirement for a companion printed version that is tabled in parliament.
The position will be responsible for leading content preparation (particularly writing, quality control and editing), sourcing and synthesising data and coordinating content with other team members. This position will work closely with Agency staff, the science community, Indigenous knowledge holders and stakeholders. We are seeking an individual who has excellent interpersonal and communication skills and can comprehend and synthesise large volumes of data (including scientific findings) and transfer that into easy to read science communication products.
The ideal candidate will be an effective team player, with strong project management skills, analysis skills and initiative. A good eye for detail is critical while also balancing the need to craft engaging content for a general audience.
Non-ongoing - Specified task/term until 30 August 2024; Full-time
The Person
You enjoy writing, can produce text quickly, and can write for a range of audiences.
You are an excellent proof-reader and editor and respond constructively to feedback and
change requests.
You thrive under pressure and don’t get flustered when faced with competing priorities.
You are a supportive and cheerful team member who is personally resilient.
You are willing to contribute to a wide variety of task types (high and low level) to achieve required outcomes.
You have the proven ability to work collaboratively with individuals, stakeholders, the science community and management.
Duties
Lead the preparation of high quality science communication and information products for government and stakeholders around the 2024 Outlook Report.
Coordinate quality control of Outlook Report content through editing, proof reading, readability and informing the presentation of data and infographics.
Provide high-level project management services, work collaboratively across the team, contribute to other tasks within the section as necessary, including review of documents.
Review, analyse, interpret and synthesise relevant data, scientific and technical reports into engaging clear content which informs policy and marine park management.
Engage, consult and collaborate with internal and external stakeholders and service providers to source information and review content.
As an APS employee you may be reassigned to a different set of duties at the same classification level at the discretion of the agency head (CEO), taking account of operational requirements in the agency.
Eligibility requirements & qualifications
Essential requirements
Have a good understanding of the purpose of the Outlook Report, its structure, and strategic context.
Have proven high-level content provision skills and ability to produce engaging, evidence-based, plain language content in the style of previous Outlook Reports.
Have a proven ability to see the big picture and communicate concepts and information logically.
Have the ability to work independently to progress own work tasks as well as contributing to team-based efforts as needed.
Desirable qualifications or equivalent experience
Tertiary qualifications or extensive experience in natural resource management or science,
Ability to travel, sometimes multiple nights at a time.
Preparing your application
You will be required to prepare a response document (“pitch”) in MSWord or PDF format using standard margins and size 11 Arial font.
Please prepare a ‘pitch’, which does not exceed two pages, in relation to the advertised role, outlining:
how your experience, abilities, knowledge and personal qualities would enable you to perform the duties and meet the technical and behavioural capabilities of the role,
any specific examples or achievements that demonstrate your ability to perform the role,
how you meet the eligibility requirements and qualifications for the position.
Your application must include;
a completed Applicant Details Form (located on the GBRMPA Tools and Tips page)
your ‘pitch’ (as described above)
proof of Australian citizenship
a current curriculum vitae (resume) that includes
an outline of your career history
qualifications and/or formal/informal training relevant to the position
contact details for at least two recent referees, one of whom should be your current supervisor
RecruitAbility applies to this vacancy. Under the RecruitAbility scheme, you will be invited to participate in further assessment activity for the vacancy if you choose to apply under the scheme; declare you have a disability; and meet the minimum requirements for the job. For more information visit: https://www.apsc.gov.au/recruitability
If you require any reasonable adjustments throughout the recruitment process please email XXX

11.59pm AEST, Monday 15 August 2022
Contact Officer - Maddison Gillam – (07) 3023 1034
Sending your application

Anonyome Labs is creating a world in which people have exclusive control over their personal data.
We’re changing the privacy and cybersafety paradigm—and resolving the greatest challenges consumers and enterprises face.
Through our products, MySudo consumer app and Sudo Platform business privacy toolkit, we empower everyday users to decide when, where and with whom they share their personal information, and we help enterprises rapidly develop and deploy branded privacy and cybersafety solutions for their customers.
In developing the Sudo digital identity at the heart of our products, we wanted to do something that hasn’t been done before — because that’s what the global fight for data privacy will demand from us all: out of the box thinking and .
If you want to join us at the leading edge of data privacy, apply to join our team now. There’s never been a better time.
We are looking for experienced developers to join our iOS team, responsible for architecting and developing our next generation of Sudo mobile apps for the global consumer market. You will be joining a high powered experienced team, following agile development principles, and who value well-designed software, creative thinking and thrive on solving the unsolvable. You will be working on technology spanning mobile communications (voice, messaging, email), and fintech/payments all underpinned by strong security and privacy principles.
This is a fantastic opportunity to work at a well established global start-up, working with some of the global leaders in the security and privacy space located in our local Gold Coast development lab and US headquarters.
Must-haves:
Degree in Computer Science or related field
At least 4 years of extensive experience in iOS development for customer-facing apps
Thorough knowledge of Swift, including advanced topics such as generics, protocols and custom operators
Familiarity with Objective-C
History of shipping successful consumer-focused apps
Experience implementing and maintaining unit tests
Ability to develop maintainable, well-designed software under tight deadlines
Strong communication skills
Passion for solving hard problems
Interest in privacy and the protection of personal information
Australian citizenship or permanent residency
Bonus points:
Experience working with a non-iOS programming languages and platforms
Experience developing with security APIs and technologies
Experience working at a startup
Finally, we expect you to score extremely high on our "Stuff That Matters":
Enhancing Privacy
Privacy is at Our Core
Growing as One team
Work Inclusively, Embrace Diversity, Succeed Together
Sharing Insights
Information empowers our decision making
Taking Ownership
Own it, enjoy it, learn from it
Feeding Curiosity
Always learning
We offer company stock options, private health insurance allowance, cool office space, catered lunches, fun exciting work environment overlooking the beach of the Gold Coast, and the opportunity to learn from leading privacy and security experts with a combined patent filing count of 60+ in the privacy/security area. If you’re interested in changing the world, we’d love to talk to you.

DATA SCIENTIST
Join a growing team at the forefront of exploration technology
Excellent range of employee benefits and incentives
Brisbane or Perth based opportunity
About the role
All progress begins with Pioneers. At Rio Tinto, it begins with you.
We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our Exploration Data Science Team to develop insights on where in the world we should explore and help us discover better deposits faster. Working as part of a global team in Rio Tinto Exploration (RTX), you will enable data integration, remove silos, connect workflows and conduct general data wrangling of complex datasets.
This is a great opportunity for a data scientist to work at the forefront of technology in a diverse and rapidly evolving field. We have a rich and rapidly growing repository of data to help map, prioritize and test the best minerals targets around the globe - from surface geochemistry, airborne geophysics, satellite remote sensing and drillhole spectral scanning data, to social and environmental data. This role is key to the future of our business.
Our exploration technical knowledge team within the Rio Tinto Exploration business, is responsible for transforming the way we find, evaluate and mine resources by developing
We are an open, connected global team that includes some of the industry’s best and brightest minds. We offer competitive, performance-focused remuneration and a wide range of benefits to reward your contribution. With a global reach, the opportunities to develop and grow your career are broad and exciting.
Reporting to the Regional Exploration Data Science Lead [Australasia], working in an exciting and challenging environment, you will:
Perform exploratory analysis of data sets to develop and refine the preliminary hypothesis
Develop interfaces that visualize information for business users
Provide expertise on statistical, mathematical, and machine learning concepts and conduct research, design, implement and validate cutting-edge algorithms and predictive statistical models
Help shape the Exploration data science team, while inspiring and supporting a growing community of citizen data scientists across Rio Tinto Exploration
Apply disciplined governance and quality assurance across projects; promote compliance with standardised processes, systems and tools
Provide expert technical support and direction to project stakeholders, building on and sharing the lessons learnt
Support training and development opportunities to ensure high quality expertise within the team
Engage with clients and key stakeholders to build their understanding of data analytics and address key issues
Disseminate results to help foster a new generation of data-driven decision makers
Capture and record the intellectual property generated as the result of the application of analytical approaches
What you will bring
Degree in Geosciences, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related quantitative discipline combined with experience in data science projects, preferably using agile methodologies (preferred but not required)
Proficient in Python and/or R for data processing, statistical analysis, modeling, machine learning and visualization and skilled in writing SQL querie
Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages and packages with Python (Sci-kit Learn, numpy, pandas, Tensorflow, Keras), R, Matlab, SQL
Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics regression, classification, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision tree, neural networks, NLP, etc.
Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders using Matplotlib, ggplot, Seaborn, Bokeh, Plotly, D3, Tableau , Shiny, Streamlit, etc.
Cloud experience (e.g. AWS s3, AWS Sagemaker and/or Azure)
Experience solving spatial and or geoscientific problems is preferred
Ability to inspire, motivate and empower others to achieve their best
Natural curiosity and passion for data science and engineering, including practical experience leveraging data science to deliver insights
A commitment to the safety of yourself and your team
What we offer
A safety-focused and inclusive working environment
A competitive salary package with annual cash incentive awards (STIP)
Access to top tier family-friendly health and medical programs
Excellent retirement plan
A comprehensive leave policy that covers all moments that matter in life (vacation/annual, paid parental leave, short term sick leave, paid holidays)
Ongoing individual wellbeing support for you and your family for personal and professional matters
Generous Rio Tinto employee share program
Where you’ll be working
At Rio Tinto Exploration, we are investing in growth for the future – starting with the exploration for new sources of essential materials. Our talented team of explorers are constantly searching the world, seeking to create value for the business by discovering and acquiring economically, socially and environmentally sustainable resources. We have 63 programmes in eight commodities across 16 countries.
We’re focused on fast-tracking technologies, data and using analytical insights to unlock value and improve the effectiveness and efficiency at every stage of the exploration process. We’re looking for a diverse team of leaders in technology and data science experts to drive our technology strategy and create viable discovery opportunities for Rio Tinto.
About Rio Tinto
Every idea, every innovation, every little thing the world calls ‘progress’ begins with a first step, and someone willing to take it: explorers, inventors, entrepreneurs. Pioneers.
For nearly 150 years, Rio Tinto has been a company of pioneers – generations of people spanning the globe, all with the grit and vision to produce materials essential to human progress.
Our iron ore has shaped skylines from Shanghai to Sydney. Our aluminium – the world’s first to be certified “responsible” – helps planes fly and makes cars lighter. Our copper helps wind turbines power cities and our boron helps feed the world, and explore the universe.
Our diamonds help us celebrate the best parts of life.
Every Voice Matters
We are committed to an inclusive environment where people feel comfortable to be themselves. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome – they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity regardless of race, gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual orientation or anything else that makes us different.
At Rio Tinto, we particularly welcome and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, women, the LGBTI+ community, mature workers, people with disabilities and people from different cultural backgrounds.
Applications close on 7th August 2022 (Rio Tinto reserves the right to remove advertised roles prior to this date)

Why Youi?
Advance your Career with a Prominent Organisation
Flexible / Remote work arrangements
Generous study policy
Insurance for Individuals
Since Youi emerged in Australia in 2008 we have built a strong brand through awesome customer service, tailoring products to individuals and challenging our competitors to do better. We value both our people and technology, and our IT department of more than 150 passionate Youiers is testament to us taking our tech and business growth seriously. With over 1,700 employees, and gross written premium exceeding $1billion, we have ambitious goals to keep growing and continue delivering awesome insurance solutions across new products and distribution channels, backed by industry leading customer experience.
About the role
Our Actuarial Department is where the data analysis and reporting takes place. The role of Senior Actuarial Analyst means that you will add value to the company by applying actuarial principles to all the important business and department problems through analytics, portfolio monitoring and best pricing and underwriting practice. This position contributes towards Youi’s ability to achieve its strategic goals via the teams OKRs by creating value, reducing costs and building efficiencies. The role includes participating in the delivery of effective and profitable rating and underwriting.
You will be tasked with the analysis of data relating to actuarial risk factors and the wider business. To excel in this role you will have an in depth understanding of key data sources and effectively manipulate these for analysis. You can expect to be dealing with people from right across the organisation.
Key responsibilities include:
Effectively prepare data for modelling purposes and build models in Emblem, Python, R and SAS
Determine claims frequency and claims size models as a basis for pricing recommendations
Monitor and identify opportunities to improve portfolio performance
Contribute to the enhancements of systems, including pricing and underwriting systems as well as the overall sales and policy system
Lead statistical modelling projects from data preparation, modelling outcomes, price recommendation, system implementation and documentation of the modelling process
Feel comfortable presenting analysis to Senior Management
Provide support to (Graduate) Actuarial Analysts
The successful candidate will ideally have:
Relevant Bachelor Degree in Actuarial Science or related studies.
Preferred qualification:
Progress in Part I exams towards qualification as an Actuary.
Progress on Part II exams or post graduate degree. Fully (or nearly) qualified Actuary
Approximately 3 - 5 years’ experience in an actuarial role
Experience in programming languages such as SQL, SAS, R, Python and C# preferred
Experience using Willis Towers Watson pricing software Emblem preferred
Knowledge of advanced actuarial concepts
Understanding of general insurance concepts
Curiosity to explore profit and growth opportunities and provide insights and recommendations to convince management to change pricing, underwriting and product
Strong attention to detail
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
The ability to work effectively within a team environment
The Youi Difference
We’re well known for having one of the best company cultures in Australia and this extends into the Actuarial team, how we interact with each other, and with the broader business. Whether it’s chatting to our CEO in the elevator (who favours shorts and t-shirt!) or sharing your favourite camping spots with a colleague whilst waiting for your haircut or massage at The Hub at HQ, everyone is warm, friendly, and approachable and you’ll love getting to know the talented people that call Youi home. We live and breathe our Human value and embrace flexible working, with a focus on employee wellbeing. We believe when you’re feeling your best, you’ll do your best work and that means awesome outcomes for our customers and our community
Don’t miss this opportunity to join a fast moving, innovative Actuarial Team -

Job Title: EL 2 (S&T Level 6) - Research Cloud and Compute
Job Descriptions:
The Role
As a critical member of the Digital Research Infrastructure directorate, you will manage a team of cloud engineers and work collaboratively to provide secure cloud and compute systems, solutions, systems support and related technology required to meet researcher needs.
You will work closely with the Discipline Leads in the Computational & Data Intensive Sciences directorate to ensure that there is strategic service alignment and day to day service alignment to ensure that the cloud and compute service offerings are fit for purpose and meet DSTG’s strategic initiatives.
You will engage with and co-operate with researchers to help inform and shape the cloud and compute service provision and service offerings.
You will lead all aspects of the delivery of cloud and compute technology including the provision of guidance on the selection and application of fit-for-purpose technology solutions. This will include relevant aspects of the provision of secure capabilities for major projects.
Key Duties:
Lead and drive innovation in research cloud and compute platforms to support research initiatives.
Lead the day to day delivery of research cloud and compute services and technology needed to meet Defence and National Security research goals in the most efficient and effective manner.
Work closely with the Discipline Leader High Performance Computing (HPC) Services and Technology to ensure relevant alignment of architecture, technology, system compatibility and service integration between HPC and research cloud/compute to provide a reliable and secure software foundation for Defence S&T and their partners to develop digital research together.
Provide innovative problem-solving approaches that enhance the cloud and compute technical capabilities and service offerings.
Accountable for the availability, reliability, security and integrity of secure cloud and computer systems.
Mentor staff in the development of technical, project, and related organisational/support skills.
Manage vendor relationships.
About our Team
The Digital Research Infrastructure (DRI) team, as part of the wider Scientific Computing (SC) branch, enables and accelerates Defence science and technology research and protects assets in DSTG’s digital research environments. SC does this by provisioning and supporting scientific computing infrastructure that is well-managed, sustainable and scalable; continuing to invest in innovative centralised digital research infrastructure and services, while divesting commodity distributed ICT infrastructure and services; and developing new Scientific Computing practises and technologies. The DRI directorate provides secure, effective and efficient digital research and eResearch infrastructure and related systems where a sovereign capability is required for Defence’s S&T capabilities.
Our Ideal Candidate
The Discipline Leader Research Cloud and Compute will ideally be a highly experienced leader able to develop, deliver and sustain a complex world-class portfolio of secure compute and cloud infrastructure systems.
We are looking for a communicator and collaborator who will be able to understand the needs of our varied customers and stakeholders and produce results according to their requirements. The right person for this role will show the flexibility to respond to the changing context and shifting priorities of stakeholders and have the agility to realign resourcing and infrastructure to meet that demand. They will be a leader who provides support and guidance to their team to ensure they are sensitive to Defence needs and direction.
Application Closing Date: Monday 29 August, 2022
For further information please review the job information pack, reference DSTG/04109/22 on https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=425A8A26-ADDC-53B9-DAA8-C8BCCA3184A6.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $123,000.00 – $148,000.00 per year
Schedule:
8 hour shift

Aurizon is seeking Graduates for our 2023 Graduate Campaign!
Our Graduates are permanent employees at Aurizon and this program provides an opportunity to develop technical and leadership capability across areas of our business. Graduates are offered diverse opportunities, flexibility, building of networks, professional challenges and a supportive career path in a top 100 ASX listed company. This program will build strong foundations for a successful future.
A dedicated mentor & supportive environment
Structured, individualised development program focused on both personal and professional skills
Graduate challenge, working in multi-disciplined teams presenting innovative solutions for Aurizon’s future
If candidates have already graduated there may be an opportunity to start at Aurizon earlier than January 2023.
Current Brisbane Opportunity- Graduate Data Science
As a Data Scientist Graduate you will be joining an established and high performing data, reporting and analytics team. This team comprises of data engineers, report developers and data scientists who work together to deliver real world business insights. The data science team has established a wide variety of solutions that harness machine learning, constraint modelling and neural networks which are used to deliver actionable insights and process automation. You will be supported by an experienced team of data scientists, as well as the wider data, reporting and analytics team, who will help the graduate elevate their skills to the next level. They will get opportunities to experiment on high volume sensor, GIS and enterprise data to further enrich their data scientist capabilities. We are also transitioning to our next generation analytics platform which will open the possibilities to the latest cutting-edge platforms.
You will develop and deliver innovative and comprehensive insights, undertake complex analysis, and implement advanced analytical capabilities that enable Aurizon to achieve it’s strategic, operational, and commercial objectives.
About Aurizon Graduates:
We are seeking Graduates who can build great leadership skills as well as develop their technical capability
Graduates who want to grow their career in Aurizon and are flexible to work in the regional communities where Aurizon operates
Have ambition and demonstrate both exceptional interpersonal and communication skills. Most importantly have the passion and drive to succeed
You must have successfully completed an undergraduate degree or higher qualification that is bachelor level or above, and completed your relevant qualification by December 2022
You must be an Australian Citizen, Australian Permanent Resident or New Zealand citizen who has entered Australia on a valid passport and has unrestricted rights to employment
Our Recruitment Process:
We pride ourselves on a recruitment process that is inclusive and one that allows our applicants multiple opportunities to shine. This process will potentially involve online testing, video screening, an assessment centre and pre-employment checks including reference checking and medical. Please monitor your emails (including your junk mail) so you do not miss out.
Benefits:
At Aurizon, we support the development and growth of our employees to reach their full potential. With a National portfolio of operations, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with long term and exciting career opportunities. Some of our benefits include:
Development and growth opportunities
Access to female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander mentoring programs
Discounts on selected health insurance funds, personal travel, gyms, vehicles and retail brands
Parental Leave Program and Super Booster
To learn about us and our company values visit www.aurizon.com.au/careers
Advertised: 26 Jul 2022 E. Australia Standard Time
Applications close: 09 Aug 2022 E. Australia Standard Time

We are also transitioning to our next generation analytics platform which will open the possibilities to the latest cutting-edge platforms.
You will develop and deliver innovative and comprehensive insights, undertake complex analysis, and implement advanced analytical capabilities that enable Aurizon to achieve it’s strategic, operational, and commercial objectives.
About Aurizon Graduates:
We are seeking Graduates who can build great leadership skills as well as develop their technical capability
Graduates who want to grow their career in Aurizon and are flexible to work in the regional communities where Aurizon operates
Have ambition and demonstrate both exceptional interpersonal and communication skills. Most importantly have the passion and drive to succeed
You must have successfully completed an undergraduate degree or higher qualification that is bachelor level or above, and completed your relevant qualification by December 2022
You must be an Australian Citizen, Australian Permanent Resident or New Zealand citizen who has entered Australia on a valid passport and has unrestricted rights to employment
Our Recruitment Process:
We pride ourselves on a recruitment process that is inclusive and one that allows our applicants multiple opportunities to shine. This process will potentially involve online testing, video screening, an assessment centre and pre-employment checks including reference checking and medical. Please monitor your emails (including your junk mail) so you do not miss out.
Benefits:
At Aurizon, we support the development and growth of our employees to reach their full potential. With a National portfolio of operations, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with long term and exciting career opportunities. Some of our benefits include:
Development and growth opportunities
Access to female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander mentoring programs
Discounts on selected health insurance funds, personal travel, gyms, vehicles and retail brands
Parental Leave Program and Super Booster
To learn about us and our company values visit www.aurizon.com.au/careers
Advertised: 26 Jul 2022 E. Australia Standard Time
Applications close: 09 Aug 2022 E. Australia Standard Time

Your Job
We are looking for strong Technical Fellows to help shape the future of our engineering organization.
The Job Seeker organization within Indeed is responsible for one of Indeed’s core businesses. Our mission is to “Build engineering systems to understand all workers, understand all jobs, deliver the best jobs to job seekers, and help job seekers get closer to being hired.”
As a thought leader at Indeed you will have numerous opportunities to shape how we evolve our products to better match job seekers with jobs. Your technical leadership will guide the future of job search and help millions of job seekers find better jobs. You will have the opportunity to influence engineering direction across a broad set of areas including search, ranking and relevance, data platform and profile, and job applications.
If you are an engineer who's passionate about building innovative products that scale to tens of millions of pageviews a day and to help people find jobs globally, we are looking for you.
Who You Are
You're someone who wants to see the impact of your work making a difference every day. You understand how to use data to make decisions. You are someone who finds passion in the craft, someone constantly seeking improvement and a better way to solve tough problems. You have a passion for producing the highest quality code as well as leading others to do the same.
You are someone who either has built or is passionate about building scalable, reliable systems that span multiple data centers as well as AWS and handle millions of requests every day.
Responsibilities:
Architect and plan solutions across the Indeed platform spanning multiple teams and organizations.
Partner with senior leadership to develop long term technical vision and strategy.
Design new software systems and enhancements to existing systems to support substantial new software features and products.
Work with Product Managers, Designers, Data Scientists, Test & Software Engineers, and other stakeholders to clarify requirements and to decompose large requests into smaller ones that can be executed sequentially or in parallel.
Provide sound technical guidance, ensure product quality, and help set the technical direction for the team.
Research, experiment, and develop new innovations as well as product and platform improvements that improve jobseeker experiences.
Contribute to the product roadmap, technology, and vision while creating a culture of quality and operational excellence on the team.
Demonstrate strong technical leadership and leverage your years of hands-on technical engineering experience to hold the organization to a high standard of technical excellence.
Share expertise on products and technologies by mentoring other engineers and by providing insightful feedback in code reviews for changes made by other engineers.
Investigate and resolve difficult problems and fix complex bugs; accept escalations of complex issues.
Assist other engineers in designing solutions, prioritizing work items, estimating urgency and business impact, and balancing short-term and long-term results.
Solve deep as well as broad technical problems.
Qualifications
15+ years of experience with large-scale Internet software development
5+ years of experience working in an individual contributor leadership role
Experience influencing a geographically-distributed global software engineering organization comprising hundreds of teams
Experience leading through influence and delivering predictable results in complex organizations
Experience with cloud architectures, hybrid cloud-metal architectures, and AWS native services
Experience with service-oriented, data-centric, event-driven, and high-performance distributed system architectures
BS in computer science , other technical fields or equivalent.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with large-scale consumer Internet systems, including large-scale experimentation
Experience with scaled machine learning, including data and feature engineering
Familiarity with data-driven product development
Who we are
We are a rapidly growing and highly-capable Engineering organization building the most popular job site on the planet. With engineering hubs in Seattle, San Francisco, Austin, Tokyo, Singapore, Hyderabad, Dublin, Aberdeen and Vancouver, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job search at a time.
Our Mission
As the world’s number 1 job site*, our mission is to help people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers.

(*comScore Total Visits, September 2021)
Salary Range Disclaimer
The base salary range represents the low and high end of the Indeed salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Indeed's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include quarterly bonuses, Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), an open Paid Time Off policy, and many region-specific benefits.
Salary Range Transparency
Sydney 241,000 - 349,000 AUD per year
Equal Opportunities and Accommodations Statement
Indeed is deeply committed to creating a workplace and global community where inclusion is not only valued, but prioritized. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, family status, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, neurodiversity, disability, age, or any other non-merit based or legally protected grounds.
