Date: 31-Jul-2022

Location:
Brisbane, QLD, AU

Department: Consulting

Description:
Job Requisition ID: 27740

About the team

Big data, information and analytics. Three words that spark apprehension in most businesses. But our team of experts are constantly curious and excited about combining our wonderful array of technological expertise to transform data into our clients’ most valuable assets, making their work smarter.

We primarily seek to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of organisations at all stages of the data transformation journey from designing the change required, to delivering and managing that change and providing assurance around change initiatives.

You will be an integral part of one of the fastest growing teams in Australia and build best in class data & AI solutions.

This role is for the AI & Automation team, which sits within the Data & AI, Strategy Analytics & Transformation in Deloitte Consulting.

What will your typical day look like?

As a Senior Consultant in our Data & AI team, focussing on Analytics & AI strategy, you will use your consulting skills to help clients make the right choices and take the right actions towards better use of Analytics and AI to achieve their business goals. As technical, strategy and industry experts, we understand clients’ challenges and define compelling strategies to meet their vision for becoming insight driven. A Senior Consultant will develop compelling interactions and presentations to showcases strategies, operating models and transformational business cases to clients across a range of industries, including Financial Services, Insurance, Government, Energy & Resources, Life Sciences & Healthcare, Telecommunications and Consumer Products.

Provide advisory services to business leaders and align AI, analytics, automation or data solutions to clients’ needs and develop an objectives, strategies and approaches that help clients transform
Build solid foundations of a business case and key recommendations for implementing analytical solutions for the client in alignment with their business agenda and strategic drivers
Analyse and evaluate current systems and structures of organisations where required, advising on business restructures, appropriate methods for collecting and analysing data and developing informed recommendations that shape or support the client’s business strategy
Comprehend and learn about client’s current business state, competitors’ point(s) of differentiation, industry landscape to support the identification, evaluation and selection of solutions that most effectively support clients’ strategic and business objectives
Conduct gap analysis on client’s current business landscape (i.e. operating model, business processes) to identify and define key recommendations and opportunities to uplift business performance
Design and assist with implementation plans for approved recommendations. Managing the delivery and provisioning of
Apply knowledge of best practices and latest yet effective trends to design a strategic and business transformation plan that delivers on client’s strategic growth agenda and gain client’s buy-in to the transformation plan
Assist with implementing approved recommendations in transformation plan, including provision of procedure and supporting documentation
Plan and carry out assigned business analysis activities within engagement timeframes and budget, to ensure implemented solutions meet business requirements and enhance efficiencies

Enough about us, let’s talk about you.


Experience developing business unit or organizational level data or technology strategy within a consulting or industry environment
Ability to structure, break down and solve complex problems through synthesis of information, quantitative thinking and analysis
Ability to interpret analysis and modelling results in a business context and provide commercially foucssed recommendations to inform business decisions
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, capable of working effectively with people at all levels in an organization
Strong sense of ownership of outcomes with the drive to self-start and take initiative
A passion for working collaboratively with diverse teams, and to create an including environment for everyone
Ability to structure and facilitate client stakeholder interviews

The minimum salary requirement for this role is $95,000 inclusive of 10% superannuation.

Staff benefits and free parking
Career opportunities and room for development
Friendly team with a passion for science

ALS is using the power of testing to solve complex challenges. With a passion for science, we serve clients with data-driven insights for a safer and healthier world.
The Role
The Environmental Division operates a modern laboratory in Brisbane (Stafford) that is equipped with the latest in analytical technology. The business is seeking experienced Laboratory Technicians to become a part of a team that strives to exceed client expectations by delivering quality results on time and by maintaining strong relationships with their clients. The business has several full time and casual opportunities across day, afternoon & weekend shifts. Please indicate your preference in your cover letter.
The day to day
Responsibilities include:
Preparation and analysis of soil, water, and sediment – weighing, digesting, titrating, or solvent extraction of samples
Plate counting, microbiological sample preparation and testing
Ensuring that preparation and analytical procedures and associated tasks are conducted in accordance with ALS Quality Work Instructions
Organising designated tasks to maximise daily efficiencies
Completing all tasks within both the timeframe set by the Supervisor and the relevant analysis standard
Highlighting anomalies in results and sample type/behaviour
The essentials
The successful candidate will possess the following skills and abilities:
A genuine interest in the Science industry
Either TAFE or University qualifications desirable but not essential
A desire to work in a high-throughput, client-focused environment, with preference given to those with previous commercial laboratory experience
A keen interest or personal hobby in computer building, circuitry, Excel macros and/or 3D printing would be advantageous
Coding or programming skills would be desirable but not essential
Excellent attention to detail, organisational and time management skills
Dedication to good laboratory practices with regard to quality of results and health and safety
Flexibility to work public holidays, afternoon and weekend shifts; please indicate your availability in your cover letter
Willingness to be cross trained in other sections of the laboratory
Dedication to go the extra mile, be solutions driven and ensure there is no compromise on quality
The benefits
At ALS we believe that the people we employ are what makes ALS the great company it is today. We offer many benefits to staff, including and not limited to:
Health fund discounts with Bupa and HCF
Opportunity to salary sacrifice car costs with Autopia.
Corporate superannuation benefits with Australian Retirement Trust
Online learning system with extensive modules of choice.
Friendly working environment with accessible management.
Virgin Australia, Microsoft, Hertz and HCBC discounts.
Influenza Vaccinations and EAP services.
Opportunities to progress and develop your career within ALS including global opportunities for suitable candidates.

We actively support a diverse workforce and encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people to apply.

ABOUT THE ROLE
Based in our Brisbane head office
Manage incoming technical support requests and enquiries
Provide first line troubleshooting support
Manage CRM case creation and triage the request to the correct person
Effective asset management
Provide administrative and logistical support to the Operations, Technical Services, and Sales Teams
Process and organise delivery of spare parts to the Technical Services team
Work in an exciting entrepreneurial environment offering high-quality niche products and innovative solutions
ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY
We are seeking an enthusiastic technical support specialist to work in our world class facilities at Cannon Hill.
The ideal candidate would be a recent engineering or biomedical engineering graduate, or laboratory scientist who is looking to start their career in the commercial medical and diagnostic industry.
Develop your career with a company that truly celebrates and rewards your success through an annual awards night, bonus scheme, and generous salary package. This really is an outstanding opportunity to join an innovative, highly regarded company that offers excellent quality products to the Australian and New Zealand markets, where you can make a difference to people’s lives.
DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Management and maintenance of spare parts inventory
Accurate and timely Salesforce CRM data entry
Department administration duties
Carry out repairs and testing of customers’ equipment
Management of all spare parts processing for transfers, dispatch, invoicing, and stock checks
Carry out system preparations as required
Travel locally and internationally for training
Contribute to the organisational culture and continuous improvement of Abacus dx
Develop and maintain relationships with key opinion leaders and key customers in assigned territory
Represent the company at local and interstate customer sites
SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
Engineering or science qualification
Great teamwork skills
Proven administration skills
Varied system skills and experience with electronic and computer-driven systems
Drivers licence
Ability to work autonomously
Ability to interpret, present and communicate technical information
Analytical problem-solving skills
Interpersonal and relationship-building skills
Time management and prioritisation of tasks
DESIRABLE
Experience working with pathology or scientific instruments
Restricted electrical licence certification or the ability to obtain one
WE OFFER
Ongoing training and development
Fantastic working environment and team culture
Highly competitive salary, bonus structure and other benefits
ABOUT Abacus dx
Abacus dx is a leading distributor of medical diagnostic, healthcare education, and life science products. Our success is attributed to our dedication in sourcing high quality, niche products and by providing the highest levels of sales, marketing and technical support. We pride ourselves on our values: Inspire, Empower, Excel.
ABOUT Big Green Surgical
Big Green Surgical is a provider of specialised healthcare solutions across various surgical specialties throughout Australia and New Zealand. We represent 20 international suppliers of innovative products, supported by a caring and trusted team of industry professionals.
Please submit your application letter and detailed resume through the Seek website. Applications without a cover letter will not be considered. Please phone 1800 222 287 for further information.

Key Accountabilities

Use of current methodology to analyse gas samples associated with occupational health, environment and coal spontaneous combustion, by micro GC (gas chromatography) and GC.
Prepare test records, technical reports and associated communications to appropriate quality assurance standards. Experience in a NATA laboratory will be highly regarded.
Ensuring instrumentation is functioning efficiently and effectively using dedicated application software.
Using document and data handling packages to process instrument derived data, calculate test results and prepare test reports for clients. Demonstrated competence with Microsoft Excel will be highly regarded.
Assist in development and implementation of new laboratory procedures to facilitate sample analysis.
Training of mine site personnel in the use of mine gas monitoring systems based on micro GC technology.
Participate in all-hours provision of professional and technical support services relating to gas monitoring systems and safety in coal mines, particularly the assessment and evaluation of mine atmospheric conditions.
Liaise with clients to facilitate information transfer and to develop Simtars commercial activities
Actively participate in and contribute to the enhancement of Simtars' Quality, Health and Safety, and Environmental Certification System and other regulatory requirements
Other duties as directed and required.
Essential / desirable requirements

Evidence that you possess a degree/qualification in Applied Science in Chemistry, or equivalent in a relevant discipline.
Required to pass a medical which classifies them as fit to work in the mining industry without any restrictions
Applicants will be required to participate in an after-hours remote support roster.
Travel may be required (interstate and intrastate) and sometimes to remote locations/overseas.
Occasionally required to work outside of standard hours of work at short notice.
A manual drivers driver's license is essential for regional travel.

WORK TYPE:
Full Time
LOCATION:
Brisbane, Sydney
JOB TYPE:
Consulting and Strategy, Business Improvement, Other Consulting & Strategy, Process Improvement, Analysis and Reporting, All Leadership/Management, Business Performance
APPLICATIONS CLOSE:
Head of Commercial Acceleration Strategy
Head of Commercial Acceleration Strategy
Brisbane
Full time
Hello. We’re Virgin Australia. And we’re back (in a big way).
We’re the airline that’s always done things a little different. Our way. The Virgin way. For us, flying is so much more than simply taking off and landing (although we understand that is quite important). It’s about going the extra mile, in the air and on the ground, to create authentic experiences that put our guests firmly at the heart of everything we do.
The opportunity:
We are building a new team and we want you to lead these talented individuals. The Commercial Performance and Insights team reports to the Chief Commercial Officer, and work alongside other Commercial Divisions including Marketing, Revenue Management, Direct Distribution, SME and Sales. This is an incredible opportunity for a consulting manager looking to take the next step in their career and utilise the skills and strategic capabilities acquired across their career. The objective of the Head of Commercial Acceleration Strategy is to provide leadership in developing the broader commercial strategy and the transformation roadmap to achieve our aspiration, and proactively identify opportunities to accelerate value capture. You will act as a thought partner to the GM of Commercial Performance and Insights on prioritisation of effort across all commercial analyst.
This role will lead a team consisting of a Commercial Acceleration Manager and Analysts to deep-dive into these opportunities (i.e. special projects), through a 4-6 weeks sprint. These special projects will be in collaboration with relevant commercial functions and other teams within the Virgin Australia Group. For example, working closely with relevant Data Science teams to augment commercial analytics to drive commercial outcomes.
In addition, this role will play a critical role in stakeholder management and preparation of outputs to communicate recommendations, analysis and value capture.
Key responsibilities -
Lead the development of commercial strategy & transformation roadmap for the Commercial division to achieve the overarching revenue ambition, and how it translates across various commercial functions (channels, customer segments, marketing, revenue management) to achieve revenue ambition
Lead special projects and deep-dives for value acceleration capture
Proactively identify opportunities across commercial functions, and lead cross-functional coordination where required
Actively lead and support preparation for ELT/Board updates
Proactively work with internal stakeholders across the Commercial functions and across VA Group
Work closely with Finance, Network and Revenue Management team (e.g. revenue forecasting)
Proactively identify and scope commercial opportunities and lead the sizing of commercial benefits and investments, in collaboration with Commercial Leadership Team
Identify and manage risks and issues within project.
Proactively interrogate and analyse data to identify trends, gaps and opportunities, and understand drivers of commercial performance using Microsoft Excel, PowerBI and other analytical tools
The ideal candidate:
You will have 5-7 years' experience in top-tier management/strategy consulting and ready to take the next step in your career from a Project Leader/Manager/Senior Manger to the Head of Commercial Acceleration Strategy. You have a passion for commercial performance improvement strategy and proven implementation experience. You will have a proven ability to successfully lead teams and promote a data led culture, to allow effective decision making across the commercial division. Furthermore, you have a desire to proactively seek opportunities for elite business performance and take the initiative to explore in detail. You have a high level attention to detail, with respect to interrogation of data quality and the generation of commercial insights. You are comfortable working in a face paced environment and enjoy the variety in working across different divisions.
Experience and skills –
Relevant Bachelor degree (MBA or relevant post grad degree would be desirable)
5-7 years' experience in strategy/management consulting
Ability to synthesis insights into a management level narrative to drive decision making
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Excellent stakeholder management skills
Cross-industry benchmarking and application in sales and distribution performance
Strong excel skills (experience using BI tools would be desirable)
Having aviation/travel knowledge is not essential, however highly desirable
What you’ll get from us
We’re committed to looking after you, with some of the best benefits and conditions in the industry – including (but not limited to):
Heavily discounted air travel for you and your loved ones (including $1000 worth of travel credits per year)
Flexible working arrangements (including work hours and work from home)
Discounts on travel insurance, car hire, accommodation and experiences worldwide
Discounted Virgin Australia Lounge membership
Hospitality, retail, technology, beauty services and wellness discounts
Wellness support, including the betterme digital wellbeing platform
A comprehensive Employee Assistance Program, which offers confidential coaching and support from qualified professionals for all aspects of life – physical, mental, social and financial
Dress for Your Day – enjoy the freedom to wear whatever is appropriate for the type of work you do and the day you have ahead of you
Equality rules
We’re all individuals. We love that. That’s why we encourage applications from Indigenous Australians, people with disability, those from diverse cultural backgrounds, our friends in the LGBTQI+ community, and anyone else who wants to join our family.
COVID-19
The safety and security of our people, guests and operations come first. Always. That’s why we’ve put together a comprehensive ‘Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Policy’. In a nutshell, to work with us, you’ll need to comply with our (and the airport’s) rules and regulations. And be fully vaxxed.
Ready to apply?
We’re ready to hear from you.

Company Description
-Be a part of groundbreaking Underground Mining practices and technology, opportunity to conduct and deliver industry leading Studies in the Geological Science.
Anglo American Steelmaking Coal
Steelmaking coal is an essential ingredient in blast-furnace steel manufacture, producing steel used for critical building and infrastructure around the world. In Australia, we operate five steelmaking coal mines in Queensland’s Bowen Basin, and have additional joint venture interests in steelmaking coal and manganese, as well as copper exploration projects underway in North West Queensland and Western Australia.

Job Description
-The Aquila project is an underground hard coking coal mine, which will extend the life of Anglo American’s existing Capcoal underground operations by six years, to 2028. As the largest underground coal miner in Australia, we are leveraging the innovative work already under way at our existing mine sites and scaling the development of new technologies in our operations. The Aquila project is a further demonstration of our commitment to the Australian metallurgical coal business, and the Central Queensland communities where we operate
Reporting to the Technical Services Superintendent, you will provide geological support to the operation to ensure safe and efficient production.
With a zero-harm attitude, you will contribute to developing geological hazard plans while maintaining the geological, geotechnical, borehole, coal quality, gas desorption and hydrogeological databases.
Being an expert in the field, you will plan for exploration, gas compliance drilling, sampling, and other geological related studies.
Your time management skills will allow you to issue permit to mine and associated documentation (including grade plans, fault plans, borehole intersection notices, contour plans and geological hazard plans) in a timely manner.
Taking part in regular underground mapping, you will audit and report to management operations on geological issues, and on occasion assist with initiating and executing mine plan change and authority to mine processes.

Qualifications
-Tertiary qualifications in Geological Sciences or equivalent
At least one year experience in operational mining (either open cut or underground)
Spatial design skills and awareness
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills
Strong analysis, problem solving and attention to detail

Additional Information
-Full-time, permanent position
7/7 roster
FIFO from Brisbane (company-funded)
Relocation assistance and subsidised accommodation
What we Offer
When you join Anglo American, you can expect to enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package. But more than this, you’ll find yourself in an environment where the opportunities for learning and growth are second to none. From technical training to leadership programmes, we bring out the best in our people. There are plenty of opportunities to move onwards and upwards too. We’re a large, successful multinational company – and we’re still growing all the time.
Who we are
We aim to lead the industry by pursuing ever safer and more responsible ways of working, demonstrating integrity, and showing care and respect for people and the planet. That means we are constantly seeking new opportunities to mine and process our products sustainably, using less water, less energy and more precise extraction technologies. As the custodians of coal and other precious natural resources – diamonds (through De Beers), copper, platinum and other precious metals, iron ore and nickel – our extraordinary teams work safely and collaboratively, with the utmost consideration for local communities, our customers and the world at large.

Background checks
Successful candidates will be required to complete background screening which may include a criminal check and validation of qualifications.

Inclusion and Diversity
At Anglo American, we embrace change and promote an inclusive and diverse environment where you can bring your whole self to work, every day. We are adopting new approaches to recruitment, talent development, mentoring, parental leave, and flexible working to further support diversity across our business.

How we are committed to your safety
Nothing is more important to us than ensuring you return home safely after a day’s work. To make that happen, we have the most rigorous safety standards in the industry. Not only that, we’re also continually investing in new technologies – from drones to data analytics – that are helping to make mining safer.
Employee referral
Do you know someone who would fit this role? Employee referrals will be accepted for this job. Refer to your local Referral Guidelines for policy conditions and amounts.
How to apply
To apply for this role, please complete our online application form. You will have the opportunity to upload your CV and other relevant documentation as part of this process.
REF21441G
CLOSING DATE
28 AUGUST 2022
Please note, screening and interviews may take place prior to closing date – applications may also close before this date.
Recruitment Agencies
Anglo American Steelmaking Coal does not accept unsolicited applications from Recruitment Agencies.

Requisition ID: 76121
Job Category: Engineering
Location: Brisbane, Queensland, Australia

With over six decades of business and technical experience in the mining, energy, and infrastructure sectors, we see challenges evolving in every industry. We respond quickly with solutions that are smarter, more efficient, and innovative. We draw upon our 9,000 staff, with experience in over 150 countries, to challenge the status quo and create positive change for our clients, our employees, and the communities we serve.

If it isn't grown, it's mined. Our mining and metals teams help our clients to safely and sustainably mine the minerals and metals used in our everyday lives. Want to play a part of innovating and optimizing the mining life cycle on greenfield and brownfield facilities? Apply today!

Our team in Brisbane is looking to engage a Simulation Engineer to service the Australia-Asia (AUA) region. This role will be based in Brisbane, one of Hatch’s Global Delivery Centre offices.

We are looking for a Simulation Engineer early in their career, with experience in AnyLogic (or similar) modelling of mining, metals, logistics and/or industrial systems and an aptitude and keen interest in Dynamic Simulation and an analytical mind who enjoys developing software and solving complex problems. The successful candidate will be required to analyse complex industrial systems focused on capacity analysis, debottlenecking and optimisation of processes and operations. You will join a growing Dynamic Simulation practice in the AUA region performing simulation studies around the globe for mining, processing, infrastructure, energy and heavy industry projects. You will also become an integral part of a global team responsible for the design, improvement, and implementation of integrated technical, human, and financial solutions through the application of analytical skills, discrete event simulation, and other engineering skills.

As the successful candidate, you will:

Analyse operational and design data
Perform analytical calculations
Develop spreadsheet models
Develop dynamic simulation models predominantly using AnyLogic
Undertake analytical and simulation studies that consider design and operating options to maximise capital returns, reduce operating costs, or improve production output
Compile reports on technical content and findings
Presentations of analysis and findings to project teams, clients and other stakeholders
Work in collaboration with multidisciplinary teams

You bring to the role:

You will hold a Bachelor (or higher) degree in engineering or science, with good results in mathematics and statistics preferable. You will have a demonstrated strong interest in modelling and dynamic simulation including, the development of mathematical and simulation models, along with proven skills with discrete event simulation software, with experience in AnyLogic being advantageous, particularly in mining, metals, logistics and/or industrial systems. Candidates will also have programming skills in at least one object-oriented programming language, for example: VBA, Java, C ++, C #, etc. In addition, you will have strong written, oral interpersonal communication and team work skills.

Why join us?

Work with great people to make a difference
Collaborate on exciting projects to develop innovative solutions
Top employer

What we offer you?

Flexible work environment
Long term career development
Think globally, work locally

As an accredited Employer of Choice for Gender Equality (WGEA) and Equal Opportunity Employer, we are committed to fostering a workforce in each of our locations that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate. Within Australia, this includes supporting and encouraging a flexible workplace and a comprehensive benefit offering. If you have any special needs requirements, please discuss with us and we will do our utmost to accommodate your request.

Consultant – Soil Science
SLR’s One Team Culture and Commitment

At SLR Consulting, we celebrate a ‘One Team Culture’, where bringing together diversity of thought and expression is key to building the best team to deliver excellent results. We strive to create an inclusive workplace where we value different experiences and look to create a culture where everyone belongs. The SLR culture is underpinned by our 5Bs which, in short is to Be safe, Belong, Be trusted, Be yourself and Be Successful.

We know it can be difficult and frustrating applying for roles, wondering if the role is right for you and if your experience is right for SLR. Many people won’t apply for roles unless they feel they tick every box on the checklist. At SLR we look for many different skills and technical competencies and we’re always looking for how new team members can add value to the business and to our culture. If you think this role isn’t quite for you, but you have a desire to work with us, – then we’d still love to hear from you!

SLR Consulting is an international environmental consultancy with a globally recognised reputation for providing high quality tailored services. With offices throughout the Asia Pacific, Europe, North, Central and South America and Africa regions, we are one of a very small number of leading international specialist environmental consultancies. We have committed to being a Climate Neutral Business by 2030 and have a long-term commitment to align with global net zero ambitions.


Key Responsibilities
About the role and what you need to succeed
SLR’s Soil Science team has a proven successful mix of practical industry experience, environmental impact assessment capability, project management skills, and regulatory knowledge. This includes providing valuable baseline information to better assess options for site management. Our focus on waste soil assessment and characterisation, and geochemistry integration into rehabilitation plans, creates a successful holistic view on the approach to land and soil management for clients.

As a member of our Soil Science team, you will have a minimum of three (3) years’ experience working on Soil Science related projects such as agronomical assessments, pasture science, land resource management and assessment, agricultural impact assessment, and soil erosivity assessments.
Reporting to the Technical Discipline Manager, you will be involved in delivering projects in the Soil Science team and be responsible for:
Organising and undertaking field investigations, including contractor supervision and training of junior staff. Field investigations will be undertaken at various sites primarily across Queensland with the opportunity for interstate project work to arise in the future.
Collation, assessment, and interpretation of data obtained from field investigations (undertaken by yourself and others) to meet the needs of our clients and provide innovative solutions to their problems.
Compilation of high-quality technical reports that meet not only the expectations of our clients, but the expectations and requirements of the administering authority.
Developing, facilitating, and enhancing relationships between our internal and external clients and SLR team members
Providing advice and assistance to internal and external clients, team members and Project Managers on projects regarding best principles and practices

To be successful in this role
You will be highly organised with excellent attention to detail and love getting things done to a very high standard. You are self-driven and comfortable with processes, whilst still being an excellent people person with a high level of client service. Ideally you would possess the following:
Appropriate Engineering, Science or other relevant tertiary qualification and demonstrated Soil Science industry experience
An understanding of the Australian Soil Classification
Excellent communication skills and technical report writing
Demonstrated experience managing a range of small to large multidisciplinary projects (preferable)
Excellent interpersonal skills, self-motivated and ability to work effectively within a team and independently
Ability and willingness to undertake fieldwork within Queensland and interstate

Our benefits at SLR include

Our culture is unique where we work together to collaborate on projects to get the best possible outcome for our clients. Whether you’re working in the office, from home or a mix of the two, we recognise that every person is different, and our benefits aim to ensure that we cater for all, including:
Hybrid work model (in-office & from home) - you choose where you work best.
Extra paid purchased leave up to 10 days so you can re-energize, help others, support family, or focus on your own professional development.
Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents throughout their parenting journey which includes 12 weeks primary carer and 4 weeks secondary carer leave.
Learning and development which includes a mapped career progression path, study assistance and up to 3 professional memberships subsidised by SLR.
Employee Assistance Program to support your physical, mental, and social wellbeing.
Global and regional mobility and recruitment referral bonus for both region and global candidates.
Other benefits include regular office social events, service anniversary awards, salary sacrificing (novated car lease) and a corporate uniform shop where you get $80 annually to spend.

We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion. Please note that interviews are conducted with gender diverse interview panels to the best of our ability. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

Unsolicited resumes from recruitment consultants will not be accepted. You must be part of the preferred supplier agreement list which is coordinated through our Talent Acquisition team.


Country
Australia

Office
Brisbane

Job Description
Position Summary
Our Network Security Engineer will interface with our valued clients on projects to develop secure network solutions. The Network and Security Engineer shall participate in Assessments, Audits, Design, and deployment projects in Network, Security and Virtualization.
These Projects will be specific to enabling a connected enterprise / IT-OT convergence / Industry 4.0 by connecting the Industrial Internet of Things.
Potential candidates should have:
‘Hands-on’ experience in Networking / Cybersecurity for a variety of automated manufacturing processes and equipment or process control.
Experience in design and deploying security controls for an Industrial Network. These can include system management hardening, device hardening, end point security, perimeter security, disaster recovery, threat detection and monitoring as examples.
Understanding of NIST 800-82, NERC-CIP, IEC-62443 Standards
Solid technical skills with EtherNet/IP or other Ethernet based networks, specifically around assessment, design and implementation of complex systems.
Strong commercial skills, ability to handle multiple projects, communication skills, ability to diagnose automation problems and interact with teams, clients and vendors.
Familiarity with a variety of security and/or networking concepts, practices, and procedures, to include manufacturing and enterprise network convergence, network protocols, communication optimization, application effects on system performance and human exploitation techniques on the manufacturing network.
Experience in developing and deploying solutions in a virtual environment.
Experience in Network Architecture, PLC, Networking and SCADA design/programming including data extraction and data analysis.
Exposure to PLC programming packages (Rockwell Automation or comparable platforms) is desirable.
Design, implement and support customer’s converged business and manufacturing/industrial systems and user needs in parallel with their overall business strategies.
Write detailed documentation that could include user needs, system specifications, observed issues with remediation recommendations or implementation requirements in order to develop or modify manufacturing infrastructure.
Design, recommend, and implement system security changes.
Design customer secure manufacturing architecture and provides vision, problem anticipation, and problem solving ability to customers.
Minimum Qualifications / skill sets:
Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Computer Science or Information Technology or related technology driven degree with minimum 5 years of work experience. If no degree, 5+ years of experience in Manufacturing Control Systems, Network Engineering, and Industrial Security Controls.
Cisco CCNA Certification. Hands-on experience configuring IT/OT equipment (Cisco ASA, Cisco Switches, Virtual Server Environments, Anti-Virus Software). Previous experience working as part of a large, multi-disciplinary team completing full project life-cycle implementations.
Candidates with Cisco / VMWare / Cybersecurity related certifications will be preferred (CCNP, GICSP, CISSP, VCP)
Travel Requirements - Flexibility for travel 25% - 75% is required and can include both domestic and international trips.
Legal authorization to work in the Australia is required.

Reporting to the Technical Discipline Manager, you will be involved in delivering projects in the Soil Science team and be responsible for:

Collation, assessment, and interpretation of data obtained from field investigations (undertaken by yourself and others) to meet the needs of our clients and provide innovative solutions to their problems.
Compilation of high-quality technical reports that meet not only the expectations of our clients, but the expectations and requirements of the administering authority.
Developing, facilitating, and enhancing relationships between our internal and external clients and SLR team members
Providing advice and assistance to internal and external clients, team members and Project Managers on projects regarding best principles and practices

To be successful in this role
You will be highly organised with excellent attention to detail and love getting things done to a very high standard. You are self-driven and comfortable with processes, whilst still being an excellent people person with a high level of client service. Ideally you would possess the following:
Appropriate Engineering, Science or other relevant tertiary qualification and demonstrated Soil Science industry experience
An understanding of the Australian Soil Classification
Excellent communication skills and technical report writing
Demonstrated experience managing a range of small to large multidisciplinary projects (preferable)
Excellent interpersonal skills, self-motivated and ability to work effectively within a team and independently
Ability and willingness to undertake fieldwork within Queensland and interstate

Our benefits at SLR include

Our culture is unique where we work together to collaborate on projects to get the best possible outcome for our clients. Whether you’re working in the office, from home or a mix of the two, we recognise that every person is different, and our benefits aim to ensure that we cater for all, including:
Hybrid work model (in-office & from home) - you choose where you work best.
Extra paid purchased leave up to 10 days so you can re-energize, help others, support family, or focus on your own professional development.
Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents throughout their parenting journey which includes 12 weeks primary carer and 4 weeks secondary carer leave.
Learning and development which includes a mapped career progression path, study assistance and up to 3 professional memberships subsidised by SLR.
Employee Assistance Program to support your physical, mental, and social wellbeing.
Global and regional mobility and recruitment referral bonus for both region and global candidates.
Other benefits include regular office social events, service anniversary awards, salary sacrificing (novated car lease) and a corporate uniform shop where you get $80 annually to spend.

We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion. Please note that interviews are conducted with gender diverse interview panels to the best of our ability. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

Unsolicited resumes from recruitment consultants will not be accepted. You must be part of the preferred supplier agreement list which is coordinated through our Talent Acquisition team.


Country
Australia

Office
Brisbane

As part of the continued growth of our services in the energy and resources sectors, ERM has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Environmental Approvals Specialist / Environmental Planning Consultant to join our team in Brisbane. We are looking for someone with a keen interest in supporting decarbonization efforts, and helping drive forward the development of large scale renewable energy projects. This is an excellent opportunity for professional consultants looking to advance their career with a global leader.
Responsibilities will include:
Leading and/ or supporting a wide variety of environmental approvals for the renewable energy and infrastructure sectors. Environmental approvals will cover Commonwealth, State and local jurisdictions as applicable.
Collaborating with other ERM national and global practitioners to execute projects. Participate on teams composed of multi-disciplinary professionals from multiple offices around the global ERM organization.
Developing skills including technical skills, project experience, and general consulting and decision-making skills.
Contributing to proposal development, including development of technical scopes and cost estimates in accordance with ERM’s policies and processes.
When required, directing and monitoring project management activities related to projects, including task delegation and direction, subcontractor management, health & safety protocol management, monitoring of commercial performance, quality review of deliverables, and interaction with clients.
Working with other global ERM resources to deepen relationships with ERM key clients to expand ERM’s profile and market share in the global mining as well as future energies' markets (through a combination of excellence in technical delivery and business development support).
Requirements:
Bachelors in environmental planning or science, or related discipline.
3 + years of relevant infrastructure and/or energy industry experience including environmental approvals/ permitting and/or management. Consulting industry experience highly desirable.
Experience with and an understanding of the environmental / planning approvals process applicable to QLD projects, therefore a working knowledge of the Planning Act 2016, Vegetation Management Act 199, Nature Conservation Act 1992 and the Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation Act 1999 and the affiliated relevant regulator guidance.
Experience in managing approvals for infrastructure projects, with experience in the renewables sector desirable.
Strong knowledge of project management and experience working as part of an integrated team.
Critical thinking skills – i.e. able to synthesize large amounts of data into meaningful outcomes.
Excellent report writing, data collation and management/presentation skills.
Motivated to proactively contribute to a team environment, share knowledge, skills and idea.
Who We Are:
As the world’s leading sustainability consulting firm, ERM is uniquely positioned to contribute to the environment and society through the expertise and energy of our employees worldwide. Sustainability is what we do, and is at the heart of both our service offerings and how we operate our business. For our people, our vision means attracting, inspiring, developing and rewarding our people to work with the best clients and on the biggest challenges, thus creating valuable careers. We achieve our vision in a sustainable manner by maintaining and living our ERM values that include Accountability, Caring for our People, Client Focus, Collaboration, Empowerment, and Transparency.
Please submit your resume and brief cover letter.
ERM does not accept recruiting agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, ERM employees or any other company location. ERM is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
ERM is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status or disability status.
Thank you for your interest in ERM.

TERN
HEW 7
Fixed-term position up to June 2023 at our Long Pocket campus
Closing date Tuesday 16 August at 11.00pm AEST (R-15278)
About This Opportunity
TERN is an Australian Government research infrastructure initiative to enhance Australia’s environmental research effort, particularly in the area of changes over time in ecosystems. TERN coordinates a national grid of field observation, sensors and remote sensing, which collectively provide open access data for researchers and other users in Australia and globally. TERN was established in 2009 by a National Collaborative Research Infrastructure Strategy (NCRIS) grant from the Australian Government Department of Education, Skills and Employment (DESE) and receives co-investment from state governments and partner institutions. Through a number of extensions and renewals of its grant, TERN’s project funding is currently in place until June 2023.
Reporting to the Program Lead, TERN Data & Analytics Platform, the Data Engineer is a hands-on role to facilitate the transformation, extraction, publication and distribution of ecosystem science data collected and collated by TERN. As a critical member of the TERN Data & Analytics platform team, the position will design, build and automate onboarding of wide range of terrestrial ecosystem data that can be exposed to researchers and policy makers.
Key responsibilities will include:
Engage with users and data providers to gather requirements to design and develop end-to-end data centric solutions to meet their needs.
Design and develop data assets by integrating data from multiple sources
Transform raw data into services for consumption in upstream application like data analytics and data visualisation tools.
Design and develop reusable automation processes for data on-boarding and migration to improve efficiency using tools such as Apache Airflow.
Design, implement and optimise data infrastructure to support datasets including geospatial, time-series and human observations from various sources;
Work with metadata and data representation and delivery standards;
Develop and maintain spatial databases and data services and make them cloud native;
Work in the cloud infrastructure to develop and host services;
Provide technical advice and support to the ecosystem science community;
Work with stakeholders to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs;
This role is subject to The University’s
Code of Conduct
.
About You
Tertiary qualification in IT, computer science, software engineering, geoinformatics, ecoinformatics or related field with at least 5 years work experience;
Proven experience in large scale data management (ingestion, extraction, processing and exploration) projects
Demonstrated experience in skillsets such as:
Python and/or R programming
Databases and SQL
ETL pipelines and workflows tools (e.g., Airflow)
Linux commands
Cloud technologies (OpenStack is preferred)
Experience building and optimising data pipelines, architectures and datasets;
Demonstrated experience in developing solutions to access large and/or streaming structured and semi-structured datasets for analytics needs.
Experience and expert knowledge in:
Data modelling and querying
Data curation and quality
Data access management
Data Migration tools and techniques
Data integration, visualisation and associated technologies
Data storage and associated technologies and infrastructure
Good understanding of software development lifecycle and agile development methodology.
Demonstrated ability to take ownership of complex problems and provide solutions.
Strong communication and organisational skills.
What We Can Offer
This is a full-time, fixed-term position through to June 2023 at HEW Level 7 based at our Long Pocket campus.
The full-time equivalent base salary will be in the range $90,538 - $98,719 plus super of up to 17%. The total FTE package will be in the range $105,929 - $115,501 per annum.
For further information about UQ’s benefits, please visit
Why Work at UQ
and review
The University of Queensland's Enterprise Bargaining Agreement 2018 - 2021
.


Questions?
To discuss this role please contact Peter Brady (Project Manager)
peter.brady@uq.edu.au
For application queries, please contact
recruitment@uq.edu.au
stating the job reference number in the subject line.

Want to Apply?
All applicants must upload the following documents in order for your application to be considered:
Cover letter addressing the ‘About You’ section
Resume
Please note that you will be asked to add all documents into the one upload box during the application form.
About the Selection Process


To satisfy pre-requisite questions and ensure your application can be considered in full, all candidates must apply via the UQ Careers portal by the job closing deadline or will not be accepted.

Other Information
Work Rights: You must have unrestricted work rights in Australia for the duration of this appointment to apply. Visa sponsorship is not available for this appointment.

We value diversity and inclusion, and actively encourage applications from those who bring diversity to the University. Our
Diversity and Inclusion webpage
contains further information if you require additional support. Accessibility requirements and/or adjustments can be directed to

.

Job Title: Regional Extension Officer - Subtropical Dairy (Sunshine Coast)
Job Descriptions:
About Dairy Australia:
Dairy Australia is the national services body for the Australian dairy industry. Our purpose is to support the profitability and sustainability of dairy farming. We do this by providing services that collectively benefit and advance dairy farm businesses and the industry, including investment in research and innovation, learning and capability development, marketing, policy research, market insights and trade development.
Our Vision and Values:
At Dairy Australia, our vision is simple, to be leaders in shaping a profitable and sustainable dairy industry. Our passionate and talented people share this vision and make an impact each day through their commitment to our values of:
Farmer First - Farmer needs guide our purpose
One Team - We work together to achieve great things
Innovative Thinking - We embrace new ideas and learning as we go
Decisive Action - We make informed decisions and move quickly to implement
About the Role:
To realise our vision, it is essential we provide effective leadership and support to the dairy industry and deliver innovative, well planned and collaborative regional extension and education activities in dairy regions.
Joining our Subtropical Dairy team in this 3 year Fixed-Term contract, you will work closely with regional networks, including dairy advisers and service providers to ensure that dairy farmers, advisers and service providers are well engaged in extension activities and are kept up to date on R, D & E programs and information.
Mentoring from an experienced Regional Extension Officer is available for new to industry applicants to ensure support and guidance is provided to thrive in this role.
Here are some examples of where you will make an impact.
Relationship Management
Develop, maintain and manage key relationships with internal and external stakeholders and expand existing and new delivery networks
Develop and maintain a good understanding of existing and emerging issues within the region and nationally
Engage and collaborate with providers and partners
Regional Delivery
Identify extension opportunities to drive practice change on dairy farms
Plan and coordinate the delivery of programs, projects and events
Develop a detailed knowledge of extension activities for regional delivery
Product and Service Development
Present a regional perspective (including the “voice of the farmer”) to contribute to the development and implementation of initiatives and projects.
Support the development of extension plans and activities to meet regional needs
Our ideal candidate
We believe in equality. We treat everyone with fairness, consideration and respect and welcome applications from candidates from diverse backgrounds.
Recent graduates with a passion for the dairy industry are encouraged to apply as mentoring is available to support you develop your career.
Ideally you will be degree qualified in agriculture, environmental science, veterinary science or a related field or have significant agriculture experience. You will enjoy working as part of a team while also having the capability to work autonomously and be outcome driven.
Just as important is your initiative and enthusiasm for:
Building Relationships: you thrive on interacting with multiple stakeholders, establish rapport easily and impress people with your ability to tailor your communication to their needs
Communicating Information: you convince people, challenge ideas and appropriately articulate information to your audience with strong attention to detail
Showing Resilience: you convey self-confidence, demonstrate composure and resolve conflicts as they arise
Giving Support: you understand people and value individuals, you work well as part of a team
Evaluating Problems: you examine information thoroughly, document facts and can interpret data
About your work life with us
We aim to provide benefits that promote the overall wellbeing of our employees. In joining our team, you will be rewarded with:
Flexible working environment – work from your home office, on the road visiting stakeholders, as well as connecting with your colleagues and stakeholders virtually
Being a key member in our supportive and high performing team of experts in their field
A caring and innovative culture -we are open to each other’s ideas, we love to innovative, we have integrity and are driven to find the best solutions for our employees and stakeholders
Fully maintained vehicle
Salary packaging
If your motivations and skills set lines up to what you’ve read, please “Apply Now”

Edge Stackers is a privately owned investment, trading and technology company.
We utilise a range of quantitative techniques and proprietary algorithmic systems fused with game theory, to identify and exploit domestic and international market inefficiencies.
Our arms-locked-culture, alongside our robust, repeatable and scalable systems, makes Edge Stackers a place outliers fight for a position at. A place where the meritocratic environment motivates, and capitalising on collective intelligence surpasses titles, ego and hierarchy.
99.9% Need Not Apply.
Our search for outlier traders is perpetual as we meticulously scale.
You would be a valued member of the team providing meaningful contribution to the company strategy.
The expectations on you would be high. You would have the advantage of an international eco-system of expert mentoring and support, deep domain intelligence, advanced technology, and resources that would enable you to excel in this fast-paced, dynamic role.
It is expected that you would be a strong performer, with enduring concentration and a resilient threshold to pressure.
You would consistently demonstrate fast and accurate data entry skills and have comfort with numbers.
Those with experience in high-level gaming or poker are encouraged to apply.
Weekend work, loyalty and humility are non-negotiable requirements.
If you would be highly motivated in a meritocratic environment, where capitalising on impressive work rates and collective intelligence surpasses titles, ego, and hierarchy, then we look forward to hearing from you.
If you have a passion for trading, data science, or data engineering, there is no better time to join our expansion and share in the spoils of superior performance, alongside the psychological safety of a 20-year old proven and profitable track record.
Recruitment@edgestackers.com

Full time, Monday to Friday position
Work for a global organisation
Salary range of $70k-$100k, plus 11% Superannuation + Incentive scheme

At Bayer we’re visionaries, driven to solve the world’s toughest challenges and striving for a world where ‘Health for all, Hunger for none’ is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We’re doing it with energy, curiosity and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‘impossible’. There are so many reasons to join us. If you’re hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there’s only one choice.
Where do you want to go?
We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced full time Residues Chemist to join our existing team at our Residues Lab, located at Eight Mile Plains, Brisbane.
You will be responsible for the management of residue studies and conduct high quality analytical procedures, to provide the residue data necessary for the registration of new products, as well as the extension of label claims for existing products in Australia.
Do something that moves you.
Fulfil the GLP (Good Laboratory Practice) role and functions of Study Director and Laboratory Investigator
Draft study plans in conjunction with the Residues Programme Manager and other members of the Regulatory Science team
Oversee field contractors responsible for the field phase of the study
Lead the analytical phase of the study, including analysis of samples, data handling and reporting
Produce GLP compliant study reports
Work in conjunction with other senior staff to supervise and support junior staff and contractors
Manage the development and validation of assigned analytical test methods for new compounds
Manage assigned laboratory and computerised systems
Keep up to date with any developments relating to residues analysis
Does this sound like you?
Minimum of Bachelor degree in Science or Agriculture
Proven experience with registration and extension of products
Experience with LC/MS, HPLC UV/vis and similar instruments
Experience in the development and validation of LC MS/MS methods for residue analysis
Up to date knowledge of Occupational Health & Safety requirements in a laboratory environment
An understanding of laboratory QA systems
Clear and concise report writing skills
Be You @ Bayer
We are committed to creating a culture where people can be their best, in an environment that values inclusion, diversity and flexibility. At Bayer everyone belongs, regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, national origin, citizenship, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, or gender identity. We encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people to apply. We also welcome applicants with diverse educational backgrounds, professional knowledge, personality types, thinking styles and life experiences. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.
Be part of something bigger
At Bayer we support your career. Ready to join our team? Click Apply. For more information about this role and the innovative suite of benefits on offer, get in contact with our Talent Acquisition Team via jobs.anz@bayer.com.
Recruitment agencies please note that this position will be managed via our in-house Talent Acquisition Team. Bayer does not accept any unsolicited resumes.
Application close 14th August 2022

About TAFE Queensland
TAFE Queensland is proud to be the largest and most experienced Vocational Education and Training provider in the State. For more than 140 years, TAFE Queensland has delivered practical and industry-relevant training to provide students with the skills and experience they need to build lifelong careers. We have recently been named the State Winner of the 2021 Large Training Provider of the Year at the prestigious Queensland Training Awards. Our training is delivered to students and apprentices on-site, online, in the workplace, or on-campus to give people the skills they need to enrich their communities, support their industries, and strengthen their local economies.
By working at TAFE Queensland, you can be part of a highly experienced workforce closely connected with their industries and dedicated to delivering best practices and innovative training.
Your Opportunity
The Client Services Librarian provides high quality library and information services and resources to TAFE Queensland students and staff, in accordance with TAFE Queensland policy and Library Network service standards.
This position is in the Client Services team and reports to the Senior Client Services Librarian.
This is a Temporary, Full-Time opportunity, to 9 June 2023 unless otherwise determined.
The position will be based primarily at Toowoomba however you may be required to perform work at other TAFE Queensland campuses.
Key Responsibilities

Contribute to the success of transformation and cultural change through promoting and modelling the established values of Commerciality, Teamwork, Innovation and Accountability.
Lead and coordinate the activities of the region's libraries and learning hubs; including collections management, providing student network computers, copiers and printing, learning spaces, equipment and resources loans and high-quality customer services to assist clients with general enquiries, finding resources, research and assignment queries, wireless and PC access, equipment use and copyright.
Manage local library staff and budget within the parameters of the TAFE Queensland Library Network business plan.
Align the delivery of library services to meet regional needs and compliment the TQ Product Governance model, and ensure that local needs are represented in Library Network plans and goals.
Promote effective use of library resources and services.
Contribute to continuous improvement through monitoring the use of library services and resources, seeking feedback from clients, and coordinating and reporting performance data.
Participate in various Library Network and TAFE Queensland forums and committees as required, and contribute to planning processes.
Participate in the management and implementation of projects as required to ensure the continued development of Library Network Services.
Participate in the delivery of the Library Network programs and other promotional and marketing initiatives to ensure client awareness and usage of services and resources.
How you will be assessed
The ideal applicant will be someone who has the following key capabilities:
*
Demonstrated ability to live the TAFE Queensland values: Innovation, Accountability, Commerciality and Teamwork and to display the initiative, attitude and ability to thrive within a dynamic, challenging and changing environment and effectively manage competing priorities.
Proven experience and high level skills in the application of the full range of professional library and/or information science practice with an understanding of current developments in information technology and telecommunication in the areas of information resources access and management.
High level research, analysis and information and knowledge management skills that support TAFE Queensland's systemic resource management priorities and the management and coordination of library initiatives and programs.
Demonstrated knowledge of copyright legislation and current and developing copyright related issues in the areas of libraries, contemporary education services and crown copyright.
Possess well-developed interpersonal and communication skills including confidential communication, written communication and client liaison skills.
Mandatory Qualifications/Requirements

Possession of an undergraduate degree in Library and Information Studies which allows eligibility for professional membership of the Australian Library and Information Association, in conjunction with at least 4 years' subsequent relevant experience in an academic library or agreed equivalent.
Highly Desirable Requirements

Completion of, or currently enrolled in, higher degree studies in areas of direct relevance to the reference, liaison role – library science, information technology or management and/or a qualification in adult learning.
How to apply
If you're interested in this role, click the 'Apply' button to submit your application via the TAFE Queensland Recruitment Portal. When submitting your application, please ensure you provide the following:

A detailed resume;
A cover letter that outlines your know skills, abilities, knowledge and experience in response to the “How you will be assessed” criteria above (maximum of 2 pages in total; and
The contact details for two referees (one of whom is your current supervisor)
Closing date: 5pm, Monday 8 August 2022.
Job Reference Number: TQ2022-531

For further information, please contact:
Desleigh FisherSenior Client Services LibrarianDesleigh.Fisher@tafe.qld.edu.au0438 200 259This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Australia License.

Coordinate with the software provider
Implement and validate workflows for GMP
Attractive salary packaging & superannuation options
About QIMR Berghofer:
QIMR Berghofer is a statutory body under the Queensland Institute of Medical Research Act (1945). The mission of QIMR Berghofer is to promote better health through impactful medical research. QIMR Berghofer has a vision to lead the way to significant innovation in health outcomes, nationally and globally. We are committed to supporting ground-breaking research discoveries, achieving sustainability and achieving impact, maintaining an internationally recognised Medical Research Institute within the State of Queensland that is the primary focus of Medical Research within the State. We cooperate with, and where possible assist the work of other medical research institutions within the State and globally.
QIMR Berghofer Values:
Excellence and Integrity
Collaboration and Partnership
Respect and Diversity
Accountability
The Institute focuses its research within four key Programs:
Cancer Research
Infection & Inflammation
Mental Health & Neuroscience
Population Health
About the Q-Gen Cell Therapeutics Group:
Q-Gen Cell Therapeutics is a leading GMP manufacturing facility dedicated to the development of GMP cell therapies for use in ground breaking clinical trials.
Role Purpose / Responsibilities:
The key duties include:
Plan and coordinate implementation to ensure project delivery and outcomes are within contract terms and milestones
Manage stakeholder and client involvement, ensuring appropriate change management and communication, including coordination of project steering committees
Develop streamlined, department specific workflows to maximize operational efficiencies
Prepare and maintain a project implementation plan in consultation with Q-Gen leadership team
Complete software validation
Provide technical guidance for computerized systems
Data entry, as required during the migration process
About you:
The right candidate will have the following:
Tertiary qualification in Life Sciences, Engineering or Computer Systems
Demonstrated high level skills and expertise in the delivery IT projects and applying GMP, GAMP and 21 CRF Part 11 principles
Self-motivated, and highly organised; able to meet deadlines and deliver multiple competing priorities in a complex and challenging environment
Excellent verbal, written, presentation and communication skills, including ability to present to technical and non-technical audiences
Remuneration:
Salary range is $107,069 to $114,653 p.a. plus super, plus very attractive salary packaging. This is a full-time appointment for 6 months.
To submit an application: use the APPLY button. All applicants must supply Cover Letter addressing selection criteria and Resume.
For further information: Contact Darron Laing, Q-Gen Operations Manager Darron Laing@qimrberghofer.edu.au
Closing Date: 14 August 2022
What we offer:
Very attractive salary packaging
Bonus superannuation
State of the art facilities
Stimulating work setting focussed on cutting edge medical research
Supportive/collaborative team environment

In the role of Cultural Heritage Officer, you will manage and implement cultural heritage processes and procedures related to the delivery of road and infrastructure works depicted in the Queensland Transport and Roads Investment Program (QTRIP) ensuring projects are not delayed while remaining compliant with state and federal legislation. You will provide high level specialist advice on cultural heritage policy, methodologies and standards both within and external to the department. You will identify sites of cultural heritage significance / project operational risks and lead the management of these risks. A key component of the role will require you to build and strengthen relationships between TMR and registered Aboriginal parties to ensure the risk of delays to delivery of QTRIP projects is minimised.
Accountabilities include,- Provide guidance and cultural heritage management expertise to meet the Department's and the Government's cultural heritage management commitments, particularly in relation to the delivery of the QTRIP works.- Demonstrate an applied understanding of historical and indigenous best practice cultural heritage management, including archaeological site survey and recording techniques to support delivery of the roads program.- Provide a sound level of cultural heritage technical expertise (both Indigenous and historical) and identify options and solutions to support the planning, design, construction and maintenance of transport infrastructure.- Undertake research including archaeological site survey where required and assemble historical data to evaluate authenticity and significance of findings to be used in cultural heritage documentation associated with infrastructure projects.- Influence infrastructure design solutions to meet cultural heritage objectives in line with government objectives and community expectations. - Assist in the management of the scope and direction of cultural heritage projects with consideration of time, cost and broader government expectations to secure timely and optimal outcomes for the community.- Work with and maintain mutually beneficial relationships with all relevant parties to assist with effective management of natural, social and cultural resources.- Manage or assist in the management of external Cultural Heritage related resources including development of terms of reference and project briefs, selection and management of contractors, technical review of risk assessments and recommendations, and oversee the implementation of the recommendations.This role reports to the Manager (Technical Services).The appointee may be eligible for incentives as detailed in the Rural and Remote Area Incentive Scheme (RRAIS) that may include subsidised accommodation, up to 10% salary incentive, subsidised electricity, family education assistance and medical treatment.
Mandatory requirements: - Possession of Bachelor of Archaeology, Anthropology, Social Science, Heritage Management, Heritage Conservation or related discipline.- A current Class 'C' Drivers LicenceHow to apply: - A certified copy of your qualifications, as listed under 'Mandatory requirements'. If your qualification is from an overseas institution, the Australian assessment of qualification equivalence must also be provided. - Your CV or resume (maximum five pages)- A cover letter (maximum two pages) outlining your skills and experience, and your ability to meet the requirements of the role- The name and contact details of at least two referees (at least one referee must have thorough knowledge of your conduct and performance within the previous two years)
Applications to remain current for 12 months
