Job Ad Reference: QLD/434055/22
Closing Date: Tuesday, 9 August 2022This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Australia License.

Date: 29-Jul-2022

Location:
Brisbane, QLD, AU

Department: Consulting

Description:
Make a real-world impact. Work on improving operational efficiencies, driving business growth and shaping future industries through the use of emerging technologies, Cloud, Digital, Data and Applied AI.
Work on large-scale digital transformation projects across Australia. Turn latest innovations into applied AI solutions. Help clients monetize applied AI services and form their Centres of Applied AI Excellence.
Drive digital transformation agenda with Cloud and Data-first approach, help define Data & AI strategy and form a roadmap to get to the desired target state. Establish client relationships and build strong partnerships.
Grow your career with the most innovative company in Australia in the IT consultancy and services space. Top-notch development and leadership programs to grow your career.

Do you want to make a significant impact and contribution to the Australian economy? Do you want to be part of the leading IT Innovation company? If you love working in diverse teams and want to be central to shaping future industries using Cloud, Data & AI, then we’d love to hear from you.

About the team

Our diverse Data & AI team comprises over 500 specialist practitioners across Australia, each of whom are constantly curious and excited about combining their business acumen and technological expertise to create data-centric solutions that help solve complex problems and transform, or reinvent our client’s business.

Our Data & AI teamwork with public and private sector clients helping them to design and implement world leading solutions and capabilities. From solving air and ground transport network issues through our industry-first Optimal Reality digital twin solution, bringing automation capabilities to vaccine rollout programs, to helping our clients move to a sustainable world, we are the partner of choice for our clients and our alliance vendors.

Our relationships with market leading vendors such as AWS, Microsoft, Google, Apple, Snowflake, Salesforce, and Informatica enable our practitioners to be at the forefront of new and emerging capabilities and to deliver our suite of services at scale. We are consistently recognised as leaders in Cloud, Data, Analytics and AI, including in the latest analyst reports.

About the job

As a Director, Applied AI, you will work closely with current and future clients to understand their needs and align on business objectives. You will shape up a winning strategy, a roadmap and a solution and form long-term sustainable partnerships.
You will lead Data, Digital & AI strategy discussions and help build a vision around client business objectives and desired outcomes. You will lead the strategy and associated technology choices for client-specific solutions. You will facilitate discovery workshops, articulate the value proposition, build high-level solution architecture with an associated roadmap and communicate business value to clients.

You will provide throughout leadership and guide project teams through delivering next-generation 360 Data platforms, Data science and applied AI industry solutions from Proof of Value (POV) to operationalization.

You will contribute to team and practice growth through business development, managing and nurturing client relationships and be an integral part of our recruiting, training, and team engagement activities.

You will coach, grow, and inspire your team members to follow leading practices for delivery excellence. You will work closely with our practice and alliance leads to develop and grow the practice. This will include team events, brown bag sessions, webinars, hackathons or tabling new ideas for assets or solutions.

Your career coach will work with you to create a tailored plan that aligns your ambitions with our practice needs, including providing you access to leading training and certification programs and development opportunities.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you.

You are someone with:
At least 10 years in Data & AI space, including senior leadership roles.
At least 5 years with Cloud (Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure or Google Cloud Platform).
At least 5 years of business and strategy development for Digital, Cloud, Data & AI services.
At least 5 years of preparing tailored proposals and delivering statgic presentations to clients.
At least 3 years in large-scale digital transformation projects. Experience in working in close collaboration with clients across various industries.
Experience in identifying new opportunities and coming up with winning solutions.
Consulting experience in providing advice on solving critical business problems using Cloud, Data & AI.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to communicate effectively with clients and project teams.
Knowledge of modern software development methodologies and practices such as Agile, Extreme Programming and SDLC.
Knowledge and practice of methodologies related to data privacy and security.
Love solving complex problems, be up-to-date on the latest technology trends and have a strong desire to learn constantly.
Master’s or PhD degree in computer science, information technology, mathematics, business, statistics or equivalent working experience.

Why Deloitte?

At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

We’re committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we’re leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive.

We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress – check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space.

Job no: 493241
Work type: Permanent (Full-Time)
Location: Milton
Categories: HR & Recruitment
yourtown is a charity with services that support young people to find jobs, learn skills, become great parents and live safer, happier lives.
Our mission is to enable young people, especially those who are marginalised and without voice, to improve their quality of life.
yourtown is undertaking one of the boldest and most ambitious digital and business transformations in Australia which will forever change the way we help children and young people.
About the Role
The People & Culture Data & Insights Lead will be supporting the P&C team by analysing, reporting, and telling data stories in a meaningful and insightful way. This will support our leaders in driving the organisation towards our maturity journey and will be instrumental in the discovery and design of quality people metrics at yourtown. We want to be pro-active and have quality HR metrics that will give us visibility and knowledge of our people data to support our P&C and organisational strategy.
This is a new role for the P&C so you will be pivotal in shaping workforce planning and providing predictive analytics to a team who are enthusiastic to learn. You will need to be comfortable developing metrics from scratch and will have experience pulling data from multiple HR and legacy yourtown systems.
Your day-to-day tasks will include:
Create, develop and maintain a cyclical reporting schedule of P&C metrics
Undertake research and provide advice on best practice ensuring this is communicated with our P&C leaders regularly
Support the organisation to create predictive analysis, establish workforce planning and influence the organization in a constructive and positive way
Work with P&C leaders to provide meaningful data and present back to them in an engaging way
Create data stories that can drive performance improvement and influence decision making
Develop analytical tools and software
Create and support data quality initiatives, governance of accuracy and ongoing integrity of P&C data
Providing support and assistance with all data and reporting matters
About you
We’re looking for candidates with:
Degree level qualifications in a relevant discipline (e.g. Human Resources, Business, Data Science)
3+ years’ experience in a data & analytics position within a P&C/ HR team
High level understanding of People & Culture responsibilities
Proven experience developing reports and using analysis to assist with business decisions
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
Ability to analyse and present data in valid ways to tell powerful stories
Curious and inquisitive attributes to compare and research data
Great attention to detail and organisation skills that can manage multiple priorities
Benefits offered at yourtown:
Access to salary packaging arrangements (boost your take-home pay!)
Flexible hybrid working arrangements (at least 2 days a week working from home)
Free membership to our wellbeing program including apps such as CALM & Centr
Access to our Employee Assistance Program
A supportive workforce with coaching and development opportunities
Private health insurance discounts
Corporate rates local gym access
Diversity and Inclusion peer support groups
With a big agenda, a big brand profile and a compelling mission, and in an organisation small enough (but with great reach!) to make a real difference, this is an opportunity to do something incredible for your career and for children and young people.
yourtown is committed to providing services that protect and keep children, young people and adults at risk free from harm. The appointment of successful applicants will be subject to satisfactory screening for child-related employment including the completion of a National Criminal History Check and retention of a valid Working with Children Check.
yourtown supports vaccination as the best way to keep our people and our communities safe from Covid-19. We require all employees, volunteers, students and contractors to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 as a condition of employment.
Contact: Louisa Gilbert - Talent Acquisition Specialist on lgilbert@yourtown.com.au
In line with yourtown's diverse workplace culture, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.
"In our team we value diversity, inclusivity and people who want to make a difference"
Position Description

Advertised: 29 Jul 2022 E. Australia Standard Time
Applications close:

About the Role
Joining our Data Science team, you will play a key role in developing end-to-end data science & ML solutions that will be applied across the entire business: customer behaviour, finance, responsible gambling, fraud identification and risk pricing.
Through developing and refining these models, the Data Science team help create best in-market products, deliver tailored experiences to our customers and improve the efficiency and margin of the digital business.
The role includes an exciting element of R&D where new and emerging technologies and tools are applied to further extend the business knowledge and understanding of customers and digital wagering markets.
About Us
We’re Entain. Our vision is to be the world leader in sports betting and entertainment. We are creating exciting and trusted experiences for our customers and revolutionising the gaming space as we go.
Combining technology and entertainment to create products that push the boundaries, Entain is home to a global family of more than 25 well-known brands – names such as Ladbrokes Australia, neds, Bookmaker.com.au, betstar, and many more.
Our growth and success have come from driving innovative and market leading betting experiences developed in-house by our exceptional team. With the attitude of a start-up but the support of a significant multi-national company, Entain is quickly positioning itself as an employer of choice.
Key Responsibilities
Develop complex predictive models using advanced statistical and machine learning tools to understand and forecast customer behaviour, business performance, and market condition.
Develop and maintain a detailed understanding of Entain digital wagering products and solutions in order to identify opportunities to improve pricing and targeting models.
Analyse model performance, customer behaviour and market conditions to provide key insights to business stakeholders.
Maintain an understanding of current and emerging trends in quantitative analysis, machine learning and data engineering.
Identify and drive opportunities to apply new approaches or technologies to help build the business.
Present findings to key stakeholders to inform business decisions.
Skills and Experience
Demonstrated commercial experience in a Data Science or similar role.
Strong Python & SQL. Experience with Scala, R, Go, JS/TS is beneficial.
Experience in PowerBI & Dash highly desirable. Experience creating interactive visualisations in other platforms (eg. Spotfire, Tableau) is beneficial.
Knowledge of underlying mathematical foundations of statistics & machine learning.
Experience in MLOps & cloud is highly desirable.
Self-driven with the ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
Experience conveying technical concepts to a non-technical audience.
Why work at Entain?
Entain day's - we work a 9-day fortnight with every second Monday off! No expectation to work longer hours or take a reduction in pay!
Meeting free Wednesday's.
Potential to earn up to 20% bonus on top of your standard salary.
Genuinely flexible work arrangements with remote working and extended business hours to cater for your personal situation!
Did you hear we have free coffee? Our Barista is onsite during business hours!
Learning and development programs - Udemy & Oracle Learn.
Paid Parental Leave.


For more information, please contact us at careers@entaingroup.com.au

Requirements

When your part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you will do important work. Surrounded by collaborative colleagues, you will have the support and opportunities that only a global leader can give you. Our respected, growing organization has an exceptional strategy for the near term and beyond. Take your place on our strong team and help us make significant contributions to the world.

Job Title: Legal Counsel or Contracts Manager -ANZ

Location: Melbourne/Sydney or Brisbane

Reporting To: Director of Legal

How you will make an impact:

This role will be a combination of working from home and the office.

The Legal Counsel, Australia, and New Zealand (ANZ) will assist the ANZ businesses in negotiating and drafting commercial contracts (including terms and conditions of product sales and purchase), service, marketing, distribution, license, development, consulting, government, and OEM agreements.
In addition, the Legal Counsel will be responsible for
Providing legal support to ANZ’s marketing, communications, procurement, and e-commerce functions.
Counselling the ANZ businesses regarding certain compliance matters (including anti-bribery, competition law and data privacy).
Resolving legal and commercial disputes; and
Providing training to the ANZ organisation on a range of matters, including commercial contracts, product liability issues, government contracts, anti-bribery, marketing, and other compliance matters.

Experience with supporting a business in a regulated industry such as medical device manufacturing, pharmaceutical or hospital is desirable but not required.

Key Responsibilities:
Advise on and support commercial contracts, proposals, RFPs/RFQs, distribution contracts, procurement contracts.
Advise on a range of legal, compliance and regulatory matters, including government contracts, marketing, competition law, anti-bribery, fraud and abuse, products liability, data privacy and due diligence.
Support and resolve customer, supplier, and other commercial disputes.
Monitor and help manage legal, compliance and risk, including reviewing policies and procedures, and delivering training programs across the region.
Reviewing marketing collateral, customer communications and proposals, and sensitive corporate communications.
Supporting company secretarial work from time to time, as required; and
Support cross-functional projects and initiatives across the region.

How will you get here?

Education:
Bachelor of law degree and registered to practice law in Australia (unrestricted practising certificate)

Experience:
3-6 years post-qualification experience, with solid commercial contracts drafting and negotiation capabilities
A mix of top-tier and in-house experience strongly preferred
Experience in some of the following legal and compliance areas: government contracts, competition law, marketing, anti-bribery, products liability, and data privacy
Capable of managing large- and small-scale legal matters and projects
Proven negotiation, research, and analytical skills
Ability to apply technical skills in a commercial context to reach solutions
Proactive, self-directed and outcomes driven

What is in it for you?
A competitive salary and performance related bonus structure
Exposure to market leading cutting-edge technologies.
Development opportunities as part of a rapidly growing global organisation
Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science, with revenues of more than $40 billion and approximately 110,000 employees globally. Our mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner, and safer. We help our customers accelerate life sciences research, solve complex analytical challenges, improve patient diagnostics, deliver medicines to market, and increase laboratory productivity. Through our premier brands – Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, and Unity Lab Services – we offer an unmatched combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and comprehensive services.

The primary focus of our Drainage Waterways and Coastal Planning department is to plan, manage and design the region's coastal, stormwater and floodplain management infrastructure, including built and natural form assets, consistent with Council's corporate strategic vision, policies and strategies.
As our Water Quality Officer, you will undertake technical investigations and design for a range of stormwater infrastructure matters particularly relating to stormwater quality infrastructure to meet the needs of the community within the Moreton Bay Regional Council area.
You will undertake planning and design in the field of environmental water quality management, including water quality in urban and rural waterways and waterbodies, water sensitive urban design, bio-retention systems and other SQIDs, and riparian rehabilitation to drive integrated and sustainable outcomes.
You will investigate environmental water quality problems and prepare and present technical reports and recommendations. You will assist in the development and implementation of the site specific and/or region wide, flood and water quality monitoring including overseeing the initial set up of automatic samplers, liaising with contractors, overseeing the maintenance schedule for automatic samplers, sample selection, preparation and storage and data management.
You will prepare and present clear and concise technical reports, letters, and presentations describing the outcomes of coastal planning investigations and liaise with local and state departments and prepare applications for permits and approvals to undertake a range of stormwater & waterway management activities and projects.
In this role you will engage proactively with key stakeholders responding to customer/client requests relating to flood and water quality data and services provided to the community.
About you:
We are seeking someone who has sound knowledge and experience in stormwater quality management and experience in the operation of water sampling infrastructure. You will have skills with regards to spatial analysis; preferably with water quality information datasets. You will have well developed problem-solving skills with the ability to investigate and resolve issues, time management skills and the ability to manage conflicting priorities and meet deadlines.
You will excellent communications skills with the ability to build relationships with a variety of stakeholders both internal and external.
Our Water Quality Infrastructure team is highly technically skilled, collaborative and passionate about achieving high quality results for our community. We are focused on delivering on our corporate values of Service, Teamwork, Integrity, Respect and Sustainability - we are seeking people who resonate with these values.
You will hold a Degree in Civil or Environmental Engineering, Environmental Science, Planning or equivalent experience.
Why join the MBRC Team?
As the third largest local government area in Australia and the fifth fastest growing region, the Moreton Bay Region boasts beautiful beaches and waterways, amazing manufacturing hubs and picturesque hinterland hamlets. Moreton Bay has a strong and connected community that enjoys all the traditional Jinibara, Kabi Kabi and Turrbal country has to offer within our region.
With a diverse workforce of more than 2000 team members dedicated to servicing the needs and enhancing the lifestyle of more than 469,000 residents, each team member has an intrinsic ability to impact our community. Whether you’re a manager or working on the frontline, your role will make a difference - bring your expertise and join our driven team today.
Aside from an opportunity to build a rewarding career within a diverse and growing organisation, we offer a range of team member benefits including:
Flexibility at MBRC depends on the type of work you do but could include options such as work from home, part time, 9-day fortnights and flexible days. Talk to us about what flexibility means to you!
Discounted Health Insurance.
We are proud to offer opportunities to develop your career within a local government organisation and our team members are encouraged to undertake study for career development in their area of employment under our Study, Training & Research Scheme (STARS).
Generous employer and employee super contribution scheme.
Free onsite parking.
Fitness Passport program offering discounted membership for you and your family to selected facilities.
How to Apply
Click on the 'Apply' button below to complete your online application. Please upload your current resume that demonstrates how you meet the requirements of this role. Applicants will need to attach the following documents:
A current resumé or curriculum vitæ
A covering letter or expression of interest (maximum 2 pages) which details your suitability for the role.
- Water Quality Engineer.pdf
Further Information
To obtain further details please contact our Recruitment Team careers@moretonbay.qld.gov.au
For more information about Moreton Bay Regional Council and to stay across what’s happening in our region, follow us on Linked In - Moreton Bay Regional Council Linked In

26 Jul 2022

15 Aug 2022 23:55

Role Details
You’ll immediately be placed in a full-time role at the heart of an agency team and receive a ton of training courtesy of the best practitioners in the industry to help you perform your role.
Made up of three core elements, the Launch Pad program combines real work experience, learning and training sessions, and a group project. These three aspects fit together to give you hands on experience as well as opportunities to learn and practice the theory through exercises.
You’ll also have the opportunity to meet with the top leaders across the group and be part of a cohort of new starters establishing an extensive network across the agencies right from the start.
It’s a unique experience which will fully immerse you in the industry from day one.
As a Launch Pad graduate, you will:
Work with internal team members and external partners and media vendors to deliver results for our clients. That could be in media strategy, digital, content, social media, media investment, data science & analytics, tech development or account services.
Develop your knowledge of media channels and marketing techniques
Work on high profile and well-known Australian and global brand clients
Expand your network, and launch your career.
Use your initiative to support team members and proactively ask where additional assistance can be provided, beyond the day-to-day
Learn to extract insightful data and reports for the team
Skills and Experience
Be an analytical thinker
A willingness to learn and desire to challenge yourself
Best in class attention to detail and accuracy
High levels of energy and a desire to deliver great work
A collaborative approach and team player attitude
Problem solving mentality
Passion! You’re keen to learn and develop your understanding of all things Media!
Have Australian working rights
As part of the role, the benefits that you can expect are:
It’s a full-time permanent role! We’re committed to you from day one, which gives you security.
You’ll get to dive straight into agency life, working within an agency team, directly with our clients. (The pressure is on from day one, but we’re sure you’ll love it!)
We are a global company, and part of the biggest media and communications company in the world. That means the advantages of scale, security, and potential overseas opportunities down the track!
Our clients (although we can’t share who) are powerhouses in their own rights. All the brands you know are on our books!
We care about your learning and it starts from day one. There are workshops, case studies, client visits, business leaders sharing their knowledge, and your chance to pitch an idea to us.
We give you an opportunity to build your network not only within our business, and your new graduate tribe, but across the industry.
We connect you with a buddy to bounce ideas off with and show you the ropes; their main role will be to make sure you learn the best tip & tricks, maximise the best perks, and fill your social calendar!
We’ll help you build your knowledge around the different facets of the industry and set yourself up for the rest of your career!
We’re committed to giving back to others with a range of social and charitable initiatives to get involved in.
Plus, there’s a ton of perks… read on!
Now for the perks
We’ve got loads of training resources, flexible work options, gym & retail discounts, heaps of bonus leave including extra Summer Days and birthdays off!
We’ve designed a super cool and convenient online portal to access and maximise all your benefits and perks in one place - perkSPACE!
Save loads of money on your fave brands, get cashback for yourself or donate to charity
Get discounted private health cover
Browse recipes, sweat it out with free online workouts, and mellow out with guided meditation
Get expert financial wellbeing tips
And so much more!

Permanent, either Full-time or 4 days/week
Work from home or at the office in Toowoomba - your choice
Deliver high level, evidenced-based clinical advice and professional information to people living with a disability
Rewarding environment with loads of opportunities for learning and career growth
Join a fun and supportive team who love what they do
About the role
As our Positive Behaviour Support Practitioner based over Ipswich and Toowoomba, you will deliver high level, evidenced-based clinical advice and professional information to people living with a disability, families, staff & managers. You will work across a centralised management function, supportingthe needs of Multicap's unique and diverse clients.
Through applying evidence-based approaches you will reduce the impact of challenging behaviour across the organisation by also demonstrating an application of your professional discipline within the context of contemporary behaviour support literature.
We will support you and pay for training to become a a board certified Behaviour Analyst.
On a day to day basis you will:
Provide discipline-specific advice and quality assurance to other Multicap Clinical Practice and Behaviour Support team members.
Undertake relevant assessments to identify causal factors of challenging behaviour in order to establish effective strategies and plans that address the behaviour and enhance the quality of life for the individual.
Provide coaching, modelling and support to stakeholders including but not limited to families, support workers, and managers to ensure support relevant parties are competent in implementing support strategies
Implement, capture and analyse data in order to monitor the plan’s effectiveness, review challenging behaviour and make any changes where required.
About you
You will have a positive attitude, enjoy working as part of a high functioning team and be able to work from home:
You will be assessed against the NDIS capability framework as either core or proficient practitioner
Have high-level interpersonal skills and experience supporting people in situations of high emotions
Demonstrate a high level communication skills to develop relationships with team members and stakeholders and deal with issues of a sensitive nature
Demonstrate problem-solving skills to successfully identify problems, develop solutions and implement these using a logical and systematic approach
Hold a current QLD Drivers Licence (mandatory)
Hold a current blue (working with children) and yellow (positive notice card) or be willing to obtain one
Be willing to undertake and pass a criminal history clearance
Be fully vaccinated against COVID-19
Essential requirements
Degree qualified in allied health or social and behavioural sciences
A minimum of 2 years' experience in the discipline of service provision
Well-developed knowledge of person-centred approaches
Experience and knowledge of challenging behaviour and intellectual disability
Demonstrated experience in coordinating the provision of support to persons living with a disability and their families and support networks
Highly desirable
Postgraduate qualifications in allied health or social or behaviour sciences and or professional registration;
Experience working with persons with intellectual disability with high and complex needs
About us
Operating for over 60 years, Multicap is one of the most highly regarded disability service providers in Queensland and northern New South Wales offering individual and group activities, supported employment, short-term accommodation, social support and much more. Our sole purpose is to ensure that the quality of life of people living with disability and their families is enhanced by our support.
Attractive Salary packaging including $15,900 packaging limit year plus $2,550 per year for meals and entertainment expenses.
Apply now! We can't wait to meet you.
To find out more visit www.multicap.org.au

The primary focus of our Drainage Waterways and Coastal Planning department is to plan, manage and design the region's coastal, stormwater and floodplain management infrastructure, including built and natural form assets, consistent with Council's corporate strategic vision, policies and strategies.
As our Water Quality Officer, you will undertake technical investigations and design for a range of stormwater infrastructure matters particularly relating to stormwater quality infrastructure to meet the needs of the community within the Moreton Bay Regional Council area.
You will undertake planning and design in the field of environmental water quality management, including water quality in urban and rural waterways and waterbodies, water sensitive urban design, bio-retention systems and other SQIDs, and riparian rehabilitation to drive integrated and sustainable outcomes.
You will investigate environmental water quality problems and prepare and present technical reports and recommendations. You will assist in the development and implementation of the site specific and/or region wide, flood and water quality monitoring including overseeing the initial set up of automatic samplers, liaising with contractors, overseeing the maintenance schedule for automatic samplers, sample selection, preparation and storage and data management.
You will prepare and present clear and concise technical reports, letters, and presentations describing the outcomes of coastal planning investigations and liaise with local and state departments and prepare applications for permits and approvals to undertake a range of stormwater & waterway management activities and projects.
In this role you will engage proactively with key stakeholders responding to customer/client requests relating to flood and water quality data and services provided to the community.
About you:
We are seeking someone who has sound knowledge and experience in stormwater quality management and experience in the operation of water sampling infrastructure. You will have skills with regards to spatial analysis; preferably with water quality information datasets. You will have well developed problem-solving skills with the ability to investigate and resolve issues, time management skills and the ability to manage conflicting priorities and meet deadlines.
You will excellent communications skills with the ability to build relationships with a variety of stakeholders both internal and external.
Our Water Quality Infrastructure team is highly technically skilled, collaborative and passionate about achieving high quality results for our community. We are focused on delivering on our corporate values of Service, Teamwork, Integrity, Respect and Sustainability - we are seeking people who resonate with these values.
You will hold a Degree in Civil or Environmental Engineering, Environmental Science, Planning or equivalent experience.
Why join the MBRC Team?
As the third largest local government area in Australia and the fifth fastest growing region, the Moreton Bay Region boasts beautiful beaches and waterways, amazing manufacturing hubs and picturesque hinterland hamlets. Moreton Bay has a strong and connected community that enjoys all the traditional Jinibara, Kabi Kabi and Turrbal country has to offer within our region.
With a diverse workforce of more than 2000 team members dedicated to servicing the needs and enhancing the lifestyle of more than 469,000 residents, each team member has an intrinsic ability to impact our community. Whether you’re a manager or working on the frontline, your role will make a difference - bring your expertise and join our driven team today.
Aside from an opportunity to build a rewarding career within a diverse and growing organisation, we offer a range of team member benefits including:
Flexibility at MBRC depends on the type of work you do but could include options such as work from home, part time, 9-day fortnights and flexible days. Talk to us about what flexibility means to you!
Discounted Health Insurance.
We are proud to offer opportunities to develop your career within a local government organisation and our team members are encouraged to undertake study for career development in their area of employment under our Study, Training & Research Scheme (STARS).
Generous employer and employee super contribution scheme.
Free onsite parking.
Fitness Passport program offering discounted membership for you and your family to selected facilities.
How to Apply
Click on the 'Apply' button below to complete your online application. Please upload your current resume that demonstrates how you meet the requirements of this role. Applicants will need to attach the following documents:
A current resumé or curriculum vitæ
A covering letter or expression of interest (maximum 2 pages) which details your suitability for the role.
- Water Quality Engineer.pdf
Further Information
To obtain further details please contact our Recruitment Team careers@moretonbay.qld.gov.au
For more information about Moreton Bay Regional Council and to stay across what’s happening in our region, follow us on Linked In - Moreton Bay Regional Council Linked In

About RedEye!
We provide the first fully cloud-based and purpose-built engineering data management solution for asset owners and their service providers globally.
We work with critical infrastructure organisations across industries such as water, energy, mining, infrastructure, healthcare, government (national parks and wildlife), and defence to improve the safety and productivity of their critical assets, in real time.
What began as an ambitious start-up in Brisbane in 2012 as a way for engineers to manage their engineering information has today evolved into a recognised leader in assets data management delivery, helping our clients manage over $250bn of assets. This is our RedEye story...so far.
Headquartered in Brisbane, we currently have a team of 89 across ANZ, the Philippines and North America.
We are a customer focused organisation, with a commitment to growth and continuous improvement. We are proud of the values we live by every day that shape the success of our team and the experience of our customers:
“I've got your back”
“I get sh*t done”
“We're making a difference”
About the Opportunity
As RedEye's Data Engineer, you will be responsible for migrating, processing, and transforming large amounts of data / files into the RedEye database as part of implementation projects. To be successful in this role, you will need to build a deep understanding of how RedEye's clients provide Engineering and asset data and have strong attention to detail with programming skills (Python, SQL, algorithms and data structures) and advanced Excel. Advanced written and verbal communication skills, providing client reporting and requirements elicitation.
Responsibilities
Data Migration:
Review Client Engineering Drafting Standards and other required artefacts and attendance at Client Engineering Data Migration requirements sessions
Perform data analysis (files and meta data) and creation of documentation of findings (ensure these are in suitable business format for client consumption)
Creation of Client Data Migration plan informing and specification of migration method
Preparation of data for migration including managing any data improvement (e.g., binary duplicates)
Preparation of Migration Manifest, matching files to metadata, assigning workflows and groups to artefacts and reviewing with client
Execute the data migration in RedEye DMS or appropriate system, validate migration
Perform revision consolidation analysis of engineering data and creation of Revision Consolidation Manifest
Complete post migration activities including automated and manual QA review and error analysis
Documentation of migration procedures and their continual development
Documentation of migration scripts and their continual development
Work with Dev/Ops teams to define tools and rules to improve the data migration and management process
Scope and assist to implement data improvement related opportunities with the Customer Operations and Account Management teams
Business Analysis & Technical Configuration:

Support the definition and documentation of business logic such as workflow mapping, and success criteria that supports the solution design
Support the translation of customer requirements into requirements definitions & input into solution design to achieve customer outcomes
Executing upon technical configuration tasks for RedEyeDMS products or environment based on client requirements
Engage with Project Manager and Technical Analyst to clarify solution requirements, answer queries and support UAT for solution development
About You:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Systems or related technical discipline
Post graduate Data Science qualifications highly regarded
Advanced knowledge of BI Power & Python
Working experience of SQL, PowerShell, algorithms and data structures and advanced Excel
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office suite, Teams, SharePoint and experience with Agile productivity tools (i.e., JIRA, Confluence etc) understands what impact variable data quality has on product performance and user experience
Ability to distinguish and communicate the difference between user error and actual system defects and document same
Ability to write clean, well-documented and reusable code and scripts in accordance with secure coding guidelines
Understanding of Agile project management methodology, approaches, tools, and phases of program/project lifecycles
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills enabling you to navigate customer processes and providing technical expertise related to the RedEye products
Excellent attention to detail
Why RedEye?
On top of being a leader in the delivery of assets data management, with a diverse team of talented and supportive professionals we also offer:

A chance to work on impactful greenfield projects, creating critical learning solutions that drive internal capabilities within our teams, and create awesome experiences for our customers
A genuine opportunity to take advantage of flexible working arrangements so you can be at your best both at work and in your personal time (work from home flexibility is the norm here)
A promise to not hold you back with red tape and excessive procedures that are counterproductive (strong emphasis on “I get sh*t done” here)
A commitment to your health and wellbeing, with discounted gym memberships and 2 annual RedEye Recharge Days, so you can take the time you need, just for yourself
Help us empower organisations that empower the world - Apply Now

Wenco International Mining Systems Ltd. (www.wencomine.com), a subsidiary of Hitachi, is a software development and technology company that provides a series of technology product lines related to optimization and improvement of mines and material movers worldwide. Wenco is looking for an Atlassian Expert (Developer & Administrator) to support cross-departmental projects, support the administration of and lead our R&D team through an evolution of our Atlassian tool chain and its integrations. Do you: • enjoy making a positive impact on people's daily work?

get excited about optimizing and/or fixing issues at the intersection of people, technologies and business? • have a passion for the artistry in creating and evolving complex systems that directly impact the success of the organization? If yes then this collaborative, people oriented opportunity is for you. Key Deliverables & Responsibilities: • Information Architecture Facilitate an information management strategy across our Atlassian cloud toolchain (Jira, Jira Service Management, Confluence, Opsgenie, etc) and interfacing systems (SharePoint, Teams, etc) Document, manage and communicate the information data model/architecture Define, implement, and promote standard methodologies for the use of Confluence • Projects Support the business process owners by helping them understand the current Atlassian tools/apps, gather requirements, investigate potential solutions, test/demonstrate selected concept and then implement.
Create visibility of project status for multiple departmental and cross-departmental projects, drawing from data in multiple systems. • Administration & Optimization Configure, manage, and enhance Atlassian tools, including native functionality as well as researching, testing, and implementing marketplace apps and other integrations. Develop interfaces between external tooling and Atlassian Manage and optimize complex Jira / Jira Service Management workflows, automation, screen schemes, permission schemes, and notification schemes. • Product Development Support Support development and delivery teams by creating holistic views of product development activities Work with deployment and delivery teams improve processes and speed of delivery Extending and maintaining Automation framework as code and CI/CD Test management app Experience and Knowledge • A degree/diploma in Computer Science, Systems Engineering, Physics, or equivalent.

At least 3 years leading an Atlassian tool chain in a product development environment • Experience with the following: Implementation and evolving a test management tool in Jira Utilizing REST APIs of Atlassian tools in order to provide improved automation and reporting capabilities Supporting release management processes • Proficient with Python, SQL Nice to Have • At least 3 years of experience as a developer, development manager, release manager, or equivalent in a highly automated software development environment • Confluence cloud blueprint development • Certifications: Jira Administration for Cloud Managing Jira Projects Manager Jira Service Projects • Experience with implementation and evolving a test management tool in Jira and a CI/CD pipeline • Experience supporting a hybrid (Agile/Waterfall) development environment Why Join Wenco? • We provide opportunities for career-growth within a fast-scaling global company • We invest in continuous training and professional development (in-house and external) to learn the latest technologies • We offer flexible remote work arrangements • We offer our employees an attractive profit-sharing plan that provides them with the benefits of their hard work • Refer a friend program – work alongside your mates and receive from $3000 to $5000 (equivalent to Canadian currency) for each successful referral! • We are heavily involved in the community and join various events of non-profit organizations • We pride ourselves on our company culture (over the last 5 years we have scored between 97% and 100% in our employee surveys on Inclusion and Diversity in the workplace • We have free counselling for you and your family via our EAP helpline • We offer much more! Wenco advances the efficiency and safety of the world’s surface mining equipment through our fleet management systems.
We are committed to providing a stable yet exciting work place environment for individual employees to build and grow their career with the company. Wenco is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is not intended as an employment contract. Job descriptions are subject to change, which may not necessarily affect compensation.

Our Mission to be Bold and Impactful
Lead the change
Work with cutting edge technology
Collaborate and engage with senior stakeholders

How you contribute
We are looking for a lead or our Data Systems Group. The group develops platform and desktop solutions focused on solving large scale data management and analysis problems for our customers.

The teams of engineers within the group are experts in their fields, are highly collaborative and are deeply passionate about the technology we develop. We need a group Lead who will assist us in ensuring that a shared vision is maintained across the group to efficiently deliver high quality, impactful products to enrich Emesent's already impressive portfolio.
Here’s what we need
Set the technical strategy across Data Systems group's products in a collaborative fashion with the rest of the business stakeholders and assessing future requirements
Drive the planning and refinement of cross-product, cross-team goals by owning PI objectives in Emesent's SAFE methodology
People Lead across the group, responsible for performance management, coaching and supporting the team leads
Scale the engineering group to meet the growing needs, as defined by resource utilization tools
Create high performing and engaging teams by building trust and providing technical guidance as needed
Work with multiple stakeholders including product owners, product Leads and senior leadership to ensure that the business is in sync with the work from the group
Deliver large cross-team and cross-group projects from concept to realization
Own technical strategy and roadmap for the group and ensure that business goals are met through product delivery
Continuous improvement of engineering teams and processes through root cause analysis and skills/technology gap assessments and recommendations
How you’ll succeed
Proven experience in engineering management and building high performing teams
Experience in managing multiple teams and managing other people Leads
Prior experience in designing, building, and maintaining complex systems. This role will involve collaborating with technical experts to assess the decisions and is not a hands-off role
Experience in continuous improvement processes such as root cause analysis, gap analysis establishing for skill and technology requirements
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and ability to work with diverse set of stakeholders from a diverse set of backgrounds
Experience in evaluating and assessing third party platforms for build-vs-buy decisions and ability to define trade offs involved
A strong customer focus and experience in working with external stakeholders
Degree in engineering, computer science or relevant field
Experience in one or more of: 3D visualization, machine learning, data analysis, enterprise platforms and cloud solutions. (desirable)
Varied experience in working with startups, scale-ups and established businesses (desirable)
The added perks
Get a competitive remuneration package including superannuation.
Participate in our employee share option scheme (Equity).
Work alongside a friendly and passionate team on cutting edge technology! - We know that our success and growth is a result of our motivated and inspiring teams.
Take up our genuine learning and development opportunities.
Settle into our great work environment and facilities.
Chill out and enjoy our loaded kitchen facilities with games, snacks, drinks, fresh fruit and coffee machine provided.
Enjoy the flexibility to work from home a few days of the week and our greatly appreciated meeting free Wednesdays.
Take advantage of our office location in Milton - Enjoy the bustling cafes and tasty food options available!
Join in on our fun work events and activities such as 'Funky shirt Fridays!', 'Coffee Club!' and 'Emesent Radio'.
Take up our paid parental leave.
Work in comfort with a casual dress code.
Utilise our secure bike storage and shower facilities offered on-site.
Take part in our generous employee referral scheme.
Centralised in Brisbane, we offer moving assistance to help you relocate and join our collaborative workplace.
Who Are We? Developing the technology of the future
Emesent has built a reputation as the key leader in automating data collection in challenging environments. Our award-winning technology, Hovermap, utilises innovative hardware, advanced algorithms and machine learning to automate collection and analysis of the physical world. Customers are able to acquire data in GPS-denied environments gaining insights that were not possible before. Our rapidly growing customer base are in the fields of mining, infrastructure and survey & mapping.
Starting from a humble vision in Brisbane, Australia, with deep connections to Australia's globally recognised CSIRO, Emesent has made an emerging name for itself across the Globe and is successfully becoming a world leader in this unique industry of autonomous technology!
At Emesent we pride ourselves on the way our people operate, we embrace diversity and equal opportunity, and are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds.
Our global talents are a cut above the rest who are at the top of their game, thriving in a collaborative environment. The work culture here is inclusive with the perfect balance of delivering results and pushing the boundaries all whilst having a little fun!

Location:
Brisbane, QLD, AU

Department: Risk Advisory

Description:
Job Requisition ID: 24704

Be part of Australia’s largest cohort of Vacationers – meaning you’ll have a community of other students to lean on and learn from
Gain real experience at our clients as part of projects and engagements
Build transferable professional skills and networks as you work with our people and our clients

If you’re fascinated by the role that technology plays in business and love the idea of helping clients manage their current and emerging cyber risks – this is the team for you!

What will you get to do?
Cyber threats are constantly evolving and the security solution landscape is becoming more complex. That’s why our work is more meaningful (and exciting) than ever. Always one step ahead, we support clients with being secure, vigilant and resilient through end-to-end advisory, implementation and managed services. We’re a team of strategists, architects, hackers, and technologists that help clients address cyber threats and have confidence to build smarter, faster and more connected futures. Pretty cool, right?

Your future starts with us.
As a worldwide leader in cyber strategy consulting and cyber intelligence, there are opportunities in 2 main pillars:

Strategy & Governance: We help clients develop their cyber security and data privacy strategies and governance models to support security priorities in an era where cyber is everywhere.
Architecture & Engineering: We work with clients to design and integrate industry leading security solutions across cloud, infrastructure, identity and access management and applications) that proactively defend clients against cyber attacks.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you.
We know that as a student, you may not necessarily have a ton of work experience, and that’s okay! At Deloitte, we see past experience and value your ethic and potential to grow more than anything else. You are also a student who:

Has a true passion for all things tech – currently majoring in IT, Computer Science, Engineering (or Business/Commerce/Law with a tech edge)
Will complete your degree in 2023
Is quick to learn, naturally inquisitive and always up for a challenge
Has excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Works best collaboratively – you thrive when working in a team!
Is proactive in driving your career forward – you might have entered a few hackathons, capture the flag competitions, maybe you have a side hustle or even taught yourself how to code!
Has Australian permanent residency or Australian/New Zealand Citizenship

Why Deloitte?

At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

We’re committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we’re leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive.

We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress – check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space.

APS 6 - $85,833 - $97,454 per annum plus superannuation
Biosecurity Plant Division
Cairns, QLD,Darwin, NT
Manage and undertake delivery of diagnostic functions and technical advice for arthropods of biosecurity concern.
Contribute to meeting the biosecurity challenges of the future.
Work in a motivated team with a wide range of skill sets and backgrounds.

Who we are
Science and Surveillance Group (SSG) is comprised of scientists, operations and support staff responsible for regulatory advice and training, technical input to biosecurity policy, regulation activity in Torres Strait and diverse surveillance and diagnostic services around Australia, including animal and plant health surveillance measures under the Northern Australia Quarantine Strategy.

The Operational Science and Surveillance (OSS) team provides diagnostic services for pests, pathogens and plants/seeds detected in imported goods and associated with conveyances and travellers, as well as National Border Surveillance (NBS) activities within Department of Agriculture, Fisheries and Forestry jurisdictions. The OSS team also provides technical and pest mitigation advice and delivers training to client programs within the Department.

The Job
Under the general direction of the Principal Entomologist, the Senior Entomologist will contribute to scientific services and operational and policy advice through:
operational management and support of Entomologists to ensure effective delivery of diagnostic functions and technical advice in the OSS laboratory
undertaking diagnostics of insects and other invertebrates to a high level
coordinating and providing technical support to the National Operational Science Entomology Network (NOSEN) for a specialist taxonomic group or specialist technical area, as required
preparing specimens for long term preservation in departmental reference collections
providing specialist risk based biosecurity management advice to Biosecurity Officers and other stakeholders as required
contributing to the deployment of quality management and innovative diagnostic technology in the OSS laboratory, including sourcing appropriate literature and diagnostic tools and undertaking auditing and verification
maintaining accurate computer based and manual records, using specimen and print reference databases with a high level of competency, maintaining quality management systems and undertaking associated tasks as required
contributing to the provision of technical advice and reports to OSS client programs and other clients on policy, auditing, inspection, risk management and treatment
participating in pest inspections, surveillance and response activities as required
liaising, negotiating and communicating with government agencies, industry bodies and other stakeholders as necessary
undertaking the development and delivery of training and awareness courses for department staff and other stakeholders
participating in working groups and other network meetings and contributing to the development and review of national policies and procedures
prioritising and managing time to provide efficient and effective services to meet internal and external client expectations, within a regulatory environment
working independently or under limited guidance and with a high level of initiative, integrity and flexibility to lead and support the work practices of the team and the day-to-day operations of the laboratory
providing innovative advice and supporting changes that may affect Operational Science and Surveillance and/or delivery of key outputs to clients
promoting and ensuring compliance with departmental WH&S policies and guidelines, and being alert for and reporting risks regarding WH&S issues.

Please note that this vacancy is being advertised as both an ongoing and non-ongoing position. If an offer of non-ongoing employment is made, the successful applicant would be employed for a period of up to 18 months.

What we are looking for
Knowledge and experience
A significant aspect of this position involves leadership and the operational application of technical knowledge and expertise. The successful candidate will have:
demonstrated and well-developed knowledge of insects, arachnids and/or particular invertebrate pests of biosecurity significance to Australia
practical experience in performing accurate morphology-based identification of invertebrate specimens (additional experience in molecular diagnostics would be advantageous)
knowledge of the Australian biosecurity environment and the application of pest risk mitigation measures
demonstrated experience in managing and motivating a team; undertaking complex tasks; prioritising effort to meet changing operational needs; negotiating the resolution of issues or conflicting points of view; harnessing the skills and knowledge of the team
demonstrated experience in interrogation, analysis and reporting on statistical and diagnostic data utilising workplace information systems.

Skills and capabilities
Highly developed ability to:
harness information and opportunities to support the needs of a diagnostic laboratory, including marshalling professional expertise and contributing own expertise to achieve training, policy and laboratory quality assurance outcomes
perform and coordinate routine diagnostics of invertebrates, including the ability to correctly identify pests of biosecurity significance
conduct advanced diagnostic tests including morphological identifications of problematic or specialist groups and/or molecular assays to confirm species level identification or other information
interpret scientific literature and implement new diagnostic protocols
record data, analyse information, prepare reports and documentation, provide technical input to work instructions, guidelines and requests for operational policy advice
provide impartial and forthright advice with effective and concise communication of relevant information (orally and in writing) to a broad range of audiences, within a regulatory context
build and sustain productive, positive, respectful relationships within a team, and with professionals external to the organisation, including contributing to and facilitating regular, constructive feedback and communication
effectively develop further technical capacity in specific areas where required
think laterally, solve problems and implement innovative solutions to improve existing practices under limited supervision
provide timely and quality science-based risk advice, with initiative, self-motivation and an ability to commit energy and drive to see that goals are achieved in an efficient and timely manner
effectively develop further technical capacity in specific areas where required.

Mandatory qualifications
To be considered for this role applicants must hold tertiary qualifications (Bachelor degree) in agriculture, ecology or a related field that emphasises entomology, with practical experience in morphology-based taxonomy.

The successful applicant must:
hold and maintain a valid Australian motor vehicle drivers licence
note that relocation assistance is subject to negotiation
wear an official uniform supplied by the department, including during field operations (as applicable), in accordance with the department’s uniform policy
wear appropriate protective personal equipment and clothing to comply with departmental Work Health & Safety policies and procedures
note that the physical requirements of the role(s) involve a combination of outdoor, laboratory and office-based work
note that intra and interstate travel is a requirement of the position
note that there may be a requirement to work out of hours (including on weekends and public holidays) to provide out of hours diagnostic support, participate in emergency response and other activities.

Date: 18-Jul-2022

Location:
Brisbane, QLD, AU

Department: Risk Advisory

Description:
Job Requisition ID: 24704

Be part of Australia’s largest cohort of Vacationers – meaning you’ll have a community of other students to lean on and learn from
Gain real experience at our clients as part of projects and engagements
Build transferable professional skills and networks as you work with our people and our clients

If you’re fascinated by the role that technology plays in business and love the idea of helping clients manage their current and emerging cyber risks – this is the team for you!

What will you get to do?
Cyber threats are constantly evolving and the security solution landscape is becoming more complex. That’s why our work is more meaningful (and exciting) than ever. Always one step ahead, we support clients with being secure, vigilant and resilient through end-to-end advisory, implementation and managed services. We’re a team of strategists, architects, hackers, and technologists that help clients address cyber threats and have confidence to build smarter, faster and more connected futures. Pretty cool, right?

Your future starts with us.
As a worldwide leader in cyber strategy consulting and cyber intelligence, there are opportunities in 2 main pillars:

Strategy & Governance: We help clients develop their cyber security and data privacy strategies and governance models to support security priorities in an era where cyber is everywhere.
Architecture & Engineering: We work with clients to design and integrate industry leading security solutions across cloud, infrastructure, identity and access management and applications) that proactively defend clients against cyber attacks.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you.
We know that as a student, you may not necessarily have a ton of work experience, and that’s okay! At Deloitte, we see past experience and value your ethic and potential to grow more than anything else. You are also a student who:

Has a true passion for all things tech – currently majoring in IT, Computer Science, Engineering (or Business/Commerce/Law with a tech edge)
Will complete your degree in 2023
Is quick to learn, naturally inquisitive and always up for a challenge
Has excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Works best collaboratively – you thrive when working in a team!
Is proactive in driving your career forward – you might have entered a few hackathons, capture the flag competitions, maybe you have a side hustle or even taught yourself how to code!
Has Australian permanent residency or Australian/New Zealand Citizenship

Why Deloitte?

At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

We’re committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we’re leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive.

We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress – check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space.

Based at our stunning beachfront location in Coolangatta, with a hybrid work from home opportunity, a role within this reputable organisation and industry, will shape an exciting next step, in your career journey. NRMA Parks and Resorts is a wholly-owned subsidiary of the National Roads and Motoring Association (NRMA) - keeping people moving for 100 years. Our expanding portfolio of owned and managed holiday parks currently features 48 holiday parks and resorts in iconic tourism locations around Australia.
NRMA Parks and Resorts has recently invested in a sophisticated new data platform to assist us on our future journey to provide market leading guest experiences.

The Role:

To support our future growth, we are looking to onboard an experienced data analyst as an integral part of our team, reporting to the General Manager Customer, Marketing and Sales. If successful, you will manage all aspects of our new data platform, including undertaking analysis of customer data to drive key insights to inform our guest experience, membership, marketing campaigns and operational strategy. This is an opportunity to use your skills in data analysis and segmentation to empower our team to deliver exceptional guest experiences.

Key responsibilities include:
Analysis of data sets, identify trends, share insights and make recommendations
Designing effective, user-centered reports, dashboards and visualisations
Assisting with the refinement and measurement of guest lifetime value, segmentation, and propensity model use cases
Measuring media effectiveness
Supporting the revenue team in understanding guest insights and trends
Assisting with data validation analysis and in enhancing our Google Cloud Platform (GCP) implementation
Adopting an agile delivery approach through continuous development of GCP, resulting market segmentation, reports, visualisation, and dashboards
Analysis of web and commercial data sets to identify trends and patterns
Identifying workflow automation opportunities
Preparing and maintaining technical documentation and an up-to-date repository
How Do You Measure Up?
Minimum of 3 years’ experience in a similar role
Experience working in a fast paced, ever-changing environment
Passion and enthusiasm for providing an exceptional customer experience and all things digital
Tertiary qualifications in a relevant field including Computer Science, Engineering, Finance or Economics (desirable)
Knowledge and experience in the travel and tourism industry (desirable)
The Perks!
Friendly hybrid working environment
Discounted NRMA insurances, FREE Premium Roadside Assist, FREE NRMA Blue Membership and other NRMA Benefits
Accommodation discounts with all NRMA Parks and Resorts across Australia


Please Note: All successful positions at NRMA Parks and Resorts will be subject to a mandatory pre-employment screening process

At DES, we have an opportunity for a Senior Environmental Officer to support the Air Quality Monitoring team within Climate, Coastal, Air and Emissions Branch. The Air Quality Monitoring team plays a vital role in monitoring ambient air quality across Queensland to protect human health and wellbeing.

In this role, you'll find:
A purpose and a challenge that matters
This is a rewarding opportunity because you will play a key role in protecting Queensland's air quality . This is also a challenging role because it will require a person with the ability to process, validate, analyse and report on monitoring data; possess technical expertise to support AQM's data management systems; and who is capable of coordinating short-term air monitoring investigation projects. This position is key to successful delivery of outcomes to stakeholders and Queensland communities.

Passionate, positive, down to earth people
Reporting to the Principal Environmental Officer, you will interact with a close-knit team of scientists and technicians. Every staff member in the team knows what they do matters. You will join a team committed to providing high quality baseline monitoring data that can be relied upon to shape government policies to protect Queensland's air environment. There are no weak links in this team!

Diverse, interesting work and experiences
Because the team is relatively small, your day-to-day work will be diverse. Some days will be spent working with technical staff to undertake short-term air quality investigations, while other days will be spent working with data and report writing. You will also have opportunity to contribute to maintaining and enhancing the team's data management, reporting and quality systems.

Opportunities to learn, discover and grow
You'll be supported to grow and refine your expertise and also work with other experts across the Climate, Coastal, Air and Emissions Branch within the Science Division, with the opportunity to build your capability within a supportive culture.

A collaborative, innovative environment
Located in Dutton Park, you will work in a contemporary building, with state-of-the-art facilities, which is easily accessible by both bus and rail. You'll be part of dynamic and creative work environment, supporting creative thinking and respect of team members to deliver on group tasks. At DES, we encourage one another to share our experience so we can all learn, improve and innovate.

You'll need:
Demonstrated knowledge and skills in conducting environmental monitoring programs.
Demonstrated ability to analyse data and process scientific and technical information, including application of data-quality verification methods.
Awareness of and fundamental knowledge in programming languages such as Python and SQL, and an understanding of data management principles working within a Microsoft Windows environment. Experience in the use of R and Microsoft Power Bi software will be highly regarded.
Demonstrated ability to report and present air monitoring and scientific research findings in a succinct and evidence-based manner to team members and external clients.
Demonstrated ability to work effectively and self-sufficiently in a pro-active manner and deliver tasks through to completion within agreed timeframes.
Demonstrated high-level communication and interpersonal skills and a strong ability to build and sustain positive relationships with team members, clients and stakeholders.
Eligibility Requirements Applicants must have the legal right to work in Australia. Applicants must hold a degree or higher qualification in science, environmental science or a similar field.
Applications to remain current for 12 months

Job no: 513006
Brand: Global Land Supply
Work type: Full time
Location: Queensland
Categories: Wholesale & Product, Leisure Travel & Retail, Finance & Strategy, Information & Technology
About the Business
Global Land Supply (GLS) is Flight Centre Travel Group’s global in-house product procurement and consolidation business, servicing a number of Flight Centre’s worldwide selling businesses including Retail, in-country support, Liberty Travel, GoGo Worldwide Vacations and Flight Centre Asia.
About the Opportunity
We are looking for a Finance Business Analyst to join our Finance Systems and Projects team and contribute to the ongoing business improvement and capability enhancement. This is a hands-on role in building and delivering high quality, value adding enhancements as well as enabling, supporting, and leading the business analysts and system analyst for your domain.
This role will suit a business analyst with an accounting background or having worked on accounting projects. You’re not required to be a CA or CPA, but a good understanding of accounting principles is an advantage.
We want someone with a passion for building reliable, scalable solutions with a focus on value to the customer. You will have the opportunity to influence the culture, facilitate solution delivery, work with your team on strategy and execution, build world-class software products and coordinate with other teams across our global Product Management & Engineering teams.
The technologies you are familiar with are less important to us, though having experience on finance systems, in particular Dynamics365 Finance and Operations and travel management software, will be an advantage.
This is an exciting opportunity to be part of our dynamic fast-paced product management and engineering team with a customer-centric focus on what we do. We deliver quality, innovative digital solutions to delight our customers and achieve our strategic priorities.
The role will be based in our South Bank Brisbane office and is office-based, though we do offer flexible working including up to 2 days work from home and flexible start and finish times. This is generally a business hours-based role.
What you will be doing:
Work with key stakeholders and project/cross-project SMEs to elicit requirements, document user stories and user acceptance criteria
Based on the requirements, acquire an understanding of where key functional, integration and systems gaps are by working with key stakeholders, vendors and reviewing existing solution system designs
Translate business requirements and uses cases to develop and deliver integration specification/mapping documents adhering to existing integration design patterns
Modelling business processes and/or workflows where required and identifying opportunities for process improvements
Collaborating with developers, solution architects, business analysts and product owners to recommend applicable system and integration modifications required for enhancements
Identifying issues, risks and benefits of proposed solutions and outlining business impacts to stakeholders and users
Reviewing and providing feedback to functional and technical specification documents for solutions from vendors
Provide technical assistance to troubleshoot and/or identify integration errors
Supporting business transition and helping to establish change
Document test cases and perform system integration testing on the delivered set of changes
What you will need:
Essential
Proven working experience as a Business Analyst for 5+ years
Demonstrated experience in documenting requirements/user stories, epics, use cases and test cases
Ability to get up to speed quickly, to understand existing system capabilities and functionality
Ability to read vendor specifications and perform gap analysis between inbound and outbound payloads with minimal assistance
Ability to work autonomously, effectively prioritise and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment is crucial
A demonstrated ability to solve problems in a complex environment with attention to detail and accuracy
Demonstrated ability to conform to shifting priorities, demands and/or timelines
Experience in working in both a hybrid waterfall and agile delivery methodology will be highly advantageous
Desired
At least 2+ years working in accounting projects
Experience working in the Retail / Travel Industry will be highly regarded
Experience working with financial and booking data will be highly regarded
Bachelor’s in computer science, Information Management, Information Technology or related field will be highly regarded
Experience with Microsoft Dynamics365 Finance & Operations or another enterprise accounting application
Writing user stories using the Gherkin framework
Experience using Azure DevOps for user stories, sprint planning and roadmaps
Bachelor in IT or Computer Science
Certificate IV in System Administration / Azure Fundamentals or Administrator qualification
What’s in it for you?
Award winning Flight Centre employee benefits: https://www.fctgcareers.com/why-work-with-us/benefits-in-each-country/australia
OTE $115 k p.a.
The opportunity to play an integral role in the growth of the business
Ongoing training and development
Career opportunities within a growing global business
Travel discounts on flights, hotels and insurance for you, your family and friends
Thrive in a diverse and inclusive environment
Discounted financial and health services
